listings.position: Senior Software Engineer (DevOps and Process Optimization/Automation)
listings.description:
Working Location: Bangkok, Thailand

This is a full time, permanent role in Bangkok, Thailand. Full relocation and Visa sponsorship provided.

Agoda is looking for a unique kind of software engineers to solve Agoda's unique problem. Those that has zero tolerance for inefficiencies in software development. Who can see beyond the norm and assist Agodians in releasing the best software impossibly fast, while impossibly safe.

The team is directly responsible in leading DevOps culture by example and developing workflow automation at Agoda.

Specifically, our work includes a scalable cluster of docker containers. A whole virtualized environment of Asia’s leading booking site in a laptop. An obliteration of conventional processes and establishing automated tools and systems. A robust event queue to track movement of features from developer commits to production. A scalable automated delivery system to support a growing websites, growing customers and growing number of engineers.

We are looking for individuals who share our vision and values to bring their best in solving these challenges together

Key Traits
  • Willing to learn
  • Zero tolerance for process inefficiency
  • Always look for opportunities to optimize and automate daily workflow
  • See beyond the current norm of operation, then design and implement solutions in stages
  • Great communication skills in building culture for other engineers to do the same


Requirements
  • Proficient in any one programming language (e.g. Golang, Python, JavaScript)
  • Hands-on experience with the whole SDLC: Requirement, Design, Code, Test, Deploy
  • Deep understanding of the computer science and its application
  • Understand VMs, docker containers and their applications
  • Understanding of container orchestration and its challenges (e.g. Kubernetes, Helm)
  • Hands on experiences with Agile practices: XP, Scrum, TDD
  • Business-level English (written and spoken)

Bonuses
  • Experienced in large scale distributed system
  • CI: TeamCity, Jenkins
  • Experience with configuration management: Puppet, Chef, Ansible

VanHack is looking for Senior Developers with 4+ years of experience and ready for a new challenge. The position is for companies in Alberta and they will sponsor your work visa. Are you this person?


 The perfect candidate:


  • Has 4+ years of professional experience with one or more of these technologies: Java; Javascript; Frontend

  • Has problem-solving skills;

  • Has advanced or fluent English;

  • Is willing to relocate to Canada in the next 3 months after the event


It will be considered a plus if the candidate:


  • Already worked at a startup before;

  • Has the ability to work in a team and independently;

  • Has the ability to adapt and learn quickly


We are holding Connect to Tech Calgary - Job Fair with companies interviewing face-to-face the selected candidates. If you have the qualifications above, your chances are really high.


We will be waiting for your application!
Call Fatima:- 9667613527 High demand of Software Engineers, Software Developer and Software testers in Hong Kong and Canada under Long term permanent residency visa program.

Please note this role is based in BANGKOK, Thailand! We provide full relocation packages for you and your family.

About Agoda
  • Agoda is one of the biggest OTAs in Asia and is part of the Booking Holdings Group (NASDAQ: BKNG), the world’s largest online travel business (100B$ Market Cap) with over 2 Million properties listed
  • We have 4000+ employees, 70 nationalities, 40+ offices, and 1000 people in technology
  • Our mobile team consists of 100+ amazing engineers and technology professionals who consistently improve an already world class product. Here is some information about our App…
  • We support 38 languages and 50 currencies
  • We are loved by our users with a rating of 4.6/4.7 and have been awarded the Editor’s Choice in the Google Play store
  • We have over 15,000 unit tests, 900 automated UI tests, and release every week


About The Role

We are looking for significant contributors to our industry leading Android app. You'll be working on a product that’s evolved tremendously to be a market leader and still has lots of room to grow.

You’ll be using many of the most current techniques and patterns to accomplish our goals. Our typical day involves of using advanced architectures, implementing automated testing, and always improving our quality, tools, and efficiency.

Responsibilities
  • Lead development of features, experiments, technical components and systems
  • Lead and mentor other technical team members
  • Learn additional mobile team related software platforms
  • Build top architectures to build top features in Kotlin
  • Major contributor to our Agile and Scrum practices
  • Get involved with full stack engineering and collaborate with server, other client, and infrastructure technical staff to the best solution


Qualifications
  • At least 3 years of experience developing Android applications; 5 years preferred
  • B.S. in Computer Science or quantitative field; M.S. preferred
  • Be a leader, technical architect, mentor, and driver towards the right technology
  • Extremely proficient in one or more mobile platforms (iOS, Android, Web) and at least one programming language (Swift, Objective C, Kotlin, JavaScript, Java, Scala, C#)
  • Extremely proficient in modern mobile and server coding and design practices. For example, MVVM, MVP, SOLID principals, and TDD.
  • Working experience with Agile, Analytics, A/B testing, GIT Flow

If you feel you are the right candidate get in touch! Agoda is full of like-minded people who demand success, reach for it, and succeed!

This job is based in Bangkok and would require you to join our Bangkok office. We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available.

Agoda is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

listings.position: Client side Software Engineer (Based in Bangkok, Thailand ) Relocation provided
listings.description:
A life less ordinary.

We’re not just talking about the location; as Asia’s fastest growing ecommerce hotel booking platform and the biggest pure Tech company in Thailand, you’ll use every last ounce of your Engineering talent at Agoda!

This is a full-time position working on site in our offices in Bangkok. We are hiring both junior and senior developers.

Relocation support and visa sponsorship available for international candidates.

Overview

Agoda is a global online accommodation reservations provider, a technology innovator, and a high-energy company based in the heart of Asia. With a network of over one million accommodation properties, including apartments, villas, homes and hotels backed by over 15 million real traveler reviews, Agoda helps other travelers find and explore new experiences in new destinations. Agoda is part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ:BKNG) - the world leader in online travel and related services.

Technology is not just what we do – it’s at the heart of who we are. We have a dynamic and a flat chain of command of a start-up, yet the capital to make things happen on a global scale. We love innovation and are putting new technologies to work to extend our lead on the competition.
Being a software engineer at Agoda isn’t just about developing software. It’s about being a center piece of the innovation and technical excellence that the rapidly changing field of online travel requires – you will be involved in the design and architecture, coding, testing and operations of our global-scale software systems. And you will be working with some of the smartest people on the planet who come from over 74 countries - It’s an incredible technical creative melting pot.

What We Are Looking For
  • 3+ years with client side frameworks such as React, Angular, VueJS etc
  • Excellent HTML/CSS skills – you understand not only how to build the data, but how to make it look great too.
  • Excellent understanding of object-oriented JavaScript, TypeScript
  • Strong experience in all aspects of client-side performance optimization
  • Deep understanding of http/s protocol, data structures/Json
  • Optional experience with backend languages/frameworks, such as .NET, .NET Core, Java, Scala, NodeJS, Go or Python.
  • You love new technologies and approaches and want to use the best tools available. We want people who can help us continually evolve our stack.
  • You have a good command of the English language.
What Will Be New For You

We are looking for people who truly want to become full-stack engineers. This position is to join our website development team and while your current skills will be strengthening our top-of-the-stack expertise, you will also get your hands into server-side engineering such as implementing your own web-apis and services from http endpoints to data access and microservices.

If you are passionate about expanding your horizon to full-stack engineer as you are passionate about front-end technologies, this job is for you!

What We Can Offer

  • Work for a profitable business with the atmosphere of a fun start-up.
    • Work on interesting problems with a high degree of autonomy.
    • Competitive salary and benefits.
    • Role open to local and international applications – full visa sponsorship and relocate package available.
    We are happy to receive CV's from both international & local applicants as we offer relocation assistance and visa sponsorship for eligible persons.

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Being a software engineer at Agoda isn’t just about developing software. It’s about being a center piece of the innovation and technical excellence that the rapidly changing field of online travel requires – you will be involved in the design and architecture, coding, testing and operations of our global-scale software systems. And you will be working with some of the smartest people on the planet who come from over 74 countries - It’s an incredible technical creative melting pot.


What We Are Looking For
  • 5+ years’ experience developing performance-critical applications that run in a production environment using one of the backend languages/frameworks such as .NET, .NET Core, Java, Scala, NodeJS, Go or Python.
  • Knowledge in one or more of the following: NoSQL technologies (CouchBase, ElasticSearch, Redis), Queueing system experience (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ).
  • Experience in physical architecture at scale, building resilient, no single point of failures, highly available solutions.
  • Understanding of monolithic and micro architectures and know how to get the best out of both.
  • You have RDBMS knowledge (SQL Server, Oracle, MySql or other)
  • Optional knowledge with client-side frameworks such as React, Angular, Vue etc
  • Knowledge in CI/CD solutions would be a plus
  • You love new technologies and approaches and want to use the best tools available. We want people who can help us continually evolve our stack.
  • You have a good command of the English language.
What Will Be New For You

We are looking for people who truly want to become full-stack engineers. This position is to join our website development team. While your current skills will be strengthening our server-side expertise, you will also have hands-on web technologies and frameworks such as ReactJS, Typescript, CSS/Html, client-side performance optimization, etc.

If you are passionate about expanding your horizon to full-stack engineer as you are passionate about server-side, this job is for you!

What We Can Offer
  • Work for a profitable business with the atmosphere of a fun start-up.
  • Work on interesting problems with a high degree of autonomy.
  • Competitive salary and benefits.
  • Role open to local and international applications – full visa sponsorship and relocate package available.
We are happy to receive CV's from both international & local applicants as we offer relocation assistance and visa sponsorship for eligible persons.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

listings.position: Full Stack Software Engineer - Chinese Market (Based in Bangkok, Thailand) Relocation Provided
listings.description:
Full Stack Software Engineer – Chinese Market

Have an amazing adventure!
  • Want an Engineering job where you can make amazing achievements?
  • Want to work in a supportive environment with Engineers from around the World?
  • Want to build product and technology in a fast-growing market like China?
  • Want the chance to improve your international language skills?
If so, Agoda is the place for you! Agoda is an award-winning website and one of the fastest-growing online hotel platforms worldwide; we’re also the biggest pure ‘Tech’ company in Thailand.

Primary language requirements: Mandarin and English. English is the business language spoken in the office. We offer English language lessons, so you can improve your business and technical skills at Agoda!

This exciting opportunity is full-time, permanent based in Bangkok, Thailand. Relocation support and visa sponsorship are available.

Our Engineers describe Agoda as interesting, challenging, fun, friendly and supportive. In short, the kind of environment where you get license and ownership to produce your best work!

This is a full stack role, covering everything from designing interfaces and building back end services and APIs, to configuring build pipelines and deployment systems. We are a data driven company and monitor and track everything we do to get the best outcomes. With high volume use cases, it’s a chance to showcase your software and architectural skills to help revolutionize the online travel space. You will be employing technologies to cover front end development (such as JavaScript, React and CSS), back end development (covering .Net and Java/Scala services with SQL and NoSQL data stores) and everything in between to help us continue evolving our platforms. We are all about performance, scalability, security and wrapping it all in the best user experience our customers can imagine.

You’ll be responsible for the complete scope, design, build and testing of products and features for one of Asia’s fastest growing e-commerce websites, specifically for Chinese market. As a part of the Agoda team, you will be exposed to numerous innovative technologies in the fields of data-processing, big data, efficient data storage structures, recommender systems / machine learning, natural language processing, and many more. Whichever technology we work with, it must operate at the performance needs of a hyper-scale infrastructure operating at thousands of requests per second.

We work from 9am - 6pm most days in the center of Bangkok, not 996, within the offices at Central World complex. The City is very modern, and the Engineering Team has expats from over 70 countries around the World - true Engineering experts. We value your contribution and give you the chance to work on some amazing projects designed to appeal to the consumers who are looking to travel and book their hotels through Agoda.com

About You

We’re looking for exceptional Engineers with an amazing breadth and depth of technology expertise! If you’re the kind of person that looks at the bigger picture and want to build something that has a real impact on the end user Agoda is the place for you.
  • Ability to see the big picture but still love to code!
  • Strong in backend languages, such as C#, Java, or Scala
  • Familiar with client-side frameworks such as React, Angular, Vue etc.
  • Strong HTML/CSS skills – you understand not only how to build the data, but how to make it look great too.
  • Knowledge of architectural design and you like to build something scalable and flexible to support business
  • Agile or Scrum is your favorite development approach. You want autonomy to create a better team.
  • And when we start talking about performance, security, unit testing and automation? Well that’s music to your ears…
  • Excellent written and spoken Chinese language skills
  • Conversational English language skills (written and spoken)
Interested?

Get in touch and apply now

Our client is a US-based technology firm expanding their operations in Canada. They are focused on providing transforming business through large-scale enterprise technology initiatives focused on Health Care and Insurance domains. They offer rapid growth, constant learning, and the immediate chance to make an impact. Along with excellent compensation and great benefits.

 

SUMMARY

 

We're looking for people that have been playing senior design and development roles but seek accelerated opportunities to become solution architects; people with a passion for technology and the desire to learn and grow, architecting and designing enterprise solutions.

  • Participate in architecture definition, product selection, and application design.
  • Play key roles in large projects. Developer. Mentor. Technical Leader. Technical Project Manager.
  • Participate and provide leadership in all phases of a project from discovery and planning through implementation and delivery.
  • Design and develop core business applications for insurance, healthcare and other clients.
  • Wear many hats and gain experience with tools, technologies and platforms across many technology stacks.
  • Work closely and share ideas with fellow Architects and Principals.
  • Learn new things, and grow rapidly from constant exposure to innovative ideas, concepts, and patterns.

QUALIFICATIONS

 

  • Design, develop, and test enterprise class business application and integration solutions using Java/J2EE, C#, .NET, VB, Web Services, and XML
  • Must have a computer science background (degree and/or experience)
  • Experience in P&C, Life, or Health insurance environment preferred, but not required
  • Knowledge of design patterns and the ability to apply them
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Ability to conceptualize and articulate ideas clearly and concisely
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Willingness to travel on an occasional basis
  • Job Location: Farmington Hills, MI USA
  • Must be onside for first 6-12 months; remote options can be explored thereafter
  • Travel is paid for by client (hotel, flights, car rental, etc.)
  • TN Visa Sponsorship is paid for and handled by client

OUR PHILOSOPHIES

  • Agile approach – emphasis on good people, continuous delivery of value, close collaboration with clients
  • Learning and reuse by leveraging patterns and frameworks
  • Small teams focused on full life-cycle from discovery and planning through implementation and launch
  • No technology bias and no affiliations with vendors – we use the technologies and approaches that make sense for our clients
  • Constant learning – adding modern technologies, frameworks, tools and products to our tool belt

WORK ENVIRONMENT AND CULTURE

  • Be surrounded by smart talented people with shared values of continually challenging, investing in, and stretching themselves to new levels
  • Collaborate with seasoned architects to solve problems and to challenge assumptions
  • Work in small teams with opportunities for rapid growth and accelerated responsibilities driven purely by individual performance

Our client is a US-based technology firm expanding their operations in Canada. They are focused on providing transforming business through large-scale enterprise technology initiatives focused on Health Care and Insurance domains. They offer rapid growth, constant learning, and the immediate chance to make an impact. Along with excellent compensation and great benefits.


NOTE:By submitting your resume, you are verifying that you are legally able to work in the U.S. This job requires weekly or bi-weekly travel into the US. Headquartered in MI, USA.


SUMMARY


  • Support multiple Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse projects, including build-out of Dimensional Models (Star / Snowflake Schema).
  • Responsible for performing data analysis activities to capture data requirements clearly, completely, and correctly while, at the same time, representing them in a formal and visual way through data models.
  • Interface with a wide range of customers, ranging from Senior Level Executives to ETL / Reporting Developers.
  • Work through early stages of software lifecycle to profile data and to create conceptual, logical & physical data model designs with appropriate structure and relationships for optimal performance.
  • Work in a fast-paced environment that develops, implements, and maintains mission critical information systems to the Business Intelligence community.
  • Ensure the long term reliability, scalability and maintainability of systems.


QUALIFICATIONS

  • Seeking a self-motivated, technical, results-oriented, and quality-focused individual with strong data warehouse and architecture skills.
  • Provide overall direction, guidance, and definition of an enterprise data architecture that effectively supports Business Intelligence capabilities. The candidate must have extensive knowledge of data architectures related to Data Warehouse implementations (as compared to OLTP).
  • Ability to thrive in a fast paced environment with multiple ongoing projects concurrently.
  • Extensive experience gathering requirements, designing, and developing data warehouses.
  • Experience with SQL Server (Microsoft).
  • Experience with Data Profiling Tools.
  • Experience with Metadata Tools.
  • Experience with providing End User Query Support.
  • Proactive, great attention to detail, results-oriented problem solver.
  • Ability to support long term goals along with immediate performance concerns.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to translate highly complex technical issues to non-technical audience.
  • Excellent communication, mentoring and problem solving skills.
  •  Ensure that the designs are consistent with the overall architecture for Business Intelligence as previously documented.
  • Ensure that significant design decisions are communicated, validated, and adhered to. • Provide rationale for design decisions.
  • Typically requires bachelor's degree (in Computer Science or related field) or equivalent, and 4 or more years of related experience.

Job Location: Mississauga, ON Canada and  MI USA . Must be onsite for first 6-12 months; remote options can be explored thereafter o Travel is paid for by Company (hotel, flights, car rental, etc.) o TN Visa Sponsorship is paid for and handled by Company

  • Extremely proficient in modern mobile and server coding and design practices. For example, VIPER, MVVM, SOLID principals, and TDD.
  • Working experience with Agile, Analytics, A/B testing, GIT Flow

Our client is a US-based technology firm expanding their operations in Canada. They are focused on providing transforming business through large-scale enterprise technology initiatives focused on Health Care and Insurance domains. They offer rapid growth, constant learning, and the immediate chance to make an impact. Along with excellent compensation and great benefits.

 

SUMMARY

We're looking for people that have been playing senior software engineer/technical lead roles but seek accelerated opportunities to become solution architects; people with a passion for technology and the desire to learn and grow, architecting and designing enterprise solutions.

  • Participate in architecture definition, product selection, and application design
  • Play key roles in large projects. Developer. Mentor. Technical Leader. Technical Project Manager
  • Participate and provide leadership in all phases of a project from discovery and planning through implementation and delivery
  • Design and develop core business applications for insurance, healthcare and other clients
  • Wear many hats and gain experience with tools, technologies and platforms across many technology stacks
  • Work closely and share ideas with fellow Architects and Principals
  • Learn new things, and grow rapidly from constant exposure to innovative ideas, concepts, and patterns

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • At least 10 years of hands-on experience architecting, designing and developing web-based enterprise applications
  • P&C, Life or Health insurance experience strongly preferred
  • Knowledge of architecture and design patterns and the ability to apply them
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Ability to conceptualize and articulate ideas clearly and concisely
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Hands-on experience with the J2EE/.NET stack
  • Willingness to travel on an occasional basis
  • Job Location: Farmington Hills, MI USA
  • Must be onside for first 6-12 months; remote options can be explored thereafter
  • Travel is paid for by employer (hotel, flights, car rental, etc.)
  • TN Visa Sponsorship is paid for and handled by employer

 

OUR PHILOSOPHIES

  • Agile approach – emphasis on good people, continuous delivery of value, close collaboration with clients
  • Learning and reuse by leveraging patterns and frameworks
  • Small teams focused on full life-cycle from discovery and planning through implementation and launch
  • No technology bias and no affiliations with vendors – we use the technologies and approaches that make sense for our clients
  • Constant learning – adding modern technologies, frameworks, tools and products to our tool belt

Description

You have probably noticed that technology is appearing more and more in hospitals, doctors' offices and medical clinics. Whether it is advanced MRI machines, or electronic medical records, technology is having a huge impact on the way health services are delivered. Do you want to be involved in this 'MedTech' revolution? [ POSITION DETAILS / JOB TITLE / LEVEL OF SENIORITY ] I am helping one of my long-term clients to hire an experienced software engineer to work on advanced data processing applications related to medical data. In this role, you'd be working in a supportive team of other software engineers and researchers to build MedTech software applications. The office is located in a central area of downtown Vancouver, so you'll be close to shopping, restaurants and transit in a busy and fun area of the city. [ BENEFITS / PERKS / COMPENSATION ] In this role, you will be a full-time employee and receive a competitive base salary, benefits and paid vacation. This company also supports the possibility of remote work within British Columbia, or further afield within Canada. The base salary for this role will be somewhere between $80,000 and $110,000, depending on your level of experience. [ CAREER / LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES? WHY WORK THERE ] The software development team is made up of several experienced software developers, who work closely with the medical research department. The research department generates large amounts of data which the engineering team processes and transforms into meaningful information, which is then used by various medical industry professionals. As a result, the research and development work that you'd be doing has a real impact on people's health and well-being. [ TECH STACK ] In terms of specific technologies, the engineering team uses a variety of tools and programming languages to accomplish their solutions. For example, for data intake applications, they are using GoLang. For data visualization they are using D3 javascript libraries. And for some of their core applications they are using PHP and Postgres database. But needless to say, they want to hire engineers who can build models, research new solutions, and try new technologies. [ HOW TO APPLY / INTERVIEW PROCESS ] The process all starts by getting in contact with me for an initial discussion about the role, including specifics, such as: company name, key hiring managers, and more in-depth job requirements. This is also a great opportunity to talk about your career goals and preferences, and how your goals align with this opportunity -- or even other future opportunities. If there is a suitable match, then I will make an introduction to the client on your behalf, and organize a series of interviews. The hiring process typically takes 1-2 weeks from start-to-finish. My name is Nathan, and I am a Tech Recruiter based in the Vancouver, BC, office of Robert Half Technology (RHT). I have over a decade of recruiting experience, matching software and IT professionals to great job opportunities. My approach to recruitment is consultative and face-to-face, and I am always looking to connect with like-minded tech enthusiasts in the Vancouver area For a more complete discussion of this role, please call me on 604-688-5256 or email me at nathan.wawruck@roberthalf.com. Also, even if you're not quite ready to apply for the role, please add me on LinkedIn to keep in contact for the future (www.linkedin.com/in/wawruck/)

Requirements

[ REQUIREMENTS ] Here are some points that you bring to the table for this role: [-] You have three or more years of experience developing commercial software applications [-] You have experience with open-source programming languages such as Golang, Python, Ruby or PHP [-] You have a passion for researching new tools and technologies [-] Your background in computer science, mathematics, or another applied science is an asset [ VISA / RELOCATION SUPPORT ] [-] Preference will be given to candidates who are currently in Vancouver with proper working permission to work in Canada [-] Remote working / telecommuting may be possible [-] No relocation or VISA sponsorship support will be offered for this role

Technology doesn't change the world. People do.

As a technology staffing firm, we can't think of a more fitting mantra. We're extreme believers in technology and the incredible things it can do. But we know that behind every smart piece of software, every powerful processor, and every brilliant line of code is an even more brilliant person.

Leader among IT staffing agencies

The intersection of technology and people â it's where we live. Backed by more than 65 years of experience, Robert Half Technology is a leader among IT staffing agencies. Whether you're looking to hire experienced technology talent or find the best technology jobs, we are your IT expert to call.

We understand not only the art of matching people, but also the science of technology. We use a proprietary matching tool that helps our staffing professionals connect just the right person to just the right job. And our network of industry connections and strategic partners remains unmatched.

Apply for this job now or contact our branch office at 888-490-4429 to learn more about this position.

All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

listings.position: Full Stack Software Engineer - Chinese Market (Based in Bangkok, Thailand) Relocation Provided
listings.description:
Full Stack Software Engineer – Chinese Market

Have an amazing adventure!
  • Want an Engineering job where you can make amazing achievements?
  • Want to work in a supportive environment with Engineers from around the World?
  • Want to build product and technology in a fast-growing market like China?
  • Want the chance to improve your international language skills?
If so, Agoda is the place for you! Agoda is an award-winning website and one of the fastest-growing online hotel platforms worldwide; we’re also the biggest pure ‘Tech’ company in Thailand.

Primary language requirements: Mandarin and English. English is the business language spoken in the office. We offer English language lessons, so you can improve your business and technical skills at Agoda!

This exciting opportunity is full-time, permanent based in Bangkok, Thailand. Relocation support and visa sponsorship are available.

Our Engineers describe Agoda as interesting, challenging, fun, friendly and supportive. In short, the kind of environment where you get license and ownership to produce your best work!

This is a full stack role, covering everything from designing interfaces and building back end services and APIs, to configuring build pipelines and deployment systems. We are a data driven company and monitor and track everything we do to get the best outcomes. With high volume use cases, it’s a chance to showcase your software and architectural skills to help revolutionize the online travel space. You will be employing technologies to cover front end development (such as JavaScript, React and CSS), back end development (covering .Net and Java/Scala services with SQL and NoSQL data stores) and everything in between to help us continue evolving our platforms. We are all about performance, scalability, security and wrapping it all in the best user experience our customers can imagine.

You’ll be responsible for the complete scope, design, build and testing of products and features for one of Asia’s fastest growing e-commerce websites, specifically for Chinese market. As a part of the Agoda team, you will be exposed to numerous innovative technologies in the fields of data-processing, big data, efficient data storage structures, recommender systems / machine learning, natural language processing, and many more. Whichever technology we work with, it must operate at the performance needs of a hyper-scale infrastructure operating at thousands of requests per second.

We work from 9am - 6pm most days in the center of Bangkok, not 996, within the offices at Central World complex. The City is very modern, and the Engineering Team has expats from over 70 countries around the World - true Engineering experts. We value your contribution and give you the chance to work on some amazing projects designed to appeal to the consumers who are looking to travel and book their hotels through Agoda.com

About You

We’re looking for exceptional Engineers with an amazing breadth and depth of technology expertise! If you’re the kind of person that looks at the bigger picture and want to build something that has a real impact on the end user Agoda is the place for you.
  • Ability to see the big picture but still love to code!
  • Strong in backend languages, such as C#, Java, or Scala
  • Familiar with client-side frameworks such as React, Angular, Vue etc.
  • Strong HTML/CSS skills – you understand not only how to build the data, but how to make it look great too.
  • Knowledge of architectural design and you like to build something scalable and flexible to support business
  • Agile or Scrum is your favorite development approach. You want autonomy to create a better team.
  • And when we start talking about performance, security, unit testing and automation? Well that’s music to your ears…
  • Excellent written and spoken Chinese language skills
  • Conversational English language skills (written and spoken)
Interested?

Get in touch and apply now

4-8 months

  • Developing process documentation and training materials

  • Modifying existing reports at the request of the customer
  • Ensuring the Business Intelligence customer base is adhering to governance standards with Power BI reports and dashboards.

  • Technical writing skills

  • Organizational skills to support team initiatives and keep projects moving

Parkland Fuel Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. listings.company: Job in Santiago de Chile, Región Metropolitana
listings.description:
Santiago de Chile, Región Metropolitana
Somos una empresa joven (3 años) pero consolidada. Nuestro modelo de negocio es un SaaS puro, es decir, somos digitales, y llevamos los bytes en la sangre. Ya tenemos más de 1.800 clientes, y la mejor plataforma del mercado en nuestro rubro (Recursos Humanos, Remuneraciones y Gestión de Personas).
Nos diferenciamos del resto porque realmente creemos que hacer un buen producto y entregar un buen servicio es el camino a seguir, y no sólo buscar estrujar al máximo la rentabilidad y los clientes.
Tenemos una cultura y un equipo humano que se basa en un principio intranzable:
la "no asshole rule". No queremos (y no tenemos!) pasteles ni gente barsa. Con ello, hemos logrado que el equipo, que todos los meses crece (hoy 35), funcione como una familia, y tengamos un nivel de buena onda que se ve a metros de distancia.
Estamos en proceso de expandirnos hacia otros paises, y haciendo crecer nuestra oferta de productos.
  • A Quién Buscamos**:
    • Nos encontramos buscando desarrolladores creativos y eficaces, con conocimientos de Python y Django, capaces de trabajar en equipo, para que nos ayuden en continuar el desarrollo de nuestra plataforma.
    En específico, te unirás en un principio a nuestro equipo de desarrollo contínuo, donde aprenderás como opera nuestra plataforma y cómo mantener en funcionamiento y dando servicio a miles de personas una plataforma SaaS. Inicialmente deberás hacerte cargo de realizar desarrollos pequeños y correcciones, para posteriormente pasar a realizar mejoras mayores. Luego de ello, podrás unirte al equipo de desarrollo de producto. Deberás aprender y utilizar nuestros esquemas de control de ambiente y pasos a producción, escribir y ejecutar pruebas unitarias y, obviamente, escribir código Django, DRF y algo de Vue.
  • Requerimientos del cargo**:Es necesario que cuentes con experiencia demostrable en Django, en proyectos reales. Obviamente, esto implica un buen manejo de Python.
    • Además, debes tener conocimientos de Bootstrap, y ojalá buen gusto para aplicarlo; conocimientos básicos de AI/UX, para que nos ayudes a resolver los problemas en la forma más usable; manejo de Git u otro sistema de control de versiones.
    Ojalá que tengas conocimiento de Docker u otro software de abstracción de plataformas.
    Necesitamos que seas capaz de trabajar en equipo, pues no estarás solo. Es deseable que tengas experiencia previa en desarrollo mediante metodologías ágiles.
    En cuantro a frameworks de FrontEnd, estamos usando Vue, pero no para todo todavía, por lo que hay tiempo para que aprendas. Tenemos un muy buen equipo técnico, por lo que esperamos que aprendas y también enseñes al resto.
    Te prometemos un ambiente de trabajo agradable y profesional, capacidad de crecimiento y de aprender, de la mano de una jefatura técnica experta y presente.
  • Por qué Talana es la mejor empresa en la cual podrías trabajar**:
    • Somos una empresa joven, pero venimos creciendo como chancho. El team es mediano (hoy 7 desarrolladores full stack, tres diseñadores AI/UX y una desarrolladora front), y con una forma de operar completamente horizontal; somos los expertos en el tema, por lo que no hay clientes lateros con los que trabajar.
    Hay mucho espacio para aprender. Tenemos charlas internas del equipo de tecnología una vez a la semana, en las cuales investigamos y exponemos acerca de lo nuevo y lo que la lleva.
    Cuidamos el ambiente de trabajo, por lo que prometemos un entorno agradable. Obviamente, no necesitamos muchas formalidades en la vestimenta. Necesitamos que programes.
    Y lo más importante es que nos importa la cultura de la empresa. Tenemos como objetivo hacer más felices a las personas en sus trabajos, y para eso partir por casa.
  • Opcionales / Deseables**:
    • Ideal si manejas bien Front-End, DevOps y bases de datos.
    Nuestra plataforma es una gran bestia, y necesitamos ayuda en esos puntos.
  • Beneficios**:
  • Programas de bienestar **Talana ofrece o subsidia programas de bienestar mental y/o físico.
  • Ayuda con la reubicación **Si vives en otro país, Talana te ayuda con la mudanza y trámites de visa de trabajo.
  • Horario flexible **Entrada y salida flexibles, libertad para realizar trámites personales o familiares.
  • Espacios para charlas internas **Talana entrega espacio para realizar presentaciones o charlas en horarios de trabajo.
  • Estacionamiento de bicicletas **Hay un lugar privado para estacionar las bicicletas.
  • Cobertura de salud **Talana paga o copaga cobertura de salud adicional a lo legal.
  • Viajes o retiros de empresa **Actividades de integración del equipo fuera del espacio de trabajo.
  • Seguro dental **Talana paga o copaga un seguro dental.
  • Computadora **Talana proporciona una computadora para tu trabajo.
  • Vestimenta informal **Talana no exige ningún código de vestimenta.
  • Áreas recreativas **Espacio para juegos o deportes.
  • Bebidas y snacks **Talana ofrece algunas bebidas y snacks de libre dispo

Somos una empresa joven (3 años) pero consolidada. Nuestro modelo de negocio es un SaaS puro, es decir, somos digitales, y llevamos los bytes en la sangre. Ya tenemos más de 1.800 clientes, y la mejor plataforma del mercado en nuestro rubro (Recursos Humanos, Remuneraciones y Gestión de Personas).

Nos diferenciamos del resto porque realmente creemos que hacer un buen producto y entregar un buen servicio es el camino a seguir, y no sólo buscar estrujar al máximo la rentabilidad y los clientes.

A Quién Buscamos

Nos encontramos buscando desarrolladores creativos y eficaces, con conocimientos de Python y Django, capaces de trabajar en equipo, para que nos ayuden en continuar el desarrollo de nuestra plataforma.

Requerimientos del cargo

Es necesario que cuentes con experiencia demostrable en Django, en proyectos reales. Obviamente, esto implica un buen manejo de Python.

Además, debes tener conocimientos de Bootstrap, y ojalá buen gusto para aplicarlo; conocimientos básicos de AI/UX, para que nos ayudes a resolver los problemas en la forma más usable; manejo de Git u otro sistema de control de versiones.

Hay mucho espacio para aprender. Tenemos charlas internas del equipo de tecnología una vez a la semana, en las cuales investigamos y exponemos acerca de lo nuevo y lo que la lleva.

Cuidamos el ambiente de trabajo, por lo que prometemos un entorno agradable. Obviamente, no necesitamos muchas formalidades en la vestimenta. Necesitamos que programes.

Como empresa, tenemos fruta fresca y snacks saludables dos veces por semana, te aportamos con el almuerzo (vía @deliboo), mesa de pimpón y otras regalías.

Y lo más importante es que nos importa la cultura de la empresa. Tenemos como objetivo hacer más felices a las personas en sus trabajos, y para eso partir por casa.

Luego de ello, podras unirte al equipo de desarrollo de producto. Deberas aprender y utilizar nuestros esquemas de control de ambiente y pasos a produccion, escribir y ejecutar pruebas unitarias y, obviamente, escribir codigo Django, DRF y algo de Vue.Requerimientos del cargo Es necesario que cuentes con experiencia demostrable en Django, en proyectos reales. Obviamente, esto implica un buen manejo de Python.Ademas, debes tener conocimientos de Bootstrap, y ojala buen gusto para aplicarlo; conocimientos basicos de AI/UX, para que nos ayudes a resolver los problemas en la forma mas usable; manejo de Git u otro sistema de control de versiones.Ojala que tengas conocimiento de Docker u otro software de abstraccion de plataformas.Necesitamos que seas capaz de trabajar en equipo, pues no estaras solo. Es deseable que tengas experiencia previa en desarrollo mediante metodologias agiles.En cuantro a frameworks de FrontEnd, estamos usando Vue, pero no para todo todavia, por lo que hay tiempo para que aprendas. Tenemos un muy buen equipo tecnico, por lo que esperamos que aprendas y tambien ensenes al resto.Te prometemos un ambiente de trabajo agradable y profesional, capacidad de crecimiento y de aprender, de la mano de una jefatura tecnica experta y presente.Por que Talana es la mejor empresa en la cual podrias trabajarSomos una empresa joven, pero venimos creciendo como chancho. El team es mediano (hoy 7 desarrolladores full stack, tres disenadores AI/UX y una desarrolladora front), y con una forma de operar completamente horizontal; somos los expertos en el tema, por lo que no hay clientes lateros con los que trabajar.Hay mucho espacio para aprender. Tenemos charlas internas del equipo de tecnologia una vez a la semana, en las cuales investigamos y exponemos acerca de lo nuevo y lo que la lleva.Cuidamos el ambiente de trabajo, por lo que prometemos un entorno agradable. Obviamente, no necesitamos muchas formalidades en la vestimenta. Necesitamos que programes.Como empresa, tenemos fruta fresca y snacks saludables dos veces por semana, te aportamos con el almuerzo (via @deliboo), mesa de pimpon y otras regalias.Y lo mas importante es que nos importa la cultura de la empresa. Tenemos como objetivo hacer mas felices a las personas en sus trabajos, y para eso partir por casa.Opcionales / DeseablesIdeal si manejas bien Front-End, DevOps y bases de datos.

Nuestra plataforma es una gran bestia, y necesitamos ayuda en esos puntos.BeneficiosProgramas de bienestar Talana ofrece o subsidia programas de bienestar mental y/o fisico. Ayuda con la reubicacion Si vives en otro pais, Talana te ayuda con la mudanza y tramites de visa de trabajo. Horario flexible Entrada y salida flexibles, libertad para realizar tramites personales o familiares. Espacios para charlas internas Talana entrega espacio para realizar presentaciones o charlas en horarios de trabajo. Estacionamiento de bicicletas Hay un lugar privado para estacionar las bicicletas. Cobertura de salud Talana paga o copaga cobertura de salud adicional a lo legal. Viajes o retiros de empresa Actividades de integracion del equipo fuera del espacio de trabajo. Seguro dental Talana paga o copaga un seguro dental. Computadora Talana proporciona una computadora para tu trabajo. Vestimenta informal Talana no exige ningun codigo de vestimenta. Areas recreativas Espacio para juegos o deportes. Bebidas y snacks Talana ofrece algunas bebidas y snacks de libre disposicion en la oficina. Dia de cumpleanos libre El dia de tu cumpleanos es canjeable por un dia completo de vacaciones. El anuncio original lo puedes encontrar en Kit Empleo: https://www.kitempleo.cl/empleo/13772053/oih-817-desarrollador-django-santiago/?utm_source=feed-trovit&utm_content=2990283874

Are you a Back-End Software Engineer with a strong knowledge of Java language? Do you want to contribute to the outstanding growth of one of the most successful FinTech companies in Europe? We have an opportunity for you!


We are looking for highly motivated, smart and driven Software Engineers to complement our team in Berlin. As a Java developer here, you will be working on our online banking system together with an international team of top developers from companies including Google and Facebook.

listings.position: Senior Software Engineer (DevOps and Process Optimization/Automation)
listings.description:
Working Location: Bangkok, Thailand

This is a full time, permanent role in Bangkok, Thailand. Full relocation and Visa sponsorship provided.

Agoda is looking for a unique kind of software engineers to solve Agoda's unique problem. Those that has zero tolerance for inefficiencies in software development. Who can see beyond the norm and assist Agodians in releasing the best software impossibly fast, while impossibly safe.

The team is directly responsible in leading DevOps culture by example and developing workflow automation at Agoda.

Specifically, our work includes a scalable cluster of docker containers. A whole virtualized environment of Asia’s leading booking site in a laptop. An obliteration of conventional processes and establishing automated tools and systems. A robust event queue to track movement of features from developer commits to production. A scalable automated delivery system to support a growing websites, growing customers and growing number of engineers.

We are looking for individuals who share our vision and values to bring their best in solving these challenges together

Key Traits
  • Willing to learn
  • Zero tolerance for process inefficiency
  • Always look for opportunities to optimize and automate daily workflow
  • See beyond the current norm of operation, then design and implement solutions in stages
  • Great communication skills in building culture for other engineers to do the same


Requirements
  • Proficient in any one programming language (e.g. Golang, Python, JavaScript)
  • Hands-on experience with the whole SDLC: Requirement, Design, Code, Test, Deploy
  • Deep understanding of the computer science and its application
  • Understand VMs, docker containers and their applications
  • Understanding of container orchestration and its challenges (e.g. Kubernetes, Helm)
  • Hands on experiences with Agile practices: XP, Scrum, TDD
  • Business-level English (written and spoken)

Bonuses
  • Experienced in large scale distributed system
  • CI: TeamCity, Jenkins
  • Experience with configuration management: Puppet, Chef, Ansible

Do you want to join a team of entrepreneurs from over 50 different nationalities? To work in an environment powered by passion where no two days are the same?

At trivago we use the latest innovative technologies to empower our users to find their ideal hotel 100 times a second, across 55 different locales world-wide and in 33 different languages.

As a Software Engineer in the Source team, you'll shape the future of trivago's main product to help our users to find the ideal hotel. You'll join one of our agile engineering teams of smart, motivated and curious people and work on our AWS platform to deliver the best and most relevant data to our millions of users and other trivago teams by utilising modern technologies like Apache Kafka, Kinesis, Redshift, Lambda, Cloudformation and many more.

The Source team in trivago has a mission to be the single source of high quality, factual accommodation data for Hotel Search. This means you'll have an opportunity to work on such challenging topics as collecting data from various sources, matching partner data to trivago inventory, consolidating information into single source of truth and delivering it to our consumers.

Sound interesting? Then we want to hear from you!

Get an inside look into tech at trivago:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aQYEsuGOs-s

What You'll Do
  • Be a part of trivago's Source team and proactively contribute to a product that is used by millions of people each day.
  • Craft and build scalable applications for our data platform on AWS that can handle billions of events, using technologies like Apache Kafka, Redshift, EC2, Lambda, Kinesis and Hadoop.
  • Take ownership and contribute your own ideas on how to bring the best and most relevant data to our users so they can make a profound decision on their next hotel booking.
  • Work closely with stakeholders and other teams to map business requirements into technical solutions that have a real impact.
  • Be an ambassador for cloud technologies, spread the word, and share knowledge among your fellow colleagues in peer exchanges, guild meetings and meet-ups.

What You'll Need
  • 3+ years of experience in (agile) Software Engineering.
  • 2+ years' experience building AWS data pipelines using technologies like Apache Kafka, Kinesis, Lambda, Redshift, DynamoDB, SQS, and S3.
  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or (in case you're self-taught) an outstanding Github profile.
  • Experience in one of more of the following programming languages: Python (preferably), Node.js, Ruby or Java.
  • Experience working with highly scalable systems, preferably in the cloud (hands-on AWS experience would be a big plus).
  • Good knowledge of relational and NoSQL databases.
  • Fluency in English (our company language).

What We'd Love You To Have
  • An AWS certification as a developer or solutions architect.
  • Knowledge/hands-on experience in distributed systems and/or streaming data technologies.
  • A proven track record delivering complex and high-impactful tech products to a large user base.
  • The ability to present complex topics in plain English to non-technical peers and stakeholders.

What You Can Expect From Life At Trivago
  • Growth: We help you grow as trivago grows through support for personal and professional development, constant new challenges, regular peer-feedback, mentorship and world-class training.
  • Autonomy: Every talent has the ability to make an impact independently by driving topics thanks to our strong entrepreneurial mindset, our horizontal workflow and self-determined working hours.
  • International environment: Our agile, international culture and environment with talents from 50+ nations encourages mutual trust and creates a safe space to discuss openly and act freely.
  • Collaborative spaces: Our state-of-the-art campus in Düsseldorf offers interactive spaces where we can easily collaborate, exchange ideas, take a break and workout together.
  • Relocation: We offer our international talents support with relocation costs, work permit and visa questions, free language classes, subsidies for public transport, flat search, company pension and insurance.
  • Tech Culture: A conference budget plus internal workshops, guilds, meet-ups and academies, as well as a MacBook Pro 15", a 30" wide-screen display, an adjustable desk, and a pair of Bose QuietComfort headphones for your time in the zone.

Additional Information
  • trivago N.V. is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users.
  • To find out more about life at trivago follow us on social media @lifeattrivago.
  • To learn more about tech at trivago, check out our blog: https://tech.trivago.com/
  • Want to learn more about trivago's business model to prepare for your interview? Visit https://company.trivago.com/our-product/

Do you want to join a team of entrepreneurs from over 50 different nationalities? To work in an environment powered by passion where no two days are the same?


At trivago we use the latest innovative technologies to empower our users to find their ideal hotel 100 times a second, across 55 different locales world-wide and in 33 different languages.


At trivago's Hotel Search team, our aim is to help travellers to find their ideal hotel or vacation rental. To achieve this, we process, aggregate and deliver vast amounts of data from different sources (online travel agencies, hotel chains and hoteliers) on a daily base to make sure that our users only have the best and most relevant information to make a profound decision on their next booking.




As a DevOps Engineer in Hotel Search, you will support our mission by helping us automate our infrastructure on the AWS platform, using the latest and greatest services and technologies. You will work in both hands-on engineering tasks, but also serve as technical consultant and adviser to several engineering teams to advocate the adoption of best practices in DevOps.




Ready to take the next step in your career? This position will stretch you both professionally and personally. If you think you've got what it takes, read on and apply today!




Get an inside look into tech at trivago:



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aQYEsuGOs-s




What you'll do:


  • Be part of a cross-functional team of software/data engineers, product owners and project managers that directly impacts how millions of travellers find their ideal hotel.

  • As AWS expert, you are actively involved in the ideation and planning of projects and initiatives, both team-level and "big picture".

  • Design and implement scalable CI/CD data pipelines on AWS platform, using infrastructure as a code and technologies like Apache Kafka, Glue, Aurora/RDS, CloudWatch, Lambda, Kinesis, DynamoDB, S3, Redshift, Docker etc.

  • Plan and build modern solutions for access control, security, monitoring and data-backup management in the cloud.

  • Drive innovation and exchange knowledge with teams and peers in your area.




What you'll need:


  • 3+ years of experience as DevOps Engineer, Cloud Architect, or Systems Architect.

  • 2+ years' experience with various AWS services, in-depth knowledge on CloudFormation and serverless architecture on AWS.

  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or (in case you're self-taught) outstanding references and an impressive Github profile.

  • Demonstrable experience in best practices of building monitoring and security on AWS cloud.

  • Good understanding of networking: TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, NAT, VPN, VPCs etc.

  • A passion for delivering high-quality solutions that will improve productivity.

  • At least a minimal understanding of a programming or scripting language (preferably Python).

  • You speak English (our company language) fluently.




What we'd love you to have:


  • You are and AWS certified Developer, DevOps Engineer or Solutions Architect.

  • You have knowledge/hands-on experience in distributed systems, ETL, big data analytics or streaming data technologies.

  • You have a proven track record delivering complex and high-impactful tech products to a large user base.

  • You are a skilful communicator, who can positively influence the people and teams they are working with in adopting DevOps best practices.




What you can expect from life at trivago:


  • Growth: We help you grow as trivago grows through support for personal and professional development, constant new challenges, regular peer-feedback, mentorship and world-class training.
  • Autonomy: Every talent has the ability to make an impact independently by driving topics thanks to our strong entrepreneurial mindset, our horizontal workflow and self-determined working hours.
  • International environment: Our agile, international culture and environment with talents from 50+ nations encourages mutual trust and creates a safe space to discuss openly and act freely.
  • Collaborative spaces: Our state-of-the-art campus in Düsseldorf offers interactive spaces where we can easily collaborate, exchange ideas, take a break and workout together.
  • Relocation: We offer our international talents support with relocation costs, work permit and visa questions, free language classes, flat search and insurance.




Additional information:


  • trivago N.V. is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users.

  • To find out more about life at trivago follow us on social media @lifeattrivago.

  • Want to learn more about trivago's business model to prepare for your interview? Visit https://company.trivago.com/our-product/.

  • To learn more about tech at trivago, check out our blog: https://tech.trivago.com/

At Landing.Partner DE (Full-time), in Berlin, Germany Salary: €65.000 - €75.000 Expires at: 2019-12-13 Our wolfpack has one clear mission: To ensure that our costumers have acces to the highest quality digital tools, suited to their needs. We guide our customers through the maze of crafting digital products and services from ideation to execution. By combining smart ways of working, human-centered design and high-quality code, we build future-proof services together with our customers. By challenging ourselves and the current thinking, we aim to make the world work better and easier applying the latest technologies and smarter ways of working. Role description & responsibilities
  • You work in close collaboration with our pack of colleagues and customers to build new systems and push existing ones to new levels.
  • While working with the customers, for you it is not only about writing top quality code, but also about continuously improving the development process and the way of working the smart way.
  • You enjoy the freedom in your work, e.g. selecting the technologies and methods you use, pushing the team to work even smarter, and guiding your career based on your interests. Main requirements
  • We expect you to have a proven track-record of at least 5 years spent delivering top-notch software
  • To be successful in that, you know your way with modern technologies and methods, keeping up-to-date is natural to you.
  • You are proficient in at least one of our favorite languages/libraries: JS (nodeJS), Clojure, Elixir or Ruby
  • It doesn't matter where and how you have gained your skills and experience, but that you are hungry to apply them and even more hungry to keep learning more.
  • You have your own strongest suit (let it be React or Clojure, or anything else like AI, Scrum Mastering, Rust, Fortran?), combined with solid foundation of skills throughout the stack. Nice to have
  • You are based in Berlin
  • You have extensive experience in Software Architecture and it's best practices Perks
  • A great community of developers, all keen to not only work with you, but also get to know you as a person and help you develop professionally as well as personally
  • A cool Berlin office with all the "necessities", a playstation, a brand new macbook and more
  • Full support during your visa process, registration in Germany, etc.

At ABOUT YOU (Full-time), in Hamburg, Germany Expires at: 2019-11-12 We are looking for (Senior) Backend PHP Developers to join one of our Tech Teams at ABOUT YOU. Our Tech Department is the heart of ABOUT YOU, driven by the passion to develop the best infrastructure & applications. You will work on high-scalable products on a cloud-based infrastructure and collaborate with developers who constantly challenge themselves to raise the bar of what is "state of the art" technology. Leap to the next level in your career and shape the online shopping experience of millions of customers by building the best shop infrastructure. What you will do
  • Work on high-scalable products with PHP7 hosted on a cloud-based infrastructure
  • Build and provide internal & external RESTful APIs that ensure a fast & frictionless updating of our backend products
  • Develop multiple backend platforms ranging from high throughput to maximum faultlessness
  • Constantly challenge and expand your knowledge of reliable software architecture, programming and new technologies

  • Deep technical understanding of RESTful API's
  • Solid background in building scalable distributed products and practical experience with Caching
  • Previous experience with handling & querying relational databases (e.g. MySQL, MariaDB or PostgreSQL)
  • Passionate about writing well-structured, efficient and maintainable code, actively keeping the quality of the code base in check
  • Comfortable working in an English-speaking & agile environment Perks
  • Grow together with one of the fastest growing eCommerce companies in Europe
  • Flexible working times

Senior Java Developer

 

This established company is disrupting its marketing in the IoT space. They have had huge success since their inception in and have grown into an international and market leading IoT company.

 

They are currently looking for Senior Java Developers and Mid Level Java Developers to join the international, cutting edge and innovative team in Berlin.

 

Renown for flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes. Every member of this international team is given the opportunity to put forward new ideas and to make a difference to the company’s development and ongoing success.

 

Working with cutting edge technologies and processes. Be a part of something amazing and apply today!

listings.position: Senior Software Engineer (DevOps and Process Optimization/Automation)
listings.description:
Working Location: Bangkok, Thailand

This is a full time, permanent role in Bangkok, Thailand. Full relocation and Visa sponsorship provided.

Agoda is looking for a unique kind of software engineers to solve Agoda's unique problem. Those that has zero tolerance for inefficiencies in software development. Who can see beyond the norm and assist Agodians in releasing the best software impossibly fast, while impossibly safe.

The team is directly responsible in leading DevOps culture by example and developing workflow automation at Agoda.

Specifically, our work includes a scalable cluster of docker containers. A whole virtualized environment of Asia’s leading booking site in a laptop. An obliteration of conventional processes and establishing automated tools and systems. A robust event queue to track movement of features from developer commits to production. A scalable automated delivery system to support a growing websites, growing customers and growing number of engineers.

We are looking for individuals who share our vision and values to bring their best in solving these challenges together

Key Traits
  • Willing to learn
  • Zero tolerance for process inefficiency
  • Always look for opportunities to optimize and automate daily workflow
  • See beyond the current norm of operation, then design and implement solutions in stages
  • Great communication skills in building culture for other engineers to do the same


Requirements
  • Proficient in any one programming language (e.g. Golang, Python, JavaScript)
  • Hands-on experience with the whole SDLC: Requirement, Design, Code, Test, Deploy
  • Deep understanding of the computer science and its application
  • Understand VMs, docker containers and their applications
  • Understanding of container orchestration and its challenges (e.g. Kubernetes, Helm)
  • Hands on experiences with Agile practices: XP, Scrum, TDD
  • Business-level English (written and spoken)

Bonuses
  • Experienced in large scale distributed system
  • CI: TeamCity, Jenkins
  • Experience with configuration management: Puppet, Chef, Ansible
