Delivery Hero is building the next generation of online food-delivery platforms around the world. We are truly an international organization, with teams in over 40 countries and 80+ nationalities represented in our Berlin office alone.


Not only do we want to bring quality food to customers around the world, we also want to redefine food delivery to include the very best meals from beloved local restaurants. We are looking for a Backend Engineer with experience in Golang (f/m/d) to join our Consumer team to create an easy and personalised ordering experience for our customers. If you’re a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.
  • Coaching and mentoring team members.
  • Take part in architectural decision making.
  • Understanding development lifecycle and collaborate with cross-functional and international agile teams.


Required technical qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or an equivalent education or practical experience.
  • Extensive experience in general purpose programming language.
  • Experience working with distributed and parallel systems and web applications.
  • Practical experience with Design Patterns, Design Principles, Software Architecture and Algorithms and automated tests (unit, integration and functional).
  • Very good communication skills in English, both written and spoken.


Preferred technical qualifications

Extensive experience with:

  • Golang
  • Design Driven Development.
  • Hexagonal Architecture.
  • S.O.L.I.D principles.
  • Event-driven architecture.
  • Good knowledge of relational databases (You should be aware of normal forms, ACID, isolation levels, index anatomy).


Other requirements

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced software release environment.
  • Flexible and open-minded personality.
  • Comfortable working in a multi-cultural environment.


Our stack consists of

  • Microservice architecture.
  • Redis, Elasticsearch, SQL and key-value storage, AMQP.
  • Cloud-based infrastructure following 12 factors using Kubernetes/Docker.
  • Go and PHP as main languages.


Our toppings:

  • English is our working language, but our colleagues at Delivery Hero come from every corner of the globe providing an incredibly diverse, international working atmosphere with cross-cultural teams

  • A modern, recently refurbished office in the heart of Berlin with several kitchens (fresh fruits, coffee, drinks…), kickers, table tennis...

  • Great career opportunities following our development career plan

  • Being part of a global family under the Delivery Hero umbrella (>300 developers working in the headquarters)

  • Moving can be stressful so to help you settle in we provide a relocation package including visa help, temporary accommodation and a budget to applicants from abroad.

  • Sprichst du kein Deutsch? No worries, we provide German classes for those expats who want to expedite their integration

  • We know that experience at the office with interesting and diverse problems, colleagues and technologies isn’t the only way to learn, so our employees get an education budget to attend conferences or trainings locally or around Europe to satisfy their pursuit of knowledge

  • Every Friday we have a team event where you can grab a beer and relax with colleagues


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and representation is key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or any other aspect that makes you, you.


Up for a challenge? Apply now!

Delivery Hero is building the next generation of online food-delivery platforms around the world. We’re truly an international organization, with teams in over 40 countries and 80+ nationalities represented in our Berlin office alone.
Within this environment Global Contact Center is a central function supporting DeliveryHero’s contact centers (or customer services) throughout the world. We provide them expertise, data and technology to operate in the most efficient way.Global Contact Center is currently looking at moving away from 3rd party technology and investing into building our own stack (automation solution, live chat tool, workforce management product…)
We are therefore looking for a Frontend Software Engineer (f/m/d) to join our team and contribute to the creation from scratch of our global Contact Center stack. If you combine strong tech skills with an outstanding drive and entrepreneurial mindset, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

What’s on the menu?

  • Contribute to designing and building from scratch applications which will transform our contact centers and customer experience around the world
  • Practice modern software development methodologies such as Continuous Delivery, TDD and Scrum.
  • Be an active partner for Product management in order to provide the best value for stakeholders and our customers.
  • Understanding development lifecycle and collaborate with cross-functional and international agile teams.
  • A fast paced and multicultural working environment
What do you bring to the table?

  • Practical experience as Frontend Developer: vanilla JavaScript, Typescript, CSS/HTML…
  • Expertise with ReactJS or Angular or VueJs
  • Experience with unit/functional testing, SPA development and toolkit such as gulp or webpack
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or an equivalent education or practical experience
  • Passion for clean and beautiful code with an eye for simplicity and pragmatism
  • Practical experience with Design Patterns, Design Principles, Software Architecture and Algorithms and automated tests (unit, integration and functional)
  • Ability to get up to speed with new systems and concepts quickly
  • Keen to constantly learn and improve your own skills, and not afraid to jump into new things
  • Curiosity, creative outside-the-box problem solving abilities and an eye for detail
Our topping?

  • English is our working language, but our colleagues at Delivery Hero come from every corner of the globe providing an incredibly diverse, international working atmosphere with cross-cultural teams
  • A modern, recently refurbished office in the heart of Berlin with several kitchens (fresh fruits, coffee, drinks…), kickers, table tennis...
  • Great career opportunities following our development career plan
  • Being part of a global family under the Delivery Hero umbrella (>300 developers working in the headquarters)
  • Moving can be stressful so to help you settle in we provide a relocation package including visa help, temporary accommodation and a budget to applicants from abroad.
  • Sprichst du kein Deutsch? No worries, we provide German classes for those expats who want to expedite their integration
  • We know that experience at the office with interesting and diverse problems, colleagues and technologies isn’t the only way to learn, so our employees get an education budget to attend conferences or trainings locally or around Europe to satisfy their pursuit of knowledge
  • Every Friday we have a team integration, when we just stop working earlier, grab a beer and relax with colleagues
At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and representation is key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or any other aspect that makes you, you.

Up for a challenge? Apply now!

More information about what we are doing can be found on our tech blog , so check it out!

ASP.NET Developer

Based in Berlin

Visa sponsorship supported

Permanent roles


We are looking for a passionate ASP.NET developer (all seniorities) to join our R&D department in Berlin.


You will be working with an organization at the forefront of data science and research for one of the largest retailers. You will play a key role in crafting and evolving APIs, data pipelines and data algorithms that are transforming their workflow and generating new ways of planning their client’s media campaigns.


What you’ll be doing 

  • Design, develop, test, debug, monitor and maintain in-house developed software
  • Solve complex problems, propose smart solutions, spot and identify possible bugs
  • Research alternative technologies to further improve efficiency and performance


What experience and skills we are looking for


    • Develop data pipelines, APIs and algorithmic logic that integrate with large scale data sources
    • Participate in technical design discussions, providing experience in authentication, security, performance and maintainability
    • Work with a team who code in C# / .NET Core,
    • Basic level Python and TypeScript / React knowledge is an advantage
    • Devise data models and processing that is optimal for fast and reliable querying of large volumes of data
    • Work with analytical data models (OLAP / ROLAP), where prior experience is definitely beneficial
    • Write high quality, test-driven software using functional and object-oriented design principles
    • Work in a continuous delivery environment, using tools such as Kubernetes,  Google Cloud Platform, and GitHub/GitLab
    • Work in a cross-functional Agile team, alongside other developers, data scientists, product owners, designers, and testers
    • You have a good understanding of SOLID design principles
    • Work from Berlin/Germany with limited opportunities for partial remote work

     

    We don’t expect you to have direct experience in all the technologies the team uses, but you will need the proficiency and enough related experience to get up to speed quickly and provide hands-on mentoring to our developers.


Key areas of responsibility:

 

Technical excellence

  • You will be responsible for the design and implementation of technical solutions on your project, working in close collaboration with your teammates and the client.
  • You will coach and mentor others, and help evolve ways of working to support the growth of the team. For example, applying practices like BDD, DevOps and Continuous Delivery.
  • You will represent the team in our wider engineering community of practice and contribute to continuous improvement of craft.

 

Software craft

  • You will tackle complex programming problems in a clean and testable way, and ensure code is maintainable.
  • You will evaluate how different technologies, frameworks and languages can be used in order to deliver the best possible solution.
  • You will promote collective code ownership across the stack, contributing to infrastructure, application and database development.

 

Design expertise

  • You will demonstrate expertise in designing and developing high-quality, scalable services using a range of architectural styles, taking into account both functional and non-functional requirements.


What we have to offer you

  • Full-time employment in Berlin, Germany
  •  You will have the opportunity to research, propose and experiment with technologies that will be implemented in new features
  • Play a role in the migration to a new microservices architecture
  •  Introduce new solutions to scale and tune various parts of our ecosystem
  • Competitive compensation, based on your experience and expertise

If you think it’s you we’re looking for please send us your CV and cover letter in English. Feel free to include any coding examples, a link to your GitHub profile, or similar.

For our Mobile Development Team in Munich, we are currently looking for a highly motivated Android Developer (m/f/d). Are you passionate about coding in Kotlin and Java? If Activities, Fragments, Intents and Services sweeten your Marshmallow and you like to have some Oreos and Pie with your coffee, send us an email with your CV and links to your existing projects in Google Play, or Github repositories if you have any. Besides having solid Android knowledge, ideally you are experienced in one or more of the following topics: Restful APIs with JSON, unit testing and test automation, continuous integration, git and Gradle. We need your creativity and ambition relating to smartphones, tablets, wearables, AI and more! Join us and contribute to our SIXT Apps and Rent/Share/Ride products creating excitement for our customers at an international scale. You will get to interact with like-minded mobile experts in our own mobile development blog and participate in dev-guilds and regular hacking days, giving you the chance to expand your knowledge of the platforms. We will provide you with the suitable setting that includes a foosball, great coffee, Club Mate and regular team events. We are coding the future of mobility! SIXT stands for success, agility, ownership and an intercultural team. Apply now, join our journey and become a part of the SIXT family.

Do What You Love
  • You play a key role in the development of the SIXT apps in a highly motivated mobile-team
  • You have high standards in regards to quality which is reflected in your clean and testable code, solid architecture and your experience with code-reviews
  • You work in an Agile setup (SCRUM) with product, design and backend experts in a proactive and fast-paced environment with flat hierarchies
  • You constantly evaluate new technologies and apply them effectively to our products
  • You communicate fluently in English and appreciate working in a culturally diverse team


Come As You Are
  • You have plenty of experience in Java and are already up to speed with Kotlin
  • You are proficient with cloud based API communication, Room Persistence storage, Material Design principles and Analytics
  • You are familiar with Dependency Injection, Modularization, Continuous Integration, Retrofit, Eventbus, Espresso, JUnit, Proguard, Firebase or Crashlytics
  • You enjoy exploring Play Services, Android Jetpack, Architecture Components, Instant Apps and Coroutines
  • Optionally you are also experienced in connecting Android apps with Bluetooth, IoT, UART serial ports and Connected-Car systems and would like to lead the development of our internal telematic services/apps


Feel Good

In addition to the obligatory table football, driving simulators, and ping-pong table, our two dedicated Feel Good Managers focus on the wellbeing of our SIXT Tech colleagues. Amongst other things they will support you with your relocation, finding accommodation, visa issues and help you to organize team events, Meetups, and Townhalls. Our offices have different sizes, you will definitely find something according to your preferences. We follow no dress code. As a member of the SIXT-Family, you get attractive car rental and leasing offers as well as access to our large employee benefit portal where you find attractive offers for traveling, shopping and more. During breakfast, lunch, and dinner our high-quality restaurant offers daily changing meat, fish and vegetarian dishes, as well as a salad bar and freshly-baked pizza. Our coffee lounge for meeting and relaxing is opened the whole day. COME AS YOU ARE and DO WHAT YOU LOVE: Join our 300 IT colleagues and apply now (in English or German preferred)!

Front End Developer – Javascript developer with Angular OR React – Munich - up to €90,000/year

 

My client is the world's leading manufacturer of standards software, services and solutions.

Innovation and integration, as well as interoperability, are the focus of the development of all his products.

 

Since it was founded, my client has successfully established its product range in many different international markets like Germany, Austria, UK, Spain, France, Poland, United States, Canada, Italy and Mexico. Worldwide, more than 7,000 employees work for him.

 

My client is looking for an experienced Front End developer with experience with either Angular or React, that have sheer passion for Software Development to join their international and growing team in beautiful Berlin.

Do not miss out on this opportunity! Apply today!

 

If this is not interesting for you but you know someone who could be interested, refer them to us and receive a generous referral bonus to say thanks!

Senior Java Developer

THESE ARE YOUR TASKS


You are able to build fast, elegant and powerful mobile apps, that can access device hardware, communicate with a Restful API and cache as well as synchronize data locally? You already have experience in Reactive Programming and in building modern iOS apps? We are looking for ambitious mobile developers to join our fast growing online marketplace.

We are currently a team of 36 people who are working in the heart of Berlin. We keep growing and plan to hire 1-2 other mobile developers in the next 3 months.
Our product roadmap includes:

  • Native mobile applications so our jobbers can manage their applications on the go
  • Modern Rest API that enables our customers to manage their short term staff via the API
  • Scoring algorithm that uses Machine learning techniques to rate the reliability of our jobbers
  • A free to use shift-planning software that generates leads for our staffing marketplace




WHAT YOU BRING


  • 2 years experience in native development for iOS (ideally with an application in the iOS App Store)
  • Experience in Reactive Programming (e.g. RxSwift or RxJava)
  • Solid knowledge in Swift and / or Objective C
  • Solid knowledge of software design patterns and good architecture
  • Deep understanding of the iOS operating system and ecosystem
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs
  • Great skills in analyzing, debugging and resolving defects
  • Proficiency in code versioning with git
  • Fluency in written and spoken English


Bonus points for
  • Experience with mobile tracking frameworks
  • Experience with Machine Learning / AI algorithms
  • Experience with managing a mobile development team




WHAT WE OFFER


  • Very competitive salary between 50k and 60k EUR depending on your experience
  • We sponsor your visa if you are not an EU resident and accompany you during the visa process
  • Once you arrive, we help you set up everything to get started: Registration, Bank Account, Health Insurance, Tax and Social Tax ID, etc.
  • You will work with the latest equipment, including a MacBook Pro, iPhone X and additional gadgets / tech equipment you like to use (headphone, monitor, etc.)
  • You work in our spacious office in the heart of Berlin (near Checkpoint Charlie)
  • You have flexible working hours
  • Twice a week, we offer free lunch for the whole company
  • Twice a week we offer free professional fitness training outside of our office
  • Twice a week you can participate in a free German language course during working hours
  • We have free company fun events about once per quarter

Your Responsibilities:

“Raisin goes mobile”!

Your mission as an experienced React Native Developer is to build great solutions with delighting UI’s as well as an amazing mobile user experience.
You are part of a cross-functional team of pioneers, crafting the first mobile solution for a market proven and successful business model.
Increasing the engagement of existing customers and winning over new customer groups and market segments are amongst the key objectives.

  • Together with your team, you will own the concept, design, implementation and deployment of our customer-facing mobile apps
  • You are actively participating in agile and collaborative processes
  • You are responsible to keep high-quality standards of software craftsmanship and low tech debt
  • Finally, you are responsible for continuously improving your team as well as yourself


Your Profile:

  • You have been working as a React Native or Mobile Developer for at least 3 years
  • You have strong experience with React Native / Redux and have a portfolio of nice examples that showcase your experience
  • You have solid practical knowledge in app integration and delivery lifecycle, including code signing and app store reviews
  • Also, you have fundamental experience consuming RESTFul APIs using any programming language
  • Very good analytical and communication skills in English complete your profile
  • Android (Java) and/or iOS (Swift) track record is a plus


Our Benefits:

Be part of a diverse team of more than 34 different nationalities, who strongly believes in agile cross-functional methods, collaboration and appreciation in our daily work. We are professional and work hard to always be the best in our field. You find us in our open office in beautiful Prenzlauer Berg well connected to public transport and surrounded by a great variety of restaurants and supermarkets.

  • Relocation and visa support as well as a relocation reimbursement
  • Personal training budget of 1,700 € and four full training days
  • Free choice of hardware
  • Beginner German classes directly at the office and financial support for acquiring a language certificate
  • Hungry all the time? Breakfast, snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks are provided
  • Stay up to date at regular townhall sessions with our founders and feel free to ask any kinds of questions
  • Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days
  • Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than 20 € per month
  • We offer you a company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20 %
  • Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch Lottery, Tech Lunch, Xletix and Raisin Ladies Events

This job is based in Bremen, Germany and requires relocation.

We sponsor Visa!


Company: https://www.gambio.com

City: Bremen, Germany


Web Developer PHP (f/m)


            Areas of focus.

  • Agile software development based on SCRUM

  • Further development and optimization of our shop solution

  • Development of automated tests


    Our requirements.

  • Very good knowledge in object-orientated programming, Php5/7 and MySQL

  • Optimally you have skills in JavaScript

  • jQuery, Smarty and PHPUnit is familiar to you

  • Enjoying development in a team 


    Our offer.

listings.position: (Senior) Backend Engineer Golang - Global Contact Center (f/m/d)
listings.description:
Delivery Hero is building the next generation of online food-delivery platforms around the world. We’re truly an international organization, with teams in over 40 countries and 80+ nationalities represented in our Berlin office alone.
Within this environment Global Contact Center is a central function supporting Delivery Hero’s contact centers (or customer service) throughout the world. We provide them expertise, data and technology to operate in the most efficient way. Global Contact Center is currently looking at moving away from 3rd party technology and investing in building our own stack (automation solution, live chat tool, workforce management product…)

We are therefore looking for a Backend Software Engineer - Golang (f/m/d) to join our team and contribute to the creation of our global Contact Center stack from scratch. If you combine strong tech skills with an outstanding drive and entrepreneurial mindset, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

What’s on the menu?
  • Contribute to designing and building from scratch applications which will transform our contact centers and customer experience around the world
  • Craft and maintain microservices architectures, API-based and event-based communication.
  • Practice modern software development methodologies such as Continuous Delivery, TDD and Scrum.
  • Be an active partner for Product management in order to provide the best value for stakeholders and our customers.
  • Understanding development lifecycle and collaborate with cross-functional and international agile teams.
  • A fast paced and multicultural working environment
What do you bring to the table?
  • Practical experience as Backend Developer in Golang
  • Good knowledge of relational databases (normal forms, ACID, isolation levels, index anatomy)
  • Experience working with distributed and parallel systems and web applications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or an equivalent education or practical experience
  • Passion for clean and beautiful code with an eye for simplicity and pragmatism (S.O.L.I.D principles)
  • Practical experience with Design Patterns, Design Principles, Software Architecture and Algorithms and automated tests (unit, integration and functional)
  • Ability to get up to speed with new systems and concepts quickly
  • Keen to constantly learn and improve your own skills, and not afraid to jump into new things
  • Curiosity, creative outside-the-box problem solving abilities and an eye for detail

Our Toppings
  • English is our working language, but our colleagues at Delivery Hero come from every corner of the globe providing an incredibly diverse, international working atmosphere with cross-cultural teams
  • A modern, recently refurbished office in the heart of Berlin with several kitchens (fresh fruits, coffee, drinks…), kickers, table tennis...
  • Great career opportunities following our development career plan
  • Being part of a global family under the Delivery Hero umbrella (>300 developers working in the headquarters)
  • Moving can be stressful so to help you settle in we provide a relocation package including visa help, temporary accommodation and a budget to applicants from abroad.
  • Sprichst du kein Deutsch? No worries, we provide German classes for those expats who want to expedite their integration
  • We know that experience at the office with interesting and diverse problems, colleagues and technologies isn’t the only way to learn, so our employees get an education budget to attend conferences or trainings locally or around Europe to satisfy their pursuit of knowledge
  • Every Friday we have a team integration, when we just stop working earlier, grab a beer and relax with colleagues
At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and representation is key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or any other aspect that makes you, you.

Up for a challenge? Apply now!

More information about what we are doing can be found on our tech blog , so check it out!

My client is a mobiles games company based in berlin. Their games beat the 350 million player mark and have over 25 million daily active users worldwide. 


Their trendy berlin office consists of a team of international and enthusiastic professional. As a senior unity engineer, you will be able to influence and see the impact of your work on millions of users. 


Their games are developed using Unity and are distributed for mobile platforms (iOS and android). Their services are deployed and ran using a great range of the services provided within AWS. They approach games development from a cross-functional perspective: They value and encourage product ownership from end to end of the development pipeline. They value practices and principles such as TDD, Continuous Integration, collective code ownership, and pair programming.

They foster continuous delivery and strive for high automation, and value and practice lean thinking: MVPs, reducing waste and costs, A/B testing, full orientation to business based on metrics and audience data


RESPONSIBILITIES


You will work in a cross-platform team (iOS, Android, backend) using Unity / C# and backend programming) 


Contribute to architectural decisions and deliver high-quality code 


Aid in design and implementation of cross-platform games for Android, iOS, also working in the game's backend implementation 


Participate in all aspects of an interactive software development process, including design, estimation, build, testing, debugging, maintenance and support in order to produce reusable and reliable code

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • You will work in a cross-platform team (iOS, Android, backend) using Unity / C# and backend programming)
  • Contribute to architectural decisions and deliver high-quality code
  • Aid in design and implementation of cross-platform games for Android, iOS, also working in the game's backend implementation
  • Participate in all aspects of an interactive software development process, including design, estimation, build, testing, debugging, maintenance and support in order to produce reusable and reliable code


WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU

 

  • 5+ years of experience as a developer (at least 3 years within the game/mobile apps industry)
  • 3+ years of experience in game development with Unity
  • A will to practice, learn and foster Continuous Integration and Delivery practices
  • Ability to share best practices and mentor teammates Willingness to continuously learn, improve and grow on a personal and professional scale
  • Profound value for simplicity and technical excellence
  • Experience programming game backends and scalability (is a plus)
  • Experience building backend services for mobile products (is a plus)
  • Experience with containers and orchestration (is a plus)
  • Experience with cloud architecture using AWS (is a plus)
  • Experience of Swift, Objective-C, Java, Kotlin or JavaScript (is a plus) Practical hands-on experience with TDD and knowledge of coding practices such as SOLID and Clean Code (is a plus)


Applicants outside of Germany are also welcome to apply as full relocation and visa support is available. 

If you would like to know more about the position and have any questions, please contact me at mohit.rajpara@claremontconslting.com. +46 (0) 844688367

listings.company: Free2Move - compare & book cars, scooters, bikes and taxis
listings.description:
This job is based in Berlin, Germany and requires relocation.

We sponsor Visa!


Company: https://de.free2move.com

City: Berlin, Germany


Scala Developer (f/m) 



You want to be part of an agile, cross-functional team focused on designing & implementing scalable and highly-reliable solutions?

The majority of our current backend services are Scala-based, mostly written in a purely functional style based on the Typelevel stack. They are supported by a range of modern technologies, including Redis for caching, RabbitMQ for messaging, MongoDB and PostgreSQL for persistence, etc. This tech stack, of course, is not carved in stone; we are open to any suggestion that might help us improve our daily work.


If you are an expert in these technologies, a veteran dedicated to producing top quality software and find our adventure interesting - then we have a place for you!


As a Scala engineer:
● You feel more than comfortable with functional programming, and have gone beyond using just monads
● You have practical experience in developing RESTful services using http4s, Akka HTTP and/or Play
● You have worked on projects that utilize streaming I/O libraries, such as fs2 or Akka Streams
● Deep knowledge of Scala-based testing frameworks, such as ScalaTest and ScalaCheck, is mandatory
● You are at least interested in more advanced Scala libraries, such as cats, shapeless, simulacrum, scalaz, etc.

As a software engineer in general:
● You have passion for microservices (both RESTful and message-based) and API-first development approach
● You are capable of making architectural decisions that will result in scalable, reliable, and performant systems
● You have a solid understanding of clean coding principles, functional and enterprise design patterns, and test-driven development
● You don't run away from documenting services under your supervision
● You are a team player and you're able to give as well as receive feedback
● You have practical experience with build automation, continuous delivery, scripting, etc.

Also nice to have:
● Experience in developing applications for cloud platforms, namely Kubernetes and AWS
● Experience with, or interest in, modern software development approaches, such as reactive
programming, CQRS, DDD, etc.
● Experience in working with containers, service meshes, API gateways, service directories and
similar technologies that make working with microservices a bit less painful
● An active GitHub account

Welcome to the circle of trust
Our people make us who we are, so as a Free2Movester you’ll benefit from these (and more) values:
● Flat hierarchies. No chain of command to pass your ideas up.
● A super friendly, super international team.
● Room and encouragement to bring your own ideas. No question is too stupid!
● A bright airy office in central Berlin. You like soft drink fridges, fruit baskets, fancy hand soaps? We’ve got ‘em.
● Your very own buddy to help you settle in, help you with paperwork and show you the good lunch spots.
● Up to 30 days holiday. You deserve it.
● The opportunity to contribute to an amazing product you’ll love.
● Free. Carsharing. Everywhere. Oh yeah.

listings.position: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer (Node.js & Typescript) / Checkout Team (m / f / d)
listings.description:
We are searching for a Software Engineer with a passion for software-craftsmanship and interest in payment systems. The ideal candidate would enjoy building scalable solutions within a strong, cross-functional, agile development team.

As a Senior Software Engineer in Omio Checkout Team you will have an opportunity to:
  • Design and build scalable, secure and reliable payment and fraud prevention systems.
  • Integrate a variety of payment methods from different payment service providers.
  • Design and continuously improve the payment experience for our customers
  • Use cutting edge technologies.
Do you care about solid engineering practices and love to share your knowledge within a talented team? Fantastic!

In Addition, We Would Love You To Have
  • Solid years of experience developing backend applications (we use Node.js).
  • Knowledge of some other programming language (Java, Go, etc)
  • Frontend experience (Typescript / JavaScript, React.js, ES6),
  • Expertise in SQL, NoSQL. Experience with distributed clusters.
  • Experience in designing and building scalable high-performing and secure applications.
  • Experience in cloud infrastructure and container technology.
  • Excellent spoken and written English skills
  • Most important: You are a good team member, nice to work with, keen to learn and someone who loves to take ownership & is able to get things done.
What can you expect from joining Omio?
  • Cutting-edge technologies and everyday opportunities to learn, grow and develop.
  • A diverse welcoming team of over 40 nationalities.
  • Free lunches, yoga, German lessons and more.
  • Competitive compensation and relocation and visa support.

Powered by Berlin-based company builder Next Big Thing AG, Evertrace GmbH is a new startup at the intersection of supply chain and cutting-edge tech (blockchain & IoT). Our vision is to eliminate frustrating information silos and time-consuming, manual work during supply chain management; instead, we’re creating a simple and safe way to exchange data in real-time between involved parties. By providing a single platform for all participants of the logistics process - cargo owners, freight forwarders, brokers, insurers - Evertrace enables accessible data & real-time documentation.

Evertrace is seeking an experienced Java Developer to build the next generation supply chain product. In this role, you will work in an agile team and collaborate on the design, development and optimization of our platform. As one of the first employees of an IoT/Blockchain based supply-chain venture, you will have the opportunity to influence and shape processes. You’ll witness fast growth and co-write Evertrace’s success story, as well as your own.

Join our team to build a product that makes a huge difference to industry players!

These will be your tasks:
  • Design and develop our high-volume, low-latency innovative IoT platform for the supply chain, delivering high-availability and performance
  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle (requirements management with stakeholders, architecture, implementation, test automation, operation, and monitoring)
  • Write well-designed and testable software components
  • Prepare, produce and support software releases
  • Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies, and presenting these for architectural review

Some technologies you will be working with:

  • Java 9, Spring Framework, Spring Boot
  • Restful API and microservices
  • Akka/Reactor or similar, Kafka
  • RDBMS, Cassandra, Elasticsearch
  • Data processing stack (like Hadoop/Sparks/Storm)
  • AI, Machine learning
  • Docker, Kubernetes
  • AWS/Azure

You're offering these qualifications:
  • 5+ years of hands-on Java experience and a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Proven record of successfully building and optimizing scalable, cost-effective and high performing solutions
  • Real-world project experience with real-time data ingestion and processing is a must.
  • A deep interest in Blockchain & IoT technologies and data analytics & AI/Machine learning frameworks (experience is a big bonus)
  • Experience with event-driven/reactive programming
  • Experience in working on back-end integration with relational databases and NoSQL database (like Cassandra)
  • Experience working with microservices and API
  • Experience with cloud deployment and agile environments
  • Knowledge and a great interest for secure development
  • A strong sense of responsibility for the product quality and a goal-oriented working style
  • A true team-player who enjoys contributing to the overall company success
  • Fluency in English (German is not mandatory)

We're offering these benefits:
A sweet deal

  • Full-time unlimited contract
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible working hours
  • Free drinks & fruits
  • Hardware of your choice
  • Subsidized membership to a Berlin sports club with 450+ locations
  • Access to Factory Community events: lectures, social events, networking, great restaurant and café, and a ball-pit!

Work with the best

  • Join an agile, cross-functional, dedicated team
  • Take responsibility for your projects. No micromanagement.
  • Work within a flat hierarchy among international team members from 20+ countries

Recruitment agency

We do not work with recruitment agencies.

Relocation & EU work visa

We offer relocation assistance for this position regarding paperwork, visa and first steps in Germany.

Software Engineer (C++), Non-functional Testing

Munich

Software Engineering – Test & Verification

Full-time

We Are AID GmbH

AID-Autonomous Intelligent Driving is bringing together the world’s top software, roboticists and AI talent to ignite a human centered revolution in autonomous driving. By understanding the human challenges as well as the engineering ones, the technology we are testing today on the streets of Munich will become the backbone of a universal self-driving system – capable of improving life in urban environments for billions of people. With the agility of a start-up and the support of Audi (VW Group), AID is free to craft an autonomous world that works for everyone – from manufacturers to passengers to city planners to pedestrians. For us, the future isn’t about merely making vehicles more autonomous, it’s about making people more autonomous.

About The Role
    • Definition and implementation of concepts for efficient specification and execution of non-function tests, e.g. performance, reliability, robustness, security etc.
    • Design and implementation of framework for automated and explorational execution of non-functional tests.
    • Execution of non-functional tests in relevant verification environments (Simulation, HIL-Systems, In-Car).
    • Analysis of test results, creation of test reports, accompanying documentation and recommendations to increase non-functional properties of the system under test.
    • Act as mentors for the organization, developing and enforcing best practices defining performant and robust design of the software product.

About You
    • Strong system understanding – interaction between hardware and low level software.
    • Strong understanding of the middleware architectures in embedded systems.
    • Experience with the evaluation and improvement of non-functional system properties, like performance, reliability, robustness, security etc.
    • Strong programming skills in C++ and a scripting language (e.g. Python).
    • Strong analytical thinking and passion for investigation.
    • Hands on, self-motivated, driven team player, who is excited to work in a new automotive startup company.
    • Innovative thinker and a positive attitude to solve cross domain problems.
    • Fluent English skills are mandatory.

Life At AID GmbH

Our state-of-the-art offices are in the heart of beautiful Munich. We’re an agile, creative and dynamic start-up with people, innovation and teamwork at the core of our values. We reward our employees with excellent salary and benefits packages including, on-site language courses, mobile phone, subsidized lunches in the company bistro, subsidized gym membership, social events, BBQ’s and much more.

We value diversity and as an equal opportunities employer we encourage applications from all suitably qualified individuals. AID is a multicultural organization with employees from over 40 different countries, as such we provide visa and relocation support to all new employees. As an organization our primary business language is English, so where possible please provide a copy of your resume in English.

What are you waiting for? Help us to build the future.

2325
Berlin, Germany, €100000 - €120000 per annum + benefits

Job Type: Permanent

Managed by: C++ Team

C++ Developer / Software Engineer (C++14 Boost). Would you like to work on complex, technically challenging systems, solving problems collaboratively with a hugely talented team? You'll be working with contributors to the C++ coding language and enjoying perks such as flexible working.

As a C++ Developer at this established technology company you will design and develop sophisticated algorithms and make refinements to the user interface of a hugely successful product that is integrated within Microsoft and used by over half million people daily. You'll be working with a large, complex codebase across the full development lifecycle ensuring clean, well maintained code.

This C++ Developer role presents an excellent opportunity for a keen technologist to learn and work with other incredible engineers at the forefront of technology. You'll be based in Central Berlin, visa sponsorship and relocation packages available.

Requirements
  • Strong C++ development experience; you'll be using C++11 onwards
  • Good knowledge of Boost (they have created their own range library)
  • Thorough understanding of Computer Science fundamentals
  • Experience of creating complex algorithms
  • Strong English language skills, plus points for German (language courses can be arranged)
As a C++ Developer / Software Engineer you will earn a competitive salary (to €120k) plus benefits.

Apply now or call to find out more about this C++ Developer / Software Engineer opportunity.

REF: BB/13541/A/KS/021019_1570008929

Please note this role is based in BANGKOK, Thailand! We provide full relocation packages for you and your family.

About Agoda
  • Agoda is one of the biggest OTAs in Asia and is part of the Booking Holdings Group (NASDAQ: BKNG), the world’s largest online travel business (100B$ Market Cap) with over 2 Million properties listed
  • We have 4000+ employees, 70 nationalities, 40+ offices, and 1000 people in technology
  • Our mobile team consists of 100+ amazing engineers and technology professionals who consistently improve an already world class product. Here is some information about our App…
  • We support 38 languages and 50 currencies
  • We are loved by our users with a rating of 4.6/4.7 and have been awarded the Editor’s Choice in the Google Play store
  • We have over 15,000 unit tests, 900 automated UI tests, and release every week


About The Role

We are looking for important contributors to our industry leading iOS app. You'll be working with top technology professionals and execute at the highest level of excellence.

You’ll be using many of the most current techniques and patterns to accomplish our goals. Our typical day involves of using advanced architectures, implementing automated testing, and always improving our quality, tools, and efficiency.

Responsibilities
  • Key contributor in features, experiments, technical components and systems.
  • Learn additional mobile team related software platforms and become full stack
  • Build top architectures to build top features in Swift
  • Collaborate with server, other client, and infrastructure technical staff to find the best solutions


Qualifications
  • At least 2 years of experience developing iOS applications
  • B.S. in Computer Science or quantitative field
  • Proficient in one or more mobile platforms (iOS, Android, Web) and at least one programming language (Swift, Objective C, Kotlin, JavaScript, Java, Scala, C#)
  • Proficient in modern mobile and server coding and design practices. For example, VIPER, MVVM, SOLID principals, and TDD
  • Work experience with REST, Agile, Analytics, GIT Flow, App Store Publishing, iOS ecosystem

If you feel you are the right candidate get in touch! Agoda is full of like-minded people who demand success, reach for it, and succeed!

This job is based in Bangkok and would require you to join our Bangkok office. We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available.

Agoda is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

SIXT is shaping mobility by offering the full spectrum of car-based mobility services under one brand: RENT, SHARE, RIDE. We – the SIXT ride team – build the technology layer for SIXT's ride service vertical and power services from on-demand ride hailing and affordable shared rides to pre-booked corporate ride services and our most exclusive limousine services. With our product brand SIXT ride we drive our customers in over 60 countries and 200 cities and are constantly expanding to new markets. We are the fastest growing SIXT product and act like a startup with fast decision making and flat hierarchies. We are coding the future of mobility! SIXT stands for success, agility, ownership and an intercultural team. Apply now and join our journey and become a part of the SIXT-Family.

Do what you love

  • You have an eye for creative and stylish designs
  • You enjoy discussing the user interface design and front-end applications with our designers and stakeholders
  • You love to implement web designs and the functional fit of web feature implementations independently
  • You have the drive to continuously further improve the SIXT ride website suites
  • You are responsible for the quality assurance measures for the software that you have developed

Come as you are

  • You have great knowledge in HTML5 and CSS3 and a profound knowledge of JavaScript and OOP
  • You have knowledge of Javascript Libraries and Frameworks such as React, jQuery or ideally Stencil
  • You are well experienced with Angular (ideally with Redux state engine)
  • You have few years of work experience and are expert in implementing responsive designs
  • You are proficient in English written and spoken

Feel Good

In addition to the obligatory table football, driving simulators, and ping-pong table, our two dedicated Feel Good Managers focus on the wellbeing of our SIXT Tech colleagues. Amongst other things they will support you with your relocation, finding accommodation, visa issues and help you to organize team events, Meetups, and Townhalls. Our offices have different sizes, you will definitely find something according to your preferences. We follow no dress code. As a member of the SIXT-Family, you get attractive car rental and leasing offers as well as access to our large employee benefit portal where you find attractive offers for traveling, shopping and more. During breakfast, lunch, and dinner our high-quality restaurant offers daily changing meat, fish and vegetarian dishes, as well as a salad bar and freshly-baked pizza. Our coffee lounge for meeting and relaxing is opened the whole day. COME AS YOU ARE and DO WHAT YOU LOVE: Join our 300 IT colleagues and apply now (in English or German preferred)!

Please note this role is based in BANGKOK, Thailand! We provide full relocation packages for you and your family.

We are currently looking for a skilled & passionate Senior Frontend Developer to become part of one of our Tech Teams at ABOUT YOU!

All Tech Teams are driven by the dedication to deliver high-scalable applications shaped by a lean and intuitive user interface that ensures the best possible user experience. Your work will impact the future of how eCommerce is experienced by millions of customers.

Jump to the next career step and unlock the future potential of frontend development by constantly challenging your tech know-how with us!

 

 

What you will do


  • Build high traffic user interfaces with JavaScript and React/React Native or Vue.js
  • Work on the implementation of high-leverage features to optimize UX and conversion rates
  • Cooperate with skilled developers, product managers, QA’s, and designers to ship new components and features
  • Draft architectural decisions together with the Tech Lead and explore new technologies
  • Have a direct impact on team processes by regular agile retrospectives
  • Exchange your knowledge with other developers and be part of our ABOUT YOU TECH community



Who you are


  • Excellent & MVP-focused coding skills in JavaScript of minimum 5 years
  • Practical & recent experience with JS Frameworks like React, React Native or Vue.js
  • Comfortable working with TypeScript or ES6
  • Solid background in building complex customer-facing products coming along with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Passionate about writing well-structured, efficient and maintainable code, actively keeping the quality of the code base in check
  • Used to work in an English-speaking environment




Benefits


  • Grow together with one of the fastest-growing eCommerce companies in Europe

  • Flexible working times

  • 40% discount on our online shop

  • Fresh fruits + drinks everywhere

  • Language courses (German & English)

  • Free sports courses & reduced price for gym membership

  • Subsidized public transportation ticket

  • Free choice of hardware and operating system (Mac, Windows, Linux) also for private usage

  • State-of-the-art tech stack running on AWS

  • Modern office in the city center of Hamburg

  • International working environment and English as company language

  • Company flats (subject to availability)

  • Agile work environment (MOVE) and cross-functional teams

  • Free access to Germany’s greatest developer conference code.talks

  • Help in relocation and VISA process



We are looking forward to receiving your application – preferably via our online application portal! Thus, we can ensure a faster process and for you, it is very easy to upload your application documents. :)

Unikrn Inc. - a company running the world's top regulated eSports betting platform with offices in Seattle, Las Vegas, Malta and Germany.

 

Founded by Rahul Sood and Karl Flores in 2014, we provide eSports fans and newcomers alike a safe and legal place to gather, game, and bet on eSports. With games such as League of Legends, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, Dota 2 and more, there’s always something to watch and bet on at Unikrn.

 

Investors such as Ashton Kutcher and Mark Cuban - to name just a few - believe in our mission. We host events, we stream and we even own our own cryptocurrency!!!

 

Come join as our new

 

Senior Frontend Developer (m/f/d)

(Berlin)

 

Our Success


  • Word class sportsbook betting product with innovative products in a highly regulated market coming with IDV, KYC, AML and other business critical Flows running on an in-house build internationally deployed Betting Platform
  • Freemium economy with a Shop, Virtual Skins and Connekt
  • Skill base international betting products like Umode
  • Tournament and Casual gamer platform https://www.challengeme.gg/
  • Crypto Currency Token https://unikoingold.com/
  • Affiliate Platform, Mautic Based CRM Platform, Custom Analytics and Tracking
  • Editorial for relevant Target Audience
  • Innovative R&D or Prototypes using things like real time Computer Vision or other interesting new Technology

 

Your Mission

  • Responsible for designing the technical architecture, development, testing and maintenance of the primary codebase according to product specifications for the company’s flagship product, Unikrn Arena
  • Define and optimise operational processes and workflows, and provide technical guidance to teams in different departments (engineering, marketing, and design) to facilitate smooth and easy development of new features
  • Translate product feature briefs provided by product managers into technical documentation and tasks
  • Estimate timelines for product managers, and manage sprints and releases for the engineering team using Agile methodology
  • Collaborate with QA to diagnose and solve technical issues or bugs arising in systems during development and / or in production environments using bug trackers, version control systems, and continuous integration
  • Advise other departments, eg. marketing and design, on technical restrictions and corresponding solutions for their software requirements to reduce costs and development time



Your Skills

  • 5+ years experience in web application design and implementation
  • Deep knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, Javascript with mobile first development
  • Knowledge of frontend UI building frameworks and libraries (eg. React, AngularJS, Ember)
  • Knowledge of state management libraries (eg. Redux, MobX)
  • Knowledge of testing strategies and best practices
  • Working knowledge of the Unix/Linux command line
  • Common source control and deployment strategies (Git, Jenkins/CircleCI/Docker)
  • The ability to make quick decisions and iterate often
  • Fluency in English is required
  • Working Visa for Germany is required

listings.position: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer- Node.js & Typescript (Checkout Team) (m / f / d)
listings.description:
We are searching for a Software Engineer with a passion for software-craftsmanship and interest in payment systems. The ideal candidate would enjoy building scalable solutions within a strong, cross-functional, agile development team.


As a Senior Software Engineer in Omio Checkout Team you will have an opportunity to:

  • Design and build scalable, secure and reliable payment and fraud prevention systems. 
  • Integrate a variety of payment methods from different payment service providers.
  • Design and continuously improve the payment experience for our customers
  • Use cutting edge technologies.


Do you care about solid engineering practices and love to share your knowledge within a talented team? Fantastic!


In addition, we would love you to have:

  • Solid years of experience developing backend applications (we use Node.js).
  • Knowledge of some other programming language (Java, Go, etc)
  • Frontend experience (Typescript / JavaScript, React.js, ES6),
  • Expertise in SQL, NoSQL. Experience with distributed clusters.
  • Experience in designing and building scalable high-performing and secure applications.
  • Experience in cloud infrastructure and container technology.
  • Excellent spoken and written English skills
  • Most important: You are a good team member, nice to work with, keen to learn and someone who loves to take ownership & is able to get things done.


What can you expect from joining Omio?

  • Cutting-edge technologies and everyday opportunities to learn, grow and develop.
  • A diverse welcoming team of over 40 nationalities.
  • Free lunches, yoga, German lessons and more.
  • Competitive compensation and relocation and visa support.


﻿Do you feel like joining our team?

We're excited to receive your application!

PHP Developer - Symfony, Munich 

 

My client a global market leader based in Munich are searching for an English speaking PHP Symfony Developer to join their existing team of world class PHP Experts, working on a state of the art platform.

 

Flexible working environment in the heart of Munich.

 

Experience:

-PHP 2 years minimum experience

-Symfony experience with the latest versions (Symfony3/4)

-Advanced English 

-Logical thinker 

-PHP Specialist.

 

Nice to have - 

  

-German speaker 

 

Visa support welcome.

 

If you are passionate about Product and a PHP expert then please apply

Our client is a successful gaming studio who have beat the 350 million player mark and have over 25 million daily active users worldwide. 


They are looking for a highly skilled Senior Backend Engineer to join their team.

All of their games are developed using Unity and are distributed for mobile platforms (iOS and Android). Their services are deployed and ran using a great range of the services provided within AWS.


They approach game development from a cross-functional perspective: value and encourage product ownership from end to end of the development pipeline.


They value practices and principles such as TDD, Continuous Integration, collective code ownership, and pair programming.

We foster continuous delivery and strive for high automation, and value and practice lean thinking: MVPs, reducing waste and costs, A/B testing, full orientation to business based on metrics and audience data.


Responsibilities

·     You will work in a cross-platform team (iOS, Android, backend) using Unity / C# and backend programming)

·     Contribute to architectural decisions and deliver high-quality code

·     Aid in design and implementation of cross-platform games for Android, iOS, also working in the game's backend implementation

·     Participate in all aspects of an interactive software development process, including design, estimation, build, testing, debugging, maintenance and support in order to produce reusable and reliable code


What they expect from you

·     5+ years of experience as a developer (at least 3 years within the game/mobile apps industry)

·     3+ years of experience in backend development/DevOps (preferably using AWS and containers)

·     A will to practice, learn and foster Continuous Integration and Delivery practices

·     Ability to share best practices and mentor teammates

·     Willingness to continuously learn, improve and grow on a personal and professional scale

·     Profound value for simplicity and technical excellence

·     Experience programming game backends and scalability (is a plus)

·     Experience building backend services for mobile products (is a plus)

·     Experience with containers and orchestration (is a plus)

·     Experience with cloud architecture using AWS (is a plus)

·     Experience of Swift, Objective-C, Java, Kotlin or JavaScript (is a plus)

·     Practical hands-on experience with TDD and knowledge of coding practices such as SOLID and Clean Code (is a plus) 

-     Excellent English communication skills. 


What they have to offer

·     We care about people and their happiness

·     Monthly team events

·     Work-life-Balance

·     25 paid vacation days

·     Competitive, top-of-market compensation

·     Unlimited employment contract

·     Professional growth opportunities

·     Allocated training budget

·     Flat structures and open communication

·     Top quality equipment

·     Support with re-location and visa

·     Office located in Berlin’s tech hotspot "Kreuzberg"

·     Free breakfast, fresh fruit, snacks, smoothies, coffee and various soft drinks



The client ideally wants candidates to be based in the EU, however, they are open to provide visa support and a relocation package. If you feel this role is for you then apply ASAP! looking forward to hearing from you.

Do you want to join a team of entrepreneurs from over 50 different nationalities? To work in an environment powered by passion where no two days are the same?


At trivago we use the latest innovative technologies to empower our users to find their ideal hotel 100 times a second, across 55 different locales world-wide and in 33 different languages.


"I want a hotel with nightlife, an infinity pool, gourmet food, a sparkling clean room, and a balcony with a view of the ocean." This statement exemplifies the types of desires our users have on trivago and our User Profiling team is responsible for knowing and processing what these desires are. This understanding is essential for the optimization of every part of the user's journey on our platform.




Working in User Profiling, you'll have the opportunity to take on this challenge from multiple angles in order to enrich our understanding of our users. You might find yourself working on anything from understanding natural language search queries from the moment users land on trivago and begin to type, to dynamically personalising their hotel search results in near-real time, or even helping users to discover hotels that offer amenities as exciting as an infinity pool.




The User Profiling team consists of 25 passionate software engineers, site reliability engineers, data scientists, data analysts, QA engineers and project managers. We work in a dynamic setup with interdisciplinary teams focused on the backend of search and personalization functionality.




Does predicting the travel desires of millions of trivago users sound exciting? If so, then this is the right position for you ─ read on and apply today!




Get an inside look into tech at trivago:




https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aQYEsuGOs-s




What you'll do:


  • Provide 4 million daily visitors with their ideal hotel through personalization.


  • Contribute to key architecture decisions affecting multiple teams.


  • Build innovative features while writing clean, composable, and testable code.


  • Combine different technologies to design and implement efficient and high performing data-intensive systems.


  • Be creative, challenge yourself and spread the word: Contribute back to open source projects or open-source something yourself.


  • Elevate the output of a cross-functional team by facilitating communication between data


  • scientists, software engineers, project managers, and other passionate experts.




What you'll definitely need:


  • An academic degree in the field of Computer Science or relevant experience developing large applications.


  • At least 3 years of experience in software development, ideally in a high-performance web environment.


  • Experienced in Java with in-depth knowledge of the language internals esp. around the topics of Garbage Collection, Memory and Threading.


  • The ability to break down large goals and design solutions into actionable steps with maintainability as a priority.


  • Enthusiasm for sharing knowledge with other people in and outside the team.


  • A strong understanding of English, our official company language.




What we'd love you to have:


  • Previous experience with AWS or GCP.


  • A solid understanding of distributed systems and their principles such as reliability, scalability, and resilience.


  • A passion for good development practices like test automation, CI/CD, source version control, documentation etc.


  • Good experience with Python.




What to expect from life at trivago:


  • Growth: We help you grow as trivago grows through support for personal and professional development, constant new challenges, regular peer-feedback, mentorship and world-class training.


  • Autonomy: Every talent has the ability to make an impact independently by driving topics thanks to our strong entrepreneurial mindset, our horizontal workflow and self-determined working hours.


  • International environment: Our agile, international culture and environment with talents from 50+ nations encourages mutual trust and creates a safe space to discuss openly and act freely.


  • Collaborative spaces: Our state-of-the-art campus in Düsseldorf offers interactive spaces where we can easily collaborate, exchange ideas, take a break and workout together.


  • Relocation: We offer our international talents support with relocation costs, work permit and visa questions, free language classes, flat search and insurance.




Additional information:


  • trivago N.V. is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users.


  • To find out more about life at trivago follow us on social media @lifeattrivago.


  • To learn more about tech at trivago, check out our blog: https://tech.trivago.com/


  • Want to learn more about trivago's business model to prepare for your interview? Visit https://company.trivago.com/our-product/

listings.description:

Your tasks:

listings.position: Front-end developer with focus on React (CRO)
listings.description:
At Otravo, we work every day to build the next-gen platform for selling flight tickets with the goal to become the largest online travel agency in Europe.


As a React developer at Otravo, hundreds of thousands of daily visitors worldwide are dependent on the quality in your code. You will get the opportunity to work with the latest technologies and your work will mainly consist of building new products together with your team, our product owner and UI/UX designers.


The challenge

The Team, mainly located in Amsterdam-Halfweg, is responsible for conversion rate optimizations (CRO) for the whole flow from landing pages until the payment. It is a very cross functional and autonomous team consisting of CMS developers, UX/UI Designers, Copywriters, CRO specialist and Front-end developers. The team takes full responsibility on identifying conversions opportunities, continuous AB testing, usability testing and implementing improvements independent of the company roadmap and business priorities. Each team member is expected to contribute to the team goals and monitor the performance and conversion. As Front-End developer you are also part of the Front-end Guild consisting of all the front-end developers in other teams to share the knowledge and ensure the quality and consistency of the implementations. 


We are we looking for?

  • At least 5 years of experience within front-end development, Javascript/Typescript.
  • At least 3 years of experience with React.
  • Solid experience with single page apps connecting to REST / API services.
  • Experience in scalable and modular CSS architecture.
  • Interested in working in an agile environment.


What can Otravo do for you?

  • We are a fast-growing and flat organization with possibility of flexible working hours and benefits in terms of health, pension and awesome company events.
  • We also give you with the opportunity to develop through courses, conferences and events. 
  • A friendly atmosphere with committed people and place which supports exchange of ideas.
  • MacBook Pro or hardware of choice. 
  • 24 paid holidays and 6 ATV days.
  • Discount on your holiday trips.
  • Support with relocation (visa, housing, 30% tax ruling).
  • Free use of company gym.


About us

Otravo is a leading European online travel organization with several well-known brands such as Vliegtickets, Travelgenio, Tripmonster, Flygstolen and Greitai to name a few. With our brands we enable travelers in over 50 countries to enjoy saving money while booking their flight tickets and holiday packages. We work closely with our partners like airlines, tour operators, hotels, car rentals, insurance companies etc. This way we guarantee our customers a complete and competitive offer. We make the shopping and booking process as easy, quick and enjoyable as possible. And with success: we process over 3 million reservations per year. 

Our offices are in The Netherlands, Spain, Uruguay, Lithuania, Sweden and Argentina.


Questions?

Is this the job for you? Then please respond quickly! We would like to receive your motivation letter and CV via the application button below. If you have any more questions: contact our recruiter Charlotte Bouma (recruitment@otravo.com).

Are you passionate about Kafka and its eco-system? And interested to be a frontrunner in building the architecture & software of a Real-Time Data Streaming product?

 

In this green field product you would be building high performing & scalable software on top off Kafka high availability clusters. On top of this, developers can built modern data rich applications with Real-Time Analytics. This sophisticated product will be build according to a progressive Microservices Based Architecture.

 

You’re tasked with translating event-driven programming to simplified, easily usable features. With knowledge of Kafka Connect and Kafka Streams you can even take one step further and add bulk data processing and event streaming capabilities.

 

You’re solid with either Java, Scala or Python, but also have the ambition to move to a more Polyglot position branching out to Java, Scala and Python. You consider a programming language / paradigm as a tool to create value. If you’re already that Polyglot craftsman even better!

 

My client is a very progressive and successful product based company. Although they have grown significant over the years, they are still able to cherish many startup perks in building great software. Examples are as few processes and protocols, thus get out of the way of the talented engineers. A very inclusive and autonomous engineering culture. Can you handle the responsibilities that come with this type of working climate?

 

On a daily bases you will be interacting with the product owner, test engineer and other developers. You are the kind off Techie that gets energy from presenting the cool and innovative ideas you have to the rest of the multidisciplinary scrum team. Next to being able to actually code these great ideas! Quality over Deadlines!

 

Keywords:

Kafka, Microservices, Scala, Java, Python, Real-Time Streaming, Dev Clusters.

 

Requirements:

  • Medior / Senior Developer Skills (Scala, Python, Java)
  • Demonstrable experience with working with Kafka
  • Experience with Microservices Based Architecture
  • Big fan of Agile, Scrum, Kanban
  • Experience applying TDD and/or BDD
  • Are or admire to be a core product developer
  • Being flexible and balanced, ready to constant changes and innovation
  • Excellent communication in English

 

Next to the interesting and challenging work, you will work together with best of breed engineers, and experience a great company culture.

 

Salary up to 80k & other benefits. Visa Sponsorship.

 

Interested? Please contact to me on stephan@doghouse-recruitment.nl

listings.position: Senior Software Engineer (DevOps and Process Optimization/Automation)
listings.description:
Working Location: Bangkok, Thailand

This is a full time, permanent role in Bangkok, Thailand. Full relocation and Visa sponsorship provided.

Agoda is looking for a unique kind of software engineers to solve Agoda's unique problem. Those that has zero tolerance for inefficiencies in software development. Who can see beyond the norm and assist Agodians in releasing the best software impossibly fast, while impossibly safe.

The team is directly responsible in leading DevOps culture by example and developing workflow automation at Agoda.

Specifically, our work includes a scalable cluster of docker containers. A whole virtualized environment of Asia’s leading booking site in a laptop. An obliteration of conventional processes and establishing automated tools and systems. A robust event queue to track movement of features from developer commits to production. A scalable automated delivery system to support a growing websites, growing customers and growing number of engineers.

We are looking for individuals who share our vision and values to bring their best in solving these challenges together

Key Traits
  • Willing to learn
  • Zero tolerance for process inefficiency
  • Always look for opportunities to optimize and automate daily workflow
  • See beyond the current norm of operation, then design and implement solutions in stages
  • Great communication skills in building culture for other engineers to do the same


Requirements
  • Proficient in any one programming language (e.g. Golang, Python, JavaScript)
  • Hands-on experience with the whole SDLC: Requirement, Design, Code, Test, Deploy
  • Deep understanding of the computer science and its application
  • Understand VMs, docker containers and their applications
  • Understanding of container orchestration and its challenges (e.g. Kubernetes, Helm)
  • Hands on experiences with Agile practices: XP, Scrum, TDD
  • Business-level English (written and spoken)

Bonuses
  • Experienced in large scale distributed system
  • CI: TeamCity, Jenkins
  • Experience with configuration management: Puppet, Chef, Ansible
