listings.position: Software Developer (front-end, back-end or full stack)
listings.description:
Join the leading companies in IT
Are you looking for a new challenge? Have you ever thought about the Netherlands as your next career destination? Come to one of the most innovative countries in the world, where you will experience a great living and working environment. Join our developers team at Yacht and be part of our Most Dev community.
 

Most Dev community
Most Dev is the Yacht Community by and for developers and data professionals. We are constantly looking for the most challenging positions at our clients, so that you can work on meaningful and technically advanced projects. We invest in improving your skills through a tailor made education program. At our Yacht Academy you will be offered various possibilities to gain and share knowledge through training, workshops and tech talks. And we organize events such as hackathons, VR zombie shootings (which is quite fun actually) and bbq’s, to chill out and have a good time together.

Want to know more? Watch this video about the Most Dev community: https://youtu.be/VttLo1rjhCM

Yacht is one of the leading HR companies in the Netherlands. We focus on development positions for front-end, back-end and full stack developers, as well as data scientists and data engineers. Amongst our clients are ING, ABN AMRO, Rabobank (the 3 largest banks in the Netherlands), eBay, VodafoneZiggo, Philips and many more interesting tech companies.

About you
You are completely king or queen in software development. Whether you are focussed on Java or Javascript, know everything about Angular or React or are master in data engineering - you are always looking to improve yourself. Whether you call yourself front-end, back-end and full stack developer, your knowledge is up-to-date, you like working in Agile/Scrum environments and are willing to share your experience with others.

Working in the Netherlands
When you have decided that Yacht is going to be your next employer, we are going to help you relocate. We have a special department to support you: the Expat Center. They will take care of applying for your visa, help you find housing and book your flight. We will even pay for your flight, your first month of rent and for the visa application. That is how we ensure that your arrival in the Netherlands goes as smoothly as possible.

What does that look like? Watch this video: https://youtu.be/U_UzTZMuDu0

Are you looking to collaborate in a multidisciplinary team to implement server side game features and systems for our groundbreaking VR games and experiences
Do you like working closely together with the client side team to support them in implementing the client side features?
Are you a comfortable setting up external servers that can be used by our games to support our games, which can seamlessly scale based on demand and can recover from basic errors and problems?
Is C++ your main programming language, because the full control of it really gets you excited and are you equally passionate about optimizing network systems for optimal latency and bandwidth utilization?

Then we are surely looking for you!

Key Responsibilities
  • To take ownership of networking and multiplayer features so they can be setup in a network safe and efficient way and the team is aware, and can work with the constraints attached to these features.
  • To use your knowledge of C++, object orientation, design patterns, algorithms and data structures to create solid technical designs and efficient implementations of networking systems and multiplayer gameplay features
  • To collaborate with the rest of the team on solving various design challenges that relate to the multiplayer side and ensure a cohesive and engaging multiplayer experience
  • To develop and maintain networking tools for testing and analysis of the multiplayer environment
  • To analyze problems and debug them in order to quickly locate and fix challenging bugs, including optimizing network systems based on latency and bandwidth

Desired Skills And Experience
  • You have developed and maintained the networking and/or multiplayer features of at least 1 game project.
  • You have written a number of games and or hobby projects in C++ and have a proper understanding of all the basic concepts of the language
  • You have created at least 1 (hobby) project using the Unreal Engine providing you with basic understanding on creating blueprints, optimizing code through usage of C++ and the Unreal pipeline
  • It is a clear bonus if you have already worked in VR

About You
  • EU citizen or eligible to work in the EU
  • Technical and very precise at the same time
  • Social and collaborative
  • Excited by the potential of VR
  • You are comfortable with working under tight deadline in a fast-paced environment

What We Offer
  • A great work-life balance with a zero-crunch policy
  • For this vacancy we only consider candidates that are eligible to work in the EU (no visa required).
Global Games Executive Search | Diversity Specialist | Building World Class Teams

Follow Interactive jobs on LinkedIn www.linkedin.com/company/interactive-selectionFacebook at www.facebook.com/Interactive.Selection and on Twitter at www.twitter.com/gamesjobs

Interactive is an equal opportunity search firm that values diversity. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds.

VakantieDiscounter is the leading online travel agency in The Netherlands where our customers experience an easier and more comfortable way of booking their holiday: www.vakantiediscounter.nl.


We are looking for a Test Engineer to join our growing development team, where you will be part of an agile feature team. Your expertise will ensure high quality delivery for an excellent customer experience, and automated QA best practices being adopted by the team. You will be involved in making technical choices and functional refinements that will shape the future of our brand. Close cooperation with the Product Owner and stakeholders is expected.


We do all our development in-house using a technology stack that consists of Scala/Spark/Play Framework on the backend and Clojure/ClojureScript/re-frame on the frontend, with most of it running on GCP. For end-2-end testing we use Cypress.


What we expect from you


  • Mentor and help the team with regards to quality assurance
  • Develop and maintain automated tests together with our software engineers
  • Research tools and frameworks for a high quality, low maintenance QA infrastructure
  • Manual test where automation is not possible
  • Investigate issues that are signalled by our stakeholder and customers
  • Constantly ask the question “what could go wrong?” and prevent it from happening
  • Perform load and performance testing


Your skills and qualifications


  • You are a seasoned Test Engineer (5+ years) with solid experience working in an Agile environment
  • You have solid experience with Selenium based testing frameworks or Cypress
  • You have experience with JavaScript, with testing service architectures, and with Jenkins or other CI/CD tooling
  • You have experience with QA in a cloud environment like AWS or GCP
  • You have a passion for learning and sharing your knowledge


What we offer


  • Competitive remuneration package
  • A developer-focused workspace at our Amsterdam office
  • A fast-growing and flat organization with the possibility of flexible working hours and benefits in terms of health, pension, and fun initiatives, team buildings and events
  • The opportunity to develop through courses, conferences and events
  • MacBook Pro or hardware of choice
  • 24 paid holidays and 6 ATV days
  • Discount on your holiday trips
  • Support with relocation (visa, housing, 30% tax ruling)


About De VakantieDiscounter


The VakantieDiscounter (part of Otravo) is a pure online travel agency from the Benelux and was founded over 20 years ago. From 2009 to 2019, the company has grown its revenue 50x. At the moment, VakantieDiscounter is embarking on an internationalization journey, starting with Germany and further expanding into several other countries in Europe.

The company is continuously focused on innovative improvements and quality, not only with regards to the platform, but also in terms of channels to reach and support the customer. The ever-prevailing goal is to make it easier and more comfortable for the customer to select a nice holiday.

The vibrant VakantieDiscounter office, with an international team of 90 people, is located on the Amsterdam canals in the center of the city. The organisation is flat, democratic and based on trust, and employees have a lot of freedom in achieving success through their own preferred approach.


Questions?


Is this the job for you? Respond quickly to this vacancy! We would like to receive your CV via the application button below. Do you have questions? Then contact our own recruiter Charlotte Bouma recruitment@otravo.com

Will you become our new Senior Scala Engineer?


VakantieDiscounter is the leading online travel agency in The Netherlands where our customers experience an easier and more comfortable way of booking their holiday: www.vakantiediscounter.nl


We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer that will join our growing development department, where you will be part of an agile feature team. Your talent and experience with software development on the JVM will help us become more innovative, improve our productivity, and continue to live up to our high standards. Your focus will be on the Travel Platform that connects Tour Operator inventories to our website by processing large amounts of data for efficient search in our search solution and facilitates booking via our API integration layer.


All systems are built in-house with our own international development teams leverage technologies such as:


  • Apache Spark, for distributed data processing
  • Scala, Akka HTTP and the Play framework for a scalable stateless REST back-end
  • HELM, Kubernetes for running our systems on GCP
  • Clojure/ClojureScript for our website
  • A/B experiments, for sensible decision making


You will be writing lots of high-quality code that goes to production continuously and spend ±10% on R&D to find the next big thing.


Our wishlist


  • Seasoned Scala Engineer (4+ years)
  • Experience working in an Agile environment
  • Deep understanding of JVM and code optimizations
  • Experience with Spark, Hadoop, or other distributed data processing platforms
  • Experience with DevOps and improving CI/CD pipelines
  • You know functional programming
  • Passion for learning and sharing your knowledge
  • We consider it a plus if you have experience with: Cats, Scalaz, functional programming libraries Kubernetes, Docker, container-based deployments Clojure and/or ClojureScript Open Source; because we contribute back to the ecosystem


What we offer


  • Competitive remuneration package
  • A developer-focused workspace at our office
  • A fast-growing and flat organization
  • Flexible working hours
  • Benefits in terms of health and pension
  • Fun initiatives like team buildings and events
  • Develop through courses and conferences
  • 24 paid holidays and 6 ATV days
  • Discount on your holiday trips
  • Relocation support (visa, housing, 30% tax ruling)


About De VakantieDiscounter


The VakantieDiscounter (Elmar Reizen BV) is an online travel agency from the Benelux and was founded over 20 years ago. From 2009 to 2019, the company has grown its revenue 50x. At the moment, VakantieDiscounter is embarking on an internationalization journey, starting with Germany and further expanding into several other countries in Europe.

The company is continuously focused on innovative improvements and quality, not only with regards to the platform, but also in terms of channels to reach and support the customer. The ever-prevailing goal is to make it easier and more comfortable for the customer to select a nice holiday.


The vibrant VakantieDiscounter office, with an international team of 90 people, is located on the Amsterdam canals in the center of the city. The organization is flat, democratic and based on trust, and employees have a lot of freedom in achieving success through their own preferred approach.

Are you a talented Developer experienced with either Python and/or Java and open to work with both of these development languages? If you are living in or able to relocate to the beautiful, international city of Amsterdam? Please read on.


I'm looking for a highly skilled, highly motivated Python / Java Data Developer to work on a greenfield project developing a data analytics platform. This is a newly formed team and you will be working closely with Data Scientists and the business in a technically challenging environment. You will have the opportunity to work with the most up-to-date technologies and methods in a highly agile environment.


As the main data provider for the finance industry our client's systems handle huge amounts of data. They are building on top of their current layers to get more value from this data.




Your Profile:


* MSc Computer Science or related


* Solid experience with Python and / or Java (OO)

 
* Able to develop and maintain APIs and SDKs, primarily in Python and Java


* You are accurate and able to write solid, scalable code


* Excellent analytical and problem solving skills


* You have strong communication skills and are a team player




In this critical role to take our clients service to the next level, you will really have the opportunity to influence the company's success. Our client offer an exciting opportunity to accelerate your career in a professional and fun environment. You will also be offered continuous professional development and training.


Above market average salary, excellent bonus scheme and secondary benefits.


Visa sponsorship available

Vacaturelink:   https://careers.klm.com/jobs/955/Digital-JAVA-developer


At KLM, we prefer to call back-end developers Java developers. It's because of our love of travel. The world we live in is changing rapidly, and as a developer, you're in the cockpit. Will you join us on a digital journey around the world?


About the job


What will your task be?


You're the indispensable link in the big picture. Most of all, you'll help make innovations a reality. For example, you'll proudly stand next to the check-in that you've made possible. Because let's be honest: we're at the cutting edge of innovation, but without back-end, it can never be realised. So whether it's that check-in, or payments, or compensation for delays: together with your colleagues in the international Product Team, you'll make sure our customers are served as well and as personally as possible via our digital channels.


This is what you will be doing:


  • Leading the way. Using the latest tools, such as JDK1.8+, Restful API's, Spring Boot, Groovy, Scala, JSON, Infinispan,Docker, Kubernetes and MongoDB, you'll develop a variety of applications for internal and external customers.
  • Integration, testing and analysis. You'll spend every day developing in an innovative environment.
  • Each day, you'll share what you're working on and thinking about in the stand-up meeting. This helps you learn from others, and helps others learn from you.
  • Together with the Social Technologies team, you'll integrate various social networks with our new possibilities in artificial intelligence, voice recognition and Salesforce.


Where will you land?


We look forward to welcoming you as a back-end developer at KLM Digital, Amsterdam. Here, 800 staff work in the beating heart of KLM IT. We work lean and mean, with flex working spaces and good coffee.


Your team consists of staff in the Netherlands, France and India. They are all motivated professionals who work at a high level with the latest tools. We work together intensively and across boundaries, and of course you'll sometimes travel to the other locations to achieve the best results.


Your profile


What are we looking for?


Someone who, as a child, built a room-tidying robot from technical Lego. Who always thinks of a handy solution when something takes too much time or effort. Who is enthusiastic and curious. Working with you is a breath of fresh air, because you can quickly understand our customers (and what they want).


What else will you bring to KLM?


  • A university or HBO (university of applied sciences) degree and several years of experience as a Java developer.
  • Experience with agile working, scrums and sprints.
  • Knowledge of REST and Spring and Version Control Systems (GIT) and automated build tools (Bamboo).

What we offer


As well as an atmosphere that's always inspiring and international, we can offer you the following:


  • An attractive salary to match the weight of your luggage
  • Excellent pension scheme, profit sharing up to 20% and variable income up to 12%
  • A job at the cutting edge when it comes to technology
  • Do you like working from home? Then you're welcome to plan those days.
  • 25 days of paid holiday and 5 additional days.
  • Extensive study and training opportunities for personal development.
  • Great employee benefits, including reductions on flight tickets
  • Visa arrangement & Relocation package are possible


Ready for your next destination?


The selection procedure may include a case, file check and assessment. By applying for this vacancy, you automatically grant permission for this.


If the above profile matches your interest, you can apply for this position by clicking on the orange Apply button.


You can apply until 18-10-2019


We will do our best to get back to you with feedback within a reasonable time frame.


Please don't forget to mention the ID of this vacancy: #955

Acquisition regarding this vacancy is not appreciated.

Our client is looking for a React Native Developer to join their awesome & diverse team, helping to build new features on their unique new product, creating a great experience for end users in the process. You will be working with an experienced management team building an app that can change people’s lives!

Keywords: Frontend, Front-end, Front End, React, React.js, Reactjs, React Native, iOS, NativeScript, Android, JavaScript, English, Amsterdam, Scale-up, Growth, Senior, Unit Testing, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, CI/CD, Software, Product, Mobile, Desktop, Machine Learning, A.I.

Job Description

Are you ready for a new and exciting challenge at an international SaaS scale-up? We’re now looking for a talented PHP Developer with 2+ years of experience to join our Software Development team in our Amsterdam HQ.

As a PHP Developer at Virtuagym you will be working in one of our web-based squads. Every squad is responsible for a specific part of our system, for instance Training and Nutrition, Communication and Engagement, Payments and Invoices, and Memberships and E-commerce. Each scrum team consists of back-enders, front-enders, and full stackers, a QA engineer and a Product Owner.

As our new full-time PHP Developer you will have a key role in optimizing the experience of our users by making our platform even more engaging. We all have an eagerness to learn, we value quality, are team players, driven and we like to have fun while improving ourselves and our products. Will you join us for a healthier and happier world?

What You’ll Do
  • Develop new features and improve existing functionalities, taking into account scalability, feasibility, transferability and quality
  • Contribute with your knowledge of coding, architecture and development processes to squad and department-wide improvements
  • Collaborate with your squad and other colleagues to determine technical and functional requirements for new features
  • Participate in all relevant scrum rituals
  • Be a team player, coach and learn every day


Requirements

About You
  • 2+ years experience with PHP (prefered OOP & PHP7+)
  • Knowledge of database design
  • SQL coding experience (MySQL and NoSQL- MongoDB, Redis, etc)
  • Familiar with web technologies (HTML, CSS, Javascript, jQuery, AJAX, JSON, Bootstrap, VueJS)
  • Experience with Git
  • Strong communication skills in English
  • A degree in a related field
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Knowledge of Agile methodologies, such as Scrum


Even Better If You Have Experience With
  • Knowledge of other languages (Python, Java, Javascript)
  • Knowledge of Microservices architecture
  • Familiar with DevOps and automation tools like Kubernetes, CI/CD and docker
  • Experience working with VueJS


What We Offer
  • You’ll be joining a diverse and international team made up of over 20 nationalities across our offices in Amsterdam and Medellin, working in an easy-going and fun environment
  • As a scale-up, we offer great freedom and autonomy to take ownership of projects and to develop your skills and experience with us
  • We provide 25 paid holidays per year, holiday allowance and a pension plan
  • Our beautiful office in Amsterdam is located along the Knowledge Mile and has stunning views of the city. We’re also just a few minutes walk away from Amstel station, a key transport hub
  • If you apply from outside of the EU, we can support you with your visa application, and offer you a refund on your flight to Amsterdam
  • And there’s more: free gym membership and weekly crossfit classes, knowledge exchange sessions (pizza included!), Dutch-speaking courses, fresh fruit in the office, Friday drinks and plenty of other fun events with your colleagues


About Us

Virtuagym is a leading tech company providing innovative fitness software for gyms, personal trainers, and corporate health services. Virtuagym has grown into an all-in-one solution for client coaching, membership management, billing, scheduling, access control and more. It’s integrated mobile fitness apps offer solutions for exercise, nutrition guidance, progress tracking, and online coaching.

With 200+ employees across two offices in Europe and Latin America, Virtuagym supports more than 15 million end-users, 30,000+ trainers worldwide and over 6,000 health clubs, including Basic-Fit (NL), Xercise4Less (UK), various YMCA’s (USA), and XSport (USA).

With over 100% growth every year, we keep reinventing ourselves in the fast-paced fitness technology domain. While we are beyond the startup phase, we still cherish our start-up culture and non-corporate approach. At Virtuagym you get the opportunity to grow and we empower you to explore, learn and do great things as we conquer the world with our great solutions!

Ready To Join Us?

Please do not hesitate to apply. For any questions on the vacancy, please call the recruitment team at +31 20 808 2868.

Please note that we do not collaborate with third parties to fill this vacancy.

Java Software Engineer (Micro Electronics) (Software engineering, Computer science, Information Technology, microelectronics , Agile, Scrum, Java, J2EE, Product development, Equipment, Algorithm, UML) General Do you enjoy working within a high-tech organization and do you want to impact the future with your knowledge of software? This might be the next job for you? Organization The organization where the vacancy exists is a professional organization with an informal work environment, specialized in the development and manufacturing of high-tech equipment and machinery. Job Description You will be part of the software groups, which addresses the high-tech equipment stability and process control. You will create software in Java EE, contributing to the development of controller software in a Scrum / Agile way of working. Since you’ll be working on very advanced, cutting edge technology, where multiple teams and disciplines are involved, you’ll work in close collaboration with several teams to together deliver and integrate solutions to complex problems, as to enhance the control capability. You will work in close contact with Team leads and Architects. In this position you will act as software professional. You will apply software engineering practices such as implementation in Java, testing and integration on the computing platform. You will gain knowledge on complex mathematical control algorithms and the controller applications, estimation, optimization algorithms, and workflows. Education Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Electronics or Physics (with a focus on software). Experience Recent experience in programming in Java (EE); Experience in Object Oriented (OO) development; Experience in the development of technical software for hightech equipment is a pre; Experience in working in an Agile / Scrum; Willingness to further expand your knowledge on complex mathematical algorithms; Preferably knowledge of Swing and JavaFx . Personal skills We expect you to be a good communicator, team player, self-starter, to take initiative and to be result oriented. You have a good command of the English language, both in writing and in speech and are willing to learn the Dutch language. Offer A great job with one of our prominent clients Good salary conditions, career opportunities and excellent benefits. Conversion to the client after a period of secondment when performing to client satisfaction Our nice extras: discount on your health insurance premium, referral bonuses, other activities ( soccer tournament, Christmas reception etc.) Visa sponsorship and application for 30% ruling Working Conditions The right candidate will be provided a challenging and varied position in a professional, high-tech environment. An appropriate salary, future prospects and excellent benefits are evident. Interested? Do you feel you are the most suitable person for this position or do you have any further questions? Send your CV to or call 040-4015200 and ask for Steven Hendriks .

Description Your Responsibilities HousingAnywhere.com is the global booking platform for mid-term rental accommodation. Being a peer-to-peer marketplace, we create an experience that satisfies both sides of the rental accommodation market and creates a direct connection between tenants and landlords. HousingAnywhere.com is active in 100 countries and 400+ cities. We have partnered with 180+ universities worldwide and currently target the international student market while we are expanding to other audiences as well. In 2018, we have been honored by being the fastest growing propTech company in the Netherlands as part of the Technology Fast 50 ranking of Deloitte. Your goal would be to provide our users with a formidable experience when looking for a place to live. At the same time, you would be dealing with the interfaces that we provide to the advertisers who are offering their room. Eventually, we need to provide high-quality matching and drive trust between the marketplace participants. We think about these challenges every day, and we would like to invite you to think along and build a world-class product. Our Stack Our client-side app is built using technologies and tools like React, Redux, SASS/CSS-in-JS, TypeScript and Webpack. Our back-end is powered by Go (Golang) backed by a Postgres database and we’re moving to a service oriented architecture (microservices). The server components are hosted on a Google Cloud architecture that allows easy scaling. We've been using React, GraphQL and Golang in production environments since the early days. Our Team We're a team of 30 people (product Lead, product owners, front-end engineers, back-end engineers, QA engineers and UX/UI designers) passionate about what we do. To scale up, we are looking for experienced full stack engineers who have proven work experience in solving complex problems in the related domain. Foremost, we need seasoned Javascript developers who have experience with React (or a similar framework) and Go, Node (or other back-end languages) who have the capabilities to help us evolve and improve platform. You will solve complex challenges with the engineering team! Sounds challenging? Be part of building our startup!

Requirements Characteristics we are looking for in a Full Stack Developer:
  • As Product-oriented person: you love developing products that help people
  • You take responsibility for the quality of your work, you like test automation and you are interested in TDD best practices
  • Team player
  • Ability to find a clean and simple solution that could be easily adapted and scale as the business requirements evolve
  • Interest in new technologies Experience needed:
  • 5-10 years of relevant work experience
  • Excellent skills in Javascript, ideally with the whole Javascript stack (Node, React, etc)
  • An educational background in the field of Computer Science or similar is preferable, although passionate career changers are also welcome.
  • Experience with online marketplaces, service providers and API development is a bonus.
  • Previous experience working with Scrum or Agile
  • Code versioning in Git
  • Solid understanding of (web) user interface design and development.
  • Experience with at least one back-end language is required (Go will be an advantage). Benefits Cool things!
  • Be part of a dynamic and fast growing scaleup, where you can make a real impact.
  • Work with an awesome international team! Think 90 people from 25 different nationalities. It’s like being abroad while you’re in the office. Our office language is English as well.
  • Work in the amazing city of Rotterdam in an office with an amazing view! On top of this, you are one short train ride away from Amsterdam and The Hague, so weekend trips are easy peasy.
  • Friday Beers & Cheers! Get to know your colleagues over drinks while we celebrate our achievements every Friday.
  • A structured career ladder. Take control of your career and your growth within HousingAnywhere.
  • Budget for Dutch or English classes to help you kick off your stay in the Netherlands, and help you immerse into the Dutch culture.
  • Coming from abroad? No worries! We’ve got you covered, we’ll provide you with relocation & visa help.
  • And of course, money. Practical Info! Full-time position (40 hours a week). You will work from our office in Rotterdam, the Netherlands. Salary will match your experience. Starting: ASAP. Do you have more questions? Email Claire at [email protected]

listings.position: Vacature Sr / Lead Software Engineer ( C++ / Machine- / Motion Control) | Eindhoven - Eindhoven
listings.description: Technicus.nl We are Trinamics, a recruitment agency specialized in technical vacancies. We support our candidates in finding the right position at one of our clients in the Netherlands. We recruit both candidates from the Netherlands as well as the rest of the world. One of the reasons our employees choose to work via Trinamics is because of our personal approach throughout the whole recruitment process. But we do not stop there, you will have the same contact person your whole career at Trinamics supporting you any way they can. Next to this we always strive to make the best match possible, both on a technical as well as a personal level. If you would like to join Trinamics, but you are currently living abroad, we will naturally help you with the administrative, VISA, 30% and moving process. Introduction We are looking for a Senior or Lead Software Engineer to join one of our clients. Do you feel comfortable in a multicultural, high-tech environment? Would you like to develop software in a multidisciplinary group of people (Mechatronics, Electronics, Mechanics and of course Software)? Than we might be looking for you! Role description As a senior / lead software engineer you will get the chance to have an impact on the worldwide semiconductor industry. With your broad software experience you will get the chance to have a very diverse role within the software team. You will be responsible for the software architecture and implementation, but also for the testing, integration and partly maintenance of very complex machines. Within the team it is appreciated that you have a proactive attitude. For example you see it as a challenge to explore new tools and techniques to improve the software development process. Next to this we ask you to coach your junior colleagues in their development. The size of the software team that you will join is between 10 and 20 people. Your colleagues are used to applying the Agile Scrum methodology on a daily basis in their work.

Functie-eisen: On a technical level We are looking for a senior candidate (around 10 or more years of experience). The code base that our client uses is mainly based on C and C++, so we are looking for a candidate with broad experience in these languages. It helps if you also have some experience with Python or C#. The machines that you will get to develop software for have a lot of moving part at very high speed on a nanometer precision scale. So we are looking for you if you have experience with developing realtime software for moving part in a complex environment. Some different examples of this could be: you developed software for safety critical systems in the aerospace industry; you developed software for complex washing machines or you have developed machine control software. It is an advantages if you have experience with Agile software development, continuous integration and model driven design. On a personal level For this position it is important that you feel comfortable communicating on different levels within the organization. On one hand you will coach your junior colleagues, on the other hand it could be your responsibility to give some pushback on an architectural decision of a senior colleague. Keeping the software of high quality is important to you. If you have ideas on how to improve the software (process) you are it comes naturally to you to bring them forward within the organization. a8f5f167f44f4964e6c998dee827110c

Job Description

Are you ready for a new and exciting challenge at an international SaaS scale-up? We’re now looking for a talented Python Developer with 3+ years of experience to join our Software Development team in our Amsterdam HQ.

As our new Intermediate or Senior Python Developer you will be joining our extraordinary Red Squad. The squad's main focus is to ensure that our schedule solution becomes and stays the best in class. In the Red Squad you will be part of a dedicated and driven scrum team consisting of multiple back-enders, front-enders, and full stackers, a QA engineer and a Product Owner.

As a Python Developer at Virtuagym you will get the opportunity to play a key role in optimizing the experience of our 5,000 business clients and 15 million end-users. We all have an eagerness to learn, we value quality, are team players, driven and we like to have fun while improving ourselves and our products. Will you join us for a healthier and happier world?

What You’ll Do
  • Develop new features and improve existing functionalities, taking into account scalability, feasibility, transferability and code quality
  • Contribute with your knowledge of coding, architecture and development processes to squad and department-wide improvements
  • Collaborate with your squad and other professionals to determine technical and functional requirements for new features
  • Participate in all relevant scrum rituals
  • Be a team player, coach and learn every day


Requirements

About You
  • 3+ years experience with Python
  • Good software and database design skills (preferred OOP, SOLID, Design Patterns)
  • Experience with SQL and preferably NoSQL
  • Familiar with Flask, Python3, MongoDB
  • Experience working with Git, AJAX, JSON, JWT and RESTful-API patterns
  • Strong communication skills in English
  • A degree in a related field
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Knowledge of Agile methodologies, such as Scrum


Even Better If You Have Experience With
  • Knowledge of other languages (PHP, Java, Javascript)
  • Knowledge of Microservices architecture
  • Familiar with DevOps and automation tools like Kubernetes
  • Experience working with VueJS


What We Offer
  • You’ll be joining a diverse and international team made up of over 20 nationalities across our offices in Amsterdam and Medellin, working in an easy-going and fun environment
  • As a scale-up, we offer great freedom and autonomy to take ownership of projects and to develop your skills and experience with us
  • We provide 25 paid holidays per year, holiday allowance and a pension plan
  • Our beautiful office in Amsterdam is located along the Knowledge Mile and has stunning views of the city. We’re also just a few minutes walk away from Amstel station, a key transport hub
  • If you apply from outside of the EU, we can support you with your visa application, and offer you a refund on your flight to Amsterdam
  • And there’s more: free gym membership and weekly crossfit classes, knowledge exchange sessions (pizza included!), Dutch-speaking courses, fresh fruit in the office, Friday drinks and plenty of other fun events with your colleagues


About Us

Virtuagym is a leading tech company providing innovative fitness software for gyms, personal trainers, and corporate health services. Virtuagym has grown into an all-in-one solution for client coaching, membership management, billing, scheduling, access control and more. It’s integrated mobile fitness apps offer solutions for exercise, nutrition guidance, progress tracking, and online coaching.

With 200+ employees across two offices in Europe and Latin America, Virtuagym supports more than 15 million end-users, 30,000+ trainers worldwide and over 6,000 health clubs, including Basic-Fit (NL), Xercise4Less (UK), various YMCA’s (USA), and XSport (USA).

With over 100% growth every year, we keep reinventing ourselves in the fast-paced fitness technology domain. While we are beyond the startup phase, we still cherish our start-up culture and non-corporate approach. At Virtuagym you get the opportunity to grow and we empower you to explore, learn and do great things as we conquer the world with our great solutions!

Ready To Join Us?

Please do not hesitate to apply. For any questions on the vacancy, please call the recruitment team at +31 20 808 2868.

Please note that we do not collaborate with third parties to fill this vacancy.

We’re now looking for a talented PHP Developer with 2+ years of experience to join our Software Development team in our Amsterdam HQ. As a PHP Developer at Virtuagym you will be working in one of our web-based squads. Every squad is responsible for a specific part of our system, for instance Training and Nutrition, Communication and Engagement, Payments and Invoices, and Memberships and E-commerce. Each scrum team consists of back-enders, front-enders, and full stackers, a QA engineer and a Product Owner. As our new full-time PHP Developer you will have a key role in optimizing the experience of our users by making our platform even more engaging. You are a Senior Java developer that is driven by ambition. Always curious and wanting to learn all the time. During your day job as a consultant at one of our clients, but also at conferences, trainings and basically whenever you can.

You are experienced in the Java ecosystem and see software development as a craft that is never perfected. You like to work with others who feel that way too. This role is namely for you!

You Have
  • A bachelor or master’s degree in computer science / engineering
  • 5+ years’ experience as a software developer in the Java ecosystem
  • Outstanding coding skills: it always works!
  • The ambition to become to grow and learn to become the best software developer
  • An independent mindset: you don’t wait for a briefing to get something done. You already know what needs to be done and come up with the best solution
  • A good knowledge of databases (SQL and No-SQL databases)
  • Worked in Agile/Scrum/Kanban teams
  • Experience with working with microservices
  • Basic knowledge of the latest front-end frameworks (Angular, React, Vue.js)
  • Good skills in English (writing and speaking)
  • A curiosity to discover the latest technologies
  • The willingness to share your experience with other developers at conferences, meetups and/or in blogs
WHY CHOOSE FOR OUR CLIENT?
  • They are small company where you’ll work with like-minded passionate software developers and you feel appreciated for the work you do.
  • They work on the and most innovative and challenging projects in the Netherlands, using the latest cutting-edge technologies
  • They will help you to learn how to speak on conferences and meetups and we’ll mentor you to become a true software development expert
  • They will actively participating in various JUG’s and developer communities. We’re happy to introduce you to the most brilliant minds in the industry.
You’ll work with in an international environment with developers from all around the world. Currently: Australia, Russia, India, Turkey, Brazil, Poland, Brazil, Portugal

What You Will Get
  • A salary that matches your skills, experiences and ambitions
  • Personal development plan to become an expert in new technologies
  • Profit sharing regulation
  • 26 payed holidays
  • Educational budget of 3,000 euros per year
  • R&D Hackathon days with the team (multiple times of the year)
  • Work with the latest cutting-edge technologies at our clients
  • Dutch language courses for you and your family
  • Laptop of your own choice
  • Transportation budget
  • Pension scheme, based on your personal situation
  • If applicable: sponsorship for the visa application for you and your family
OUR CLIENT
is a Java consultancy company in Amsterdam of international developers, working on the most innovative and challenging projects. They are driven software engineers with a passion for technology. They bring together the best developers from all around the world. They love what they do and they practice what they preach. They are actively participating in meetup groups and developer communities in the Netherlands, because they believe in lifelong learning. To keep up with all rapid changes in software development, they challenge themselves to learn something new every day. They believe that you need to love your work and work on the projects you love. They share our passion for Java technology with each other, they work on the most challenging and innovative projects, they never stop learning and they go on many fun social activities together

We are looking for a Senior Python Developer with real passion for building next-generation web applications to join our back-end team. As a developer at Elements, you will work in a diverse team and implement rock solid and innovative solutions to create high quality web applications.

Who We Are

We are an enthusiastic team of over 60 professionals from all around the world, who share the love for technology and a ‘can do’ attitude. From our offices in Almere and Barcelona we work on a variety of projects for clients like KPN, Afterpay, Avrotros, Telfort, Powerpeers, KRO, Gamma and many more.

Check our current tech stack on stackshare.io/elements

What You Will Do

You will play an important role in making estimates and defining architecture, defining the structure for our projects and coming up with technical solutions. Most of the time, you will design and code these technical solutions, but testing your own work and the work of others is of course also involved. You will assist in defining database and (web) application design. Furthermore, as a Senior, you will support our Head of Technology and will be the go-to person in the development team. You will breathe the Elements' way of working and you will always be encouraged to make suggestions to improve it. Last but not least, we would love to see that you have a natural drive to stay up to speed with the latest technological innovations.

What You Need
  • At least a Bachelor degree in a related field
  • At least 3 years experience as a Python developer, preferably also with Django
  • Excellent coding skills and solid experience with relevant large-scale projects
  • Knowledge of Front-End technologies
  • Ability to architect an application from start to finish
  • Experience in working the Scrum way
  • Ability to coach and support team members during projects
  • Excellent English language and communication skills
  • Go-getter attitude, creative, flexible, accurate
  • Strong personality that knows how to approach and motivate people
  • Preferably you already live in the Netherlands, however, for a highly experienced and motivated candidate we might consider Visa sponsorship and relocation assistance


Benefits
  • You will be a part of our highly technically oriented team of developers, where you get to teach and learn at the same time
  • We provide you with lunch, snacks and unlimited freshly ground coffee every day
  • You will have flexible working hours and a possibility to occasionally work from home
  • We encourage you to visit events and/or take courses to keep up-to-date and gain new skills
  • And to top it off, what would work be like without fun? You could get your fair share at our regular company events and Friday beer & game afternoons, or by diving into the nostalgia of your childhood on our arcade machine


Do you see this role as a good match? Then we'd love to hear from you.

listings.position: Software/Mobile developer (OpenGL, C++, Vulkan, GTest, Gmock, iOS, Android)
listings.description: Software/Mobile developer (OpenGL, C++, Vulkan, GTest, Gmock, iOS, Android) Intro Are you a Software/Mobile developer with experience in the software domain looking for the next chapter in your career? Our partner, a multinational, active in the navigation industry is looking for a Software/Mobile developer to extend their team. Do you like to get the best out of yourself and your colleagues and prefer to work in an informal environment? This job opportunity might be very interesting for you! About our client Our client delivers several platforms, ranging from mobile devices to desktops and browsers. When you will work with our client you get to work on the rendering of the map but you will also get introduced to other parts of our clients navigation software to work on the services that provide the roads, traffic and routs. They are looking for Software/Mobile developer who will work in a software engineering scrum team. He or she should be able to support the team in verifying that the user stories comply with the Definition of Done and the software to be delivered is of sufficient quality to be released. Your challenge You will produce ‘simple’ code in a dynamic, divers and collaborative environment You will work on the line between the user and interface and the code, you appreciate the beauty of both You will constantly grow, led by your curiosity to grab the many development opportunities at TomTom and stay up to speed with the latest tools and techniques in an ever-changing technological landscape. Your profile You are a professional in C++ software development for mobile or embedded devices with strict power and memory constraints, and/or server-based solutions. You have the aspiration to be(come) an expert in computer graphics, in designing and developing visual simulations of complex data structures. You have hands-on experience with OpenGL (ES). Experience with Vulkan or Metal is a plus. You’ve got experience with automated testing, for example with GTest and GMock, You have experience with iOS or Android application development You have understanding of DevOps (bonus points) Education You finished a Bachelor or Master in Computer Science, mathematics or equivalent Interested? Do you feel you are the most suitable person for this position or do you have any further questions? Send your CV call 040-4015200 and ask for Mark Simons. We are here to guide engineers in the maze of vacancies to obtain a position to be proud of. Proud because it is at a leading company, because the new position increases own influence or because it’s the best fitting position in terms of content. Mechanical engineering, electrical engineering and software are the technical pillars of Trinamics, but their application is diverse. Because we know our clients and candidates well, we quickly see where someone would fit best. Once we find a position we remain involved in the process. We do this by, among other things, offering training and development programs. We offer extra guidance and our social network to talents who leave their homes in another country to realize their ambitions here. In our eyes, it is the only logical way to keep developing our technical talents. Every technical company wants to move forward as quickly as possible, to be leading. For that you need the best technical people. However, in the current market, talent is scarce and not always easy to find. Progress is also what drives Trinamics. With every good performance, we set a new bar to surpass. And we do that time and time again. Relocation support (where applicable): Seeing as Trinamics feels it is important you can fully focus on working in a new organization in a new role, next to adjusting to a new life in a new country and culture, we’re here to help you in a smooth relocation. We are experienced in assisting you on the visa application process, travel, short and long stay, 30% ruling (tax exemption) application, health insurance, setting up a bank account, Dutch language courses and (in case it’s needed) finding proper schooling for your child(ren).

listings.position: Server Side Software Engineer (Based in Bangkok,Thailand) Relocation Provided
listings.description:
A life less ordinary.

We’re not just talking about the location; as Asia’s fastest growing ecommerce hotel booking platform and the biggest pure Tech company in Thailand, you’ll use every last ounce of your Engineering talent at Agoda!

This is a full-time position working on site in our offices in Bangkok. We are hiring both junior and senior developers.

Relocation support and visa sponsorship available for international candidates.

Overview

Agoda is a global online accommodation reservations provider, a technology innovator, and a high-energy company based in the heart of Asia. With a network of over one million accommodation properties, including apartments, villas, homes and hotels backed by over 15 million real traveler reviews, Agoda helps other travelers find and explore new experiences in new destinations. Agoda is part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ:BKNG) - the world leader in online travel and related services.

Technology is not just what we do – it’s at the heart of who we are. We have a dynamic and a flat chain of command of a start-up, yet the capital to make things happen on a global scale. We love innovation and are putting new technologies to work to extend our lead on the competition.

Being a software engineer at Agoda isn’t just about developing software. It’s about being a center piece of the innovation and technical excellence that the rapidly changing field of online travel requires – you will be involved in the design and architecture, coding, testing and operations of our global-scale software systems. And you will be working with some of the smartest people on the planet who come from over 74 countries - It’s an incredible technical creative melting pot.


What We Are Looking For
  • 5+ years’ experience developing performance-critical applications that run in a production environment using one of the backend languages/frameworks such as .NET, .NET Core, Java, Scala, NodeJS, Go or Python.
  • Knowledge in one or more of the following: NoSQL technologies (CouchBase, ElasticSearch, Redis), Queueing system experience (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ).
  • Experience in physical architecture at scale, building resilient, no single point of failures, highly available solutions.
  • Understanding of monolithic and micro architectures and know how to get the best out of both.
  • You have RDBMS knowledge (SQL Server, Oracle, MySql or other)
  • Optional knowledge with client-side frameworks such as React, Angular, Vue etc
  • Knowledge in CI/CD solutions would be a plus
  • You love new technologies and approaches and want to use the best tools available. We want people who can help us continually evolve our stack.
  • You have a good command of the English language.
What Will Be New For You

We are looking for people who truly want to become full-stack engineers. This position is to join our website development team. While your current skills will be strengthening our server-side expertise, you will also have hands-on web technologies and frameworks such as ReactJS, Typescript, CSS/Html, client-side performance optimization, etc.

If you are passionate about expanding your horizon to full-stack engineer as you are passionate about server-side, this job is for you!

What We Can Offer
  • Work for a profitable business with the atmosphere of a fun start-up.
  • Work on interesting problems with a high degree of autonomy.
  • Competitive salary and benefits.
  • Role open to local and international applications – full visa sponsorship and relocate package available.
We are happy to receive CV's from both international & local applicants as we offer relocation assistance and visa sponsorship for eligible persons.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Are you passionate about Ruby and Rails? And interested to be a frontrunner in building a greenfield product that is disrupting global trade?

 

The head office of mine client is based in San Francisco, and they are extremely successful with their software plus overall proposition. This year venture capitalists backed my client with an additional 1 billion in funding. They are now scaling their software engineering teams globally, and Amsterdam is already their European head office. The time is now to also start building their engineering teams in Amsterdam. The teams in Amsterdam will have full ownership over new software products to be built, thus not acting on a blueprint from San Francisco….

 

You could be 1 of the first Seniors to join the Amsterdam engineering team, the goal is to quickly scale these new teams to 50 FTE in total. This will bring abundant opportunities if you would join now. You would be working with Ruby, Rails, React, GraphQL, PostgreSQL. Further down the road new services will be built on the JVM machine, thus experience & interest with JVM based languages is a big plus. Think: Clojure, Scala, Java…

 

My client is also dedicated in giving back to society, and they go to great lengths for this. They have Corporate Social Responsibility programs in place that amongst others support aid programs during big disasters.  

 

Keywords:

Ruby, Rails, React, GraphQL, PostgreSQL, Microservices, Scala, Java, Clojure.

 

Requirements:

  • Senior Developer Skills (Ruby, Scala, Java, Clojure)
  • Minimal 6 years experience
  • Experience with building Enterprise Grade software products.
  • Big fan of Agile, Scrum, Kanban
  • Quality Mindset: you write your own Unit & integration tests
  • Being flexible and balanced, ready to constant changes and innovation
  • Excellent communication in English

 

Next to the interesting and challenging work, you will work together with best of breed engineers, and experience a great company culture.

 

Excellent salary up to 100k. Visa Sponsorship. 

 

Interested? Please contact to me on stephan@doghouse-recruitment.nl

*******for English, please scroll down*******


We zijn opzoek naar een Python/Django Developer voor ons team in Almere. Iemand die ons team versterkt met passie voor het vak en de wil om altijd te leren. Je gaat aan de slag in een divers team en ontwikkelt samen met anderen gebruiksvriendelijke en innovatieve oplossingen voor onze klanten. Oplossingen die onze klanten verder helpen!


WIE WE ZIJN

Wij zijn een onafhankelijk, no-nonsense bureau met 65 Elementeers uit alle windstreken, werkend vanuit locaties in Almere en Barcelona. Samen werken we voor een diverse groep klanten aan digitale oplossingen. In ons werk worden we gedreven door mensen, vakmanschap en vooruitgang.

Voor onze huidige tech stack kun je kijken op stackshare.io/elements


WAT GA JE DOEN?

Samen met je team maak je inschattingen en bepaal je de architectuur van een project. Ook denk je mee over de juiste aanpak en doe je voorstellen voor technische oplossingen binnen de uitdagingen die er liggen. Het meeste van je tijd ben je code aan het ontwerpen en schrijven om deze oplossingen tot leven te brengen. Je snapt de werkwijze van Elements en maakt deze je helemaal eigen maar je bent zeker niet bang om verbeteringen hier in voor te stellen. Van nature doe jij je best om bij te blijven met de laatste ontwikkelingen in je vakgebied.


OVER WELKE KENNIS EN VAARDIGHEDEN BESCHIK JE?

  • Ruime ervaring met development in een professionele omgeving, bij voorkeur in een project organisatie
  • Ervaring met en kennis van development in Python/Django
  • Kennis van JavaScript, FrontEnd technologieen, GIT, CI en Linux
  • Ervaring met het werken in agile projecten (Scrum, Kanban)
  • Uitstekende beheersing van de Engelse taal, zowel spreken als schrijven en goede communicatieve vaardigheden
  • Creatief, flexibel, open-minded en gericht op samenwerken.


WAT HEBBEN WIJ JE TE BIEDEN?

  • We bieden je aan om onderdeel te worden van ons team van developers, een groep mensen met een sterke technische achtergrond en enthousiasme voor het vak. Je kan van ze leren en ze staan open voor wat jij te vertellen hebt.
  • Als je hard werkt, krijg je honger! We bieden je een uitgebreide lunch met veel gezonde keuzes, een kast vol zoete en hartige snacks, koffie van versgemalen bonen en verschillende soorten thee.
  • Je kunt je tijd flexibel indelen. We zien je het liefst op kantoor maar als het nodig is kun je vanuit huis werken.
  • We stimuleren je om op de hoogte te blijven van de laatste ontwikkelingen binnen je vakgebied door het bezoeken van bijvoorbeeld conferenties of het volgen van trainingen.
  • Elke vrijdag sluiten we de week af met “beers & boardgames” en we organiseren regelmatig andere leuke uitjes en activiteiten.


Spreekt dit je aan? Dan horen we heel graag van jou.



*******English description*******


We are looking for a new colleague with a passion for building next-generation web applications. As a Python/Django Developer at Elements, you work in a diverse team and implement innovative solutions to create high quality web applications. Solutions that help our clients move forward!


WHO WE ARE

We are an independent, no-nonsense agency with around 65 Elementeers from all around the world, who share the love for technology and a 'can do' attitude. From our offices in Almere and Barcelona we work on a variety of digital solutions for our clients. In our work we are driven by people, craft and progress.

Check our current tech stack on stackshare.io/elements


WHAT YOU WILL DO

You will collaborate with the team to make estimates and define architecture and also participate in defining the project structure and coming up with technical solutions. You will spend most of your time designing and coding these technical solutions. Furthermore, you will breathe the Elements' way of working and you will always be encouraged to make suggestions to improve it. Last but not least, we would love to see that you have a natural drive to stay up to speed with the latest technological innovations.


WHAT YOU NEED

  • Solid experience with professional programming and development of relevant projects
  • Experience in Python/Django development
  • Knowledge of JavaScript, FrontEnd technologies, GIT, CI en Linux
  • Experience with working in agile project teams (Scrum, Kanban)
  • Excellent English language (both written and spoken) and communication skills
  • Creative, flexible, open-minded and a teamplayer
  • Preferably you already live in the Netherlands, however, for a highly experienced and motivated candidate we might consider Visa sponsorship and relocation assistance


WHAT WE CAN OFFER

  • We offer you a place in our highly technically oriented team of developers, where you get to teach and learn at the same time
  • We provide you with lunch, snacks, tea and unlimited freshly ground coffee every day
  • You will have flexible working hours and a possibility to occasionally work from home
  • We encourage you to visit events and/or take courses to keep up-to-date and learn new skills
  • And to top it off, what would work be like without fun? You could get your fair share at our regular company events and Friday beer & game afternoons, or by diving into the nostalgia of your childhood on our arcade machine


Do you believe that we could be a good match? Then we'd love to hear from you!

• If you are an experienced full stack developer ready to take on a senior role, and you want to relocate to The Netherlands: you have come to the right place. Emakina is looking for a Lead Developer.** About the Lead Developer role At Emakina you get to work with a range of technologies like .net, java, javascript and Salesforce Commerce Cloud (a SaaS e-commerce platform) together with best of class agile tools like Jira, Stash (git), and Bamboo for continuous integration and deployment. As a Lead Developer, you spend between 40% to 80% of your time working on user stories in the sprint. The remaining is spent on a combination of architecture, consulting and coaching fellow team members. We trust you to make decisions that help our clients forward. We give you the freedom to be solution oriented. With that comes the ability to explain your choices to different target audiences and the ability to set and manage client expectations. You understand the complex challenges that lie behind a business case, plus the experience of our ultimate client: the end user. You’ll be working on major projects – with budgets to match – at the very core of our clients’ business. Your vision leads the way and you are comfortable communicating this vision with all stakeholders involved, be it from the customer or your own colleagues.

    • Your main responsibilities:
  • You are responsible for the technical delivery of the platform.
  • You define large-scale web-based solutions and guide a focused and dedicated team of talented developers to bring them to life.
  • You help different specialists to work together and excel.
  • You continuously develop your soft- and hard skills. You share your knowledge with the team and inspire them with your new know-how.
  • You work with multidisciplinary teams and you work agile. The way we work The agile way of working is embedded throughout the organisation – whether it be strategy, concept, tech or design projects. With solidly established processes that let you focus your full attention and expertise on what you do best. We believe in delivering our projects on time, and in accordance with the customer needs, whilst having fun. Challenging projects, focussed on one customer at the time.

    About the work environment Emakina, located in Amsterdam, is a friendly, informal workplace where you can work with some of the biggest brands and e-commerce retailers in Europe. You’ll work with dynamic professionals and ego-free team players who value personal initiative and development. You can count on a competitive salary, knowledge sharing (through our Nerd Summits, books and passionate conversations with other experts) all within an inspiring international environment. We have over 20 different nationalities at our office. We believe that to be able to be on top of your game at work, you need a healthy work-life balance. We care about your well-being. If you’d like some time to spend with your family, on your hobby or something else, there’s always the opportunity to discuss a 32, 36 or 40 hour contract. Also, for parents with children under the age of 8 there’s the option to take parental leave. To sweeten the deal we also have plenty of extracurricular activities from ski trips to beach barbecues or trips around the canals with the company boat. Every Friday afternoon we head up to the 4th floor to start the weekend off with some drinks. Relocation to Amsterdam, The Netherlands If you come to Amsterdam, we will try to make your relocation process as smooth as possible. We will help you (and your family) with flights, visa-applications, the 30%-facility and more. Read the interview with Alon on his relocation process.

    Sound interesting? Send us your CV or click below to apply. Not sure yet? Chat with Seyma on +31 (0)20 463 77 66.

listings.position: Vacature Sr / Lead Software Engineer ( C++ / Machine
listings.description:
Beschrijving functie
We are Trinamics, a recruitment agency specialized in technical vacancies. We support our candidates in finding the right position at one of our clients in the Netherlands. We recruit both candidates from the Netherlands as well as the rest of the world. One of the reasons our employees choose to work via Trinamics is because of our personal approach throughout the whole recruitment process. But we do not stop there, you will have the same contact person your whole career at Trinamics supporting you any way they can. Next to this we always strive to make the best match possible, both on a technical as well as a personal level.
If you would like to join Trinamics, but you are currently living abroad, we will naturally help you with the administrative, VISA, 30% and moving process.

Introduction
We are looking for a Senior or Lead Software Engineer to join one of our clients. Do you feel comfortable in a multicultural, high-tech environment? Would you like to develop software in a multidisciplinary group of people (Mechatronics, Electronics, Mechanics and of course Software)? Than we might be looking for you!

Role Description

As a senior / lead software engineer you will get the chance to have an impact on the worldwide semiconductor industry.
With your broad software experience you will get the chance to have a very diverse role within the software team. You will be responsible for the software architecture and implementation, but also for the testing, integration and partly maintenance of very complex machines. Within the team it is appreciated that you have a proactive attitude. For example you see it as a challenge to explore new tools and techniques to improve the software development process. Next to this we ask you to coach your junior colleagues in their development.
The size of the software team that you will join is between 10 and 20 people. Your colleagues are used to applying the Agile Scrum methodology on a daily basis in their work.

Eisenpakket
On a technical level
We are looking for a senior candidate (around 10 or more years of experience).
The code base that our client uses is mainly based on C and C++, so we are looking for a candidate with broad experience in these languages. It helps if you also have some experience with Python or C#.
The machines that you will get to develop software for have a lot of moving part at very high speed on a nanometer precision scale. So we are looking for you if you have experience with developing realtime software for moving part in a complex environment. Some different examples of this could be: you developed software for safety critical systems in the aerospace industry; you developed software for complex washing machines or you have developed machine control software.
It is an advantages if you have experience with Agile software development, continuous integration and model driven design.
On a personal level
For this position it is important that you feel comfortable communicating on different levels within the organization. On one hand you will coach your junior colleagues, on the other hand it could be your responsibility to give some pushback on an architectural decision of a senior colleague.
Keeping the software of high quality is important to you. If you have ideas on how to improve the software (process) you are it comes naturally to you to bring them forward within the organization.

Taalvaardigheid
Vereist: Engels
Handig om te kunnen: Nederlands

For our client, a high tech dynamic technical company, we are looking for several Software Engineers with C++, Java and Python experience with a background in the high tech sector.

Organization

Function

As the machine is an extremely complex system, it is crucial that data is available with which system performance can be monitored and measured. The source team provides the mechanisms to do this in a controlled, structured way while keeping security and performance (data load) in mind.

As a software engineer you will work in a team reporting to your team lead. This team uses Agile/Scrum during development. You will have close collaboration with your architect and peers. To come to the right solutions, you are also required to discuss requirements with our stakeholders, for this you need to be pro-active and be able to find your way in the organization. Next to creating new functionality, the work consists of troubleshooting and refactoring existing software.

Main Responsibilities

  • Write & update required documentation (design, test, etc.)

Requirements

Bachelor, Master, PDEng, PhD degree in Computer Science, Embedded Systems or equivalent
2-5 years experience in a technical product development environment
Knowledge about the software development process and tools
Experience with C++, Java and Python

Good salary conditions, career opportunities and excellent benefits

listings.position: XL | Senior Full Stack Developer with DBA | Utrecht | Enterprise Software
listings.description:
Welcome and congratulations for clicking on this! (^.^)

If you’re sitting comfortably, let me paint a picture for you: imagine waking up excited every morning to go to the office. Sounds far-fetched, right? Well not anymore. Not when it is a cool, modern office, in an open-space with a bunch of cool dudes and dudettes from all over the world, doing their magicto deliver software applications. As a collective, you work for an enterprise DevOps platform adopted by the largest and most demanding companies in the world, providing them with the intelligence, automation and control they need to deliver software faster and with less risk. You must know you will be a part of a team that includes some of the early DevOps visionaries and leaders who literally wrote the book on Continuous Delivery.

Don’t get me wrong, your colleagues are a cocktail of nationalities, who work hard, but partyharder, and who will most likely adopt you in their shenanigans as well. What else is fun about the team and the company? Read until the end.

What will your role in all this be, you ask?
You would join the release orchestration product development team. You will plan, design, develop and test new features of the flagship release orchestration product. But come on, you already have that under your belt. And I’m sure you will also be excited to know you will do that as a member of the Scrum team, focusing on developing software used for building and delivering high quality enterprise products in a parallel development environment.

“Yes, yes” you must say, “but what about the actual responsibilities?”
  • You’re planning, designing, implementing and testing new product features like a boss;
  • You perform design, development and support of existing and new products as if you were born to do it;
  • You understand product requirements in order to design new features, because duuh… (no, this job description was not provided by Captain Obvious even if it may seem so);
  • You help support production code and systems, because you’re cool like that;
  • You participate in design discussions and code reviews (trust me, those won’t be meetings that could have been E-mails);
  • You interact with the internal customers, because you’re Batman, and you can be a people person as well as a badass.
  • You will report to the Chapter Lead.
“OK. I can do all that!” I hear you say. Awesome sauce. “What do I need to have to apply?”
  • A must is a minimum of 10 years of professional Java software development;
  • A proven ability to design and develop complex applications, a self-starter;
  • Experience with either Scala or AngularJS;
  • A few years experience as a Database Administrator – it can be included in your total of 10 years of software development;
  • Demonstrated understanding of Agile/Scrum;
  • Fluent in English (written and verbal);
  • Computer Science – Eng. University diploma or B.S. with 5-6 years of work experience or M.S. in Computer Science with 3-4 years of experience preferred but equivalent experience/education is acceptable;
  • Willingness to relocate to Utrecht, Netherlands, but could also be located in Burling, MA, USA (Boston area).

Well, If You Read So Far (you Get a Cookie) But You Also Get To Know What’s In It For You

Sounds great so far, doesn’t it.
  • You will work for a company founded in the Netherlands and with HQ in the US, with additional offices can be found in the UK, France, Germany and India.
  • People! – super-dedicated wizards that love to innovate products;
  • Passion! – start-up mentality with passion for the product definition, marketing, sales and support;
  • Technology! – tools built on Scala and AngularJS. Puppet, SaltStack, Docker, Cloud – you will work with all of them;
  • Agility! – an agile way of working that gives an edge in bringing elegantly simple tools to market, tools that can compete and win in the market.
  • Benefits!
  • Competitive salary according to experience, relocation package, VISA assistance, a top-of-the-line laptop, mobile phone and all the books you can read! You will have all the tools you need to shine bright like a star (diamonds don’t shine, Rihanna! They reflect!);
  • Training budget of 3500 EUR per employee per year; You will find a lot of accent on tech conferences and podcasts, meet-ups and always in the news with the latest tech trends;
  • Foosball? Or Never-Have-I-Ever in the breaks? I know it’s a drinking game but I already warned you your team is a bunch of party animals;
  • A sweet garden with a swing in it if you feel the need to go cry somewhere and feel cradled by the sweet release of… gravity? I don’t know, man. I don’t know.
  • Surinamese food personally delivered by the chef’s son, a cool dude who is in the same building and also helps bring in new awesome people like you to the team.
So, if by now you feel like you kind of already belong in this team, or should at least give this a try to see who these cool people are, either apply here or send your CV to me at click apply. I promise I’ll make it fun.

Cookie for reading this far. Cheers!

listings.position: Senior Software Engineer (DevOps and Process Optimization/Automation)
listings.description:
Working Location: Bangkok, Thailand

This is a full time, permanent role in Bangkok, Thailand. Full relocation and Visa sponsorship provided.

Agoda is looking for a unique kind of software engineers to solve Agoda's unique problem. Those that has zero tolerance for inefficiencies in software development. Who can see beyond the norm and assist Agodians in releasing the best software impossibly fast, while impossibly safe.

The team is directly responsible in leading DevOps culture by example and developing workflow automation at Agoda.

Specifically, our work includes a scalable cluster of docker containers. A whole virtualized environment of Asia’s leading booking site in a laptop. An obliteration of conventional processes and establishing automated tools and systems. A robust event queue to track movement of features from developer commits to production. A scalable automated delivery system to support a growing websites, growing customers and growing number of engineers.

We are looking for individuals who share our vision and values to bring their best in solving these challenges together

Key Traits
  • Willing to learn
  • Zero tolerance for process inefficiency
  • Always look for opportunities to optimize and automate daily workflow
  • See beyond the current norm of operation, then design and implement solutions in stages
  • Great communication skills in building culture for other engineers to do the same


Requirements
  • Proficient in any one programming language (e.g. Golang, Python, JavaScript)
  • Hands-on experience with the whole SDLC: Requirement, Design, Code, Test, Deploy
  • Deep understanding of the computer science and its application
  • Understand VMs, docker containers and their applications
  • Understanding of container orchestration and its challenges (e.g. Kubernetes, Helm)
  • Hands on experiences with Agile practices: XP, Scrum, TDD
  • Business-level English (written and spoken)

Bonuses
  • Experienced in large scale distributed system
  • CI: TeamCity, Jenkins
  • Experience with configuration management: Puppet, Chef, Ansible
