  • Experience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systems.
  • Hands on experience working with big data framework like Spark/Hadoop.
  • Experience in data science for e-commerce.

listings.position: Volunteer Knowledge Management Specialist (Spanish) - Volunteer in Honduras - Cuso International
listings.description:
Location Comayaguela, Honduras

Start Date Aug - Oct 2019 (flexible)

Length of Placement 7 Months

Language Requirements English, Spanish

Open to Canadian Citizens and Permanent Residents only

The Volunteer’s Role

As the Knowledge Management Specialist, you will use your technical skills to support the Instituto Nacional de la Mujer (INAM) staff in the area of knowledge and database management to improve how information is saved and retrieved. You will work with INAM staff to develop procedures, guidelines, and tools for compiling, storing, measuring, analyzing, reporting volunteer data. The expectation of this role will be the enhancement of how INAM monitors and evaluates the impact it is making through its activities.

The ideal candidate will also possess an interest in supporting female empowerment through improved gender equality & social inclusion. INAM is an autonomous institution focused on coordinating advocacy work related to female issues and their barriers to economic growth. If you are passionate about women’s issues and would like to support INAM’s important mandate, this is the perfect opportunity for you!

Be part of this initiative by sharing your knowledge management skills, and let’s make a difference together!

As a Volunteer, You Will
  • Review and familiarize yourself with INAM’s existing knowledge & database management practices
  • Assist INAM in developing systems, procedures, forms for collecting, storing, analyzing, measuring and reporting data
  • Train and mentor INAM staff on effective data management
  • Create a knowledge and database management manual for INAM staff
  • Support in the delivery of workshops, networking events and activities of INAM.
Essential Academic Qualifications
  • University and/or College degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Business Administration Communications or another related field of study.
Essential Professional Background
  • 2-3 years’ professional experience working in database and knowledge management
  • Understanding of participatory approaches and training skills
  • Experience preparing professional documents and reports
  • Experience supporting technical aspects of workshops, meetings, and training sessions
Support Package
  • Modest monthly living allowance (varies depending country)
  • Accommodation while in placement
  • Return airfare and visa/work permit costs
  • Cost of required vaccinations, antimalarial medication and health insurance
  • Pre-departure training and in-country orientation
  • Travel and accommodation for reintegration debriefing weekend
  • Access to Employee Assistance Program while in placement and upon return
  • Travel and accommodation for the pre-departure training course and for in-country orientation (more details below)
Apply on our website: https://cusointl.org/2WJuBE0

listings.position: Head of Data Science and Insights - Role based in Berlin at Deep Blue Recruitment
listings.description:
Deep Blue Recruitment are currently working with one of the most successful FinTech companies in Europe that are looking for a Head of Data Science and Insights to join their team in Berlin.

You will be a key part of their leadership team and will have a significant impact on the future direction of the business and the way in which they harness data.

These will be your tasks
  • You lead and develop your team to validate, interpret, and provide insights in dashboards, reports, and presentations for all departments as well as the management team.
  • You use data and information visualisation to actively address unanswered business issues and generate business insights that push the business forward.
  • You provide data mining, pattern and root cause analyses to help business units understand areas of untapped opportunity and develop your team in this direction.
  • You move their BI department to the next level and start to design technical solutions for decision systems and the development of modelling algorithms to be deployed to production.
  • You build, manage, and develop a team of Data Analysts, and Data Scientists.
  • You set a vision, establishing a data-driven culture, and fostering the use of data to inform and make key business decisions


Requirements
  • You have 5+ years of experience leading a data and analytics practice, delivering reporting, insights, and optimisation across a wide variety of businesses.
  • You have played a strategic role collecting, managing and analysing data for different functions incl. marketing, product, operations, and finance.
  • You have a passion for research and data and are highly skilled in performing quantitative analyses related to business and department performance.
  • You are passionate about the inner workings of data technologies, have an understanding of A/B testing as well as vast knowledge in the identification of metrics that drive the long-term health of the business.
  • You understand analytics methodologies and emerging trends, including knowing the best tools to deliver the insights required. You work to innovate our delivery experiences by staying ahead of the curve in delivery offerings and solutions.


Benefits
  • Get paid a competitive salary with stock options
  • Optional German language courses
  • Full support to grow and take leadership from day one
  • Work in a beautiful office building located on the riverfront
  • You have the option to take your dog to work!
  • Relocation and visa support if needed

This is a permanent position and we are looking for someone to start immediately - apply today!

listings.position: Anti-Money Laundering, Forensic Services - Senior Associate
listings.description:
Line of Service
Advisory

Industry/Sector
Not Applicable

Specialism
Fraud, Investigations & Regulatory Enforcement (FIRE)

Management Level
Senior Associate

Job Description & Summary

A career in our Forensic Services practice, within Forensic Accounting services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients understand where they might have vulnerabilities and develop solutions to manage the risks involved. We prevent, respond to and remediate a wide range of business threats, risks and complex issues.

Our forensic specialists provide solutions and support for clients dealing with regulatory and crisis situations. As part of the team, you’ll help provide support to our clients who wish to investigate potential financial crime, support clients responding to regulatory enquiries, deal with cybersecurity breaches and provide expert advice and opinions in legal proceedings. You’ll also help clients review and remediate systems and controls to prevent further issues.

To really stand out and make us ﬁt for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be an authentic and inclusive leader, at all grades/levels and in all lines of service. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.

Responsibilities

PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to

As a Senior Associate, you’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution.

  • Use feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas.
  • Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities and coach to help deliver results.
  • Develop new ideas and propose innovative solutions to problems.
  • Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current trends in business area.
  • Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.
  • Share relevant thought leadership.
  • Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing others.
  • Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality, diverse relationships.
  • Uphold the firm’s code of ethics and business conduct.

    • Requirements
    • Bilingual French and English is mandatory
    • An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work
    • Knowledge of financial services industry, financial products, and monetary instruments
    • Ability to provide options and recommendations to address business needs and manage deliverables
    • Knowledge of financial crimes (e.g., AML, fraud) and relevant regulatory compliance (i.e., PCMLTFA)
    • Understand AML technical components such as control list filtering, customer risk scoring, transaction monitoring, case management workflow, and regulatory reporting (i.e., STR)
    • Familiarity with industry standard AML platforms is an asset (e.g., Oracle FCCM, Actimize, Detica, SAS, Verafin, etc)
    • Knowledge of data analytics approaches (e.g., cluster analysis, K-mean, sampling methods, etc)
    • Ability to use advanced functions in SQL, SAS/R/Python
    • Minimum 3 years of experience in AML and financial crimes including client-facing roles and responsibilities
    • Minimum Bachelor's Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, or any related field
    • CAMS certification is an asset
    This role does not support completion of the Canadian CPA designation.

    Why you’ll love working for PwC
    We want you to love every (if not, almost every) minute of your career, having said this, we get it. Each life stage we go through comes with a new set of priorities and demands. This is why we support you through a range of financial and non-financial rewards and benefits, so regardless of your situation, there’s something for everyone.

    Leading Benefits For Our Permanent Staff Include
    • A competitive compensation package
    • Sponsored investments, pensions and saving plans with matching firm contributions
    • Flexible working
    • PwC FlexBenefits, for personalised medical & dental coverage, including enhanced mental health benefit
    • Every day recognition and real time appreciation through our rewards and recognition program
    • Dress for your day with our flexible dress environment
    • Health, wellness and fitness perks
    • Family-friendly benefits, including maternity and parental leave policies and support networks to help you prepare for your successful return to work
    • Adoption/surrogacy benefits
    • Back-up child and elder care support
    • Career defining project work and international experience
    • Development opportunities including learning on the job, formal learning, learning from others and access to “Vantage” our digital learning system
    • Award winning programs including “Women in Leadership” and “Enhanced Pursuit Program”
    • A coach to help develop skills, diversify experiences and achieve career aspirations

    Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)

    Degrees/Field Of Study Required

    Degrees/Field of Study preferred:

    Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)

    Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)

    Travel Requirements

    Up to 20%

    Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?
    No

    Government Clearance Required?
    No

    Job Posting End Date

    PwC is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.

Role: Lead Data Engineer

Industry: FinTech

Salary: Up to €85,000


This company will completely revolutionise the industry in the next couple of years. Looking to expand their data and insights team and already considered to be one of the biggest disrupters of the FinTech space.


Currently challenged with preparing the data environment for their hypergrowth, the goal here is to drive the data engineering team to build the best possible inhouse data pipelines, ETL processes, data models and DWH.


What you do:

Own the company's event pipeline and data lake, work on your own teams technical strategy (closely with product and data analytics), develop and improve data and analytics platform, ensure data quality/accuracy/reliability, maintain APIs and microservices, implement continuous integration and deployment processes, and productionize machine learning code.


Experience:

  • 3+ years leading an engineering team
  • 7+ years in a similar position
  • University degree in Computer Science (or related)


Need to know how to:

  • Handle event driven pipelines
  • Build and support high scalable big data platforms


Skills:

  • Python development
  • Scrum and agile development processes/methodologies
  • Git, Continuous Integration and TDD


What we give you:

  • A competitive salary with stock options
  • Opportunities to work remote and flexible working hours
  • German language course
  • Relocation and visa support
  • Bring your buddy to work - all dogs welcome!



Or to apply directly send CV to rebecca@alldus.com

To strengthen our international team in Berlin, we are offering a full-time position as


Content Executive (m/f/d)


Retailers face unique challenges - we support them with technology-led solutions. Crealytics is a customer-centric organization: our data-driven, proprietary technology aids some of the world's biggest eCommerce players including Foot Locker, ASOS, and s.Oliver. Crealytics’ Product & Technology specialists are key to this. From design and engineering to data science, they work closely with our Digital Marketing and Business Intelligence teams. We employ over 150 experts across our Berlin, London, Passau and New York City offices. And we’re looking to expand. If you’re interested in sharpening your area of expertise while learning new skills, we’d love to hear from you. 



The core of your role as Content Executive is to attract site visitors and support lead generation efforts. You do so by producing targeted content through search, social media, third parties and outreach. 


This role suits someone with innovative ideas, who has a passion for enhancing existing standards and enjoys collaborating across departments. They show a keen interest in all things related to technology and digital marketing.  



// Your responsibilities


  • As Contenct Executive, you maintain and manage an automated content marketing machine with a view to driving and qualifying leads
  • You distribute and report upon content across multiple channels
  • You build up our partnerships with influencers and stay on top of relevant news, events and conversations 
  • You communicate the strategy internally and educate the company on the importance of quality content
  • You conduct internal and external research to identify key insights, trends and strategies that are relevant to the company’s mission
  • You maintain a deep familiarity with social media management, including audience engagement, tracking, and reporting 


// Your profile


  • You have 1 to 3 years of experience as a content writer and/or B2B marketer 
  • You have successfully managed campaigns on social media or Google AdWords to drive leads in a B2B environment
  • You are an engaging writer who can define and create audience-facing material, using insights gleaned from a range of specialists within the company 
  • You are familiar with a diverse set of content executions, including website content, white papers, case studies, social media content, and blogging
  • You have experience planning for and executing promotional content for events
  • You have a familiarity with WordPress or other web-based publishing platforms as well as with marketing automation products such as Marketo, Drip, Hubspot or similar
  • You have perfect written English and know how to craft information with your target audience in mind 
  • Ideally, you have a basic understanding of the Retail Marketplace


// What we offer


  • Appraisal Interviews - In your regular appraisal interviews you’ll learn more about your strengths, explore areas of growth, and discuss your career development.
  • Company Socials - We’re all about combining work and fun. Every year we get the whole company together for a company outing to discuss strategy over barbecue and beer.
  • Conferences - Learn from industry experts and discover the latest trends by attending one of many domestic and international conferences.
  • Development plan - At Crealytics you’ll never stop learning, which is why we offer an elaborate professional development plan. Follow our set career programs or adapt them to your individual career goals.
  • Dogs allowed - Don’t leave poor Fido at home! Our office is dog-friendly :-)
  • Feedback culture - Communication isn’t a one-way street. At Crealytics we value what you have to say. Have an idea for how we can improve? Share it with our management team through employee surveys or end-of-year one-on-ones. It’s up to you!
  • Fitness - A healthy mind starts with a healthy body. We offer our employees a selection of partnerships with fitness studios and sports memberships.
  • Flexible working hours - Not a morning person? Want to be home when your kids get off school? We understand! Flexible working hours allow you to pursue a Work-Life balance that suits your needs.
  • Food and drinks - Craving vitamins or caffeine? Just stop by our kitchen and grab some fresh fruit, a nice cup of cappuccino, or enjoy a relaxing beer after work.
  • Game rooms - Need a quick break? Head over to the game room and challenge one of your fellow Crealytees to a set of table tennis, a game of foosball, or try your luck on our video game console.
  • Headhunting bonus - Inspire your friends, family, neighbors, or the people you meet in a park and get up to 3.000 € if we hire a new Crealytee referred by you.
  • International environment - Not from around here? Neither are most of us! We’ve got employees from over 40 countries helping us run international campaigns all over the world.
  • International opportunities - Internationalize your career. If you find a Crealytics job in another city or country, we’ll help you move there.
  • Language courses - Want to brush up on your language skills? Give one of our free language classes a try.
  • Lunch roulette - This is a fantastic opportunity to get in touch with all your colleagues. Everyone interested will be randomly sorted into small groups to go out for lunch together.
  • Onboarding mentorship - From day one you’ll be assigned your very own mentor. They will act as your guide, answering all your questions as you settle into life at Crealytics.
  • Orientation week - Get off to a great start! The Crealytics orientation week is an excellent opportunity to learn more about our company, explore our products, strengthen your communication skills, and meet the management.
  • Pension scheme - In addition to the statutory pension scheme, we offer you a non-binding retirement plan for your specific situation - subsidized by Crealytics of course.
  • Relocation - Paid accommodation, as well as experienced “relocation buddies,” guide you through your visa application.
  • Teambuilding - Bond with your teammates with an activity you’ll all enjoy. Each team gets a yearly incentive budget to do whatever they want.
  • Training - We offer more than 60 wide-ranging internal and external trainings and workshops. Improve existing skills or learn something entirely new using our dedicated training budget.
  • Transparency - You deserve to know how we’re doing as a company. Join our quarterly meetings and strategy sessions to find out about current business figures, product updates, and the company roadmap.

 

Join our team and become part of our success story!

Do you want to join a team of entrepreneurs from over 50 different nationalities? To work in an environment powered by passion where no two days are the same?


At trivago we use the latest innovative technologies to empower our users to find their ideal hotel 100 times a second, across 55 different locales world-wide and in 33 different languages.


We're looking for a highly-driven and strategic person to take ownership of the field of advertiser analytics, focusing on understanding and leveraging advertiser data! The goal of our team is to monitor the marketplace and take pro-active steps towards improving it, as well as provide reliable and accurate metrics to gain insights into advertisers' behaviour.


To reach this goal, we will need your help to leverage the power of advanced algorithms, devise new and efficient logging solutions, and investigate outliers and correlations in the advertisers' data. As part of these topics, you'll develop new and more flexible detection models for our internal anomaly detection system. You'll be the go-to-person for a small team of dedicated, highly skilled developers, data scientists and data engineers that moves at a high pace. Your focus will be developing roadmaps and milestones with your team, aligning with stakeholders and prioritizing the work at hand.


Ready for the challenge? Then we want to hear from you!


What you'll do:

  • Keep on developing the vision for the team further.
  • Create the roadmap for this project: Gather the requirements and prioritize them.
  • Provide visibility to stakeholders into the team's progress and impact on the timeline of delivery during development cycles.
  • Hold important discussions with your stakeholders and win them over with your ideas.
  • Facilitate stand-ups, sprint planning, sprint review meetings, team retrospectives ─ enable your developers, data scientists and data engineers to be successful.

What you'll need:

  • 2-3 years of experience as a Product Owner for an eCommerce company.
  • Ability to manage a product which is highly connected with multiple business areas.
  • Be a very good communicator who knows how to "negotiate" with highly influencing stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of Agile / Scrum Methodologies.
  • Pro-active attitude and ability to drive product development by his/her intrinsic motivation to succeed.
  • Strategic thinking.

What we'd love you to have:

  • Experience with statistics and other data science topics such as algorithm development.
  • Basic knowledge of engineering practices.

What you can expect from life at trivago:

  • Growth: We help you grow as trivago grows through support for personal and professional development, constant new challenges, regular peer-feedback, mentorship and world-class training.
  • Autonomy: Every talent has the ability to make an impact independently by driving topics thanks to our strong entrepreneurial mindset, our horizontal workflow and self-determined working hours.
  • International environment: Our agile, international culture and environment with talents from 50+ nations encourages mutual trust and creates a safe space to discuss openly and act freely.
  • Collaborative spaces: Our state-of-the-art campus in Düsseldorf offers interactive spaces where we can easily collaborate, exchange ideas, take a break and workout together.
  • Relocation: We offer our international talents support with relocation costs, work permit and visa questions, free language classes, flat search and insurance.

Additional information:

  • trivago N.V. is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users.
  • To find out more about life at trivago follow us on social media @lifeattrivago.
  • Want to learn more about trivago's business model to prepare for your interview? Visit https://company.trivago.com/our-product/.

Do you want to join a team of entrepreneurs from over 50 different nationalities? To work in an environment powered by passion where no two days are the same?

At trivago we use the latest innovative technologies to empower our users to find their ideal hotel 100 times a second, across 55 different locales world-wide and in 33 different languages.

As a Software Engineer in the Source team, you'll shape the future of trivago's main product to help our users to find the ideal hotel. You'll join one of our agile engineering teams of smart, motivated and curious people and work on our AWS platform to deliver the best and most relevant data to our millions of users and other trivago teams by utilising modern technologies like Apache Kafka, Kinesis, Redshift, Lambda, Cloudformation and many more.

The Source team in trivago has a mission to be the single source of high quality, factual accommodation data for Hotel Search. This means you'll have an opportunity to work on such challenging topics as collecting data from various sources, matching partner data to trivago inventory, consolidating information into single source of truth and delivering it to our consumers.

Sound interesting? Then we want to hear from you!

Get an inside look into tech at trivago:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aQYEsuGOs-s

What You'll Do
  • Be a part of trivago's Source team and proactively contribute to a product that is used by millions of people each day.
  • Craft and build scalable applications for our data platform on AWS that can handle billions of events, using technologies like Apache Kafka, Redshift, EC2, Lambda, Kinesis and Hadoop.
  • Take ownership and contribute your own ideas on how to bring the best and most relevant data to our users so they can make a profound decision on their next hotel booking.
  • Work closely with stakeholders and other teams to map business requirements into technical solutions that have a real impact.
  • Be an ambassador for cloud technologies, spread the word, and share knowledge among your fellow colleagues in peer exchanges, guild meetings and meet-ups.

What You'll Need
  • 3+ years of experience in (agile) Software Engineering.
  • 2+ years' experience building AWS data pipelines using technologies like Apache Kafka, Kinesis, Lambda, Redshift, DynamoDB, SQS, and S3.
  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or (in case you're self-taught) an outstanding Github profile.
  • Experience in one of more of the following programming languages: Python (preferably), Node.js, Ruby or Java.
  • Experience working with highly scalable systems, preferably in the cloud (hands-on AWS experience would be a big plus).
  • Good knowledge of relational and NoSQL databases.
  • Fluency in English (our company language).

What We'd Love You To Have
  • An AWS certification as a developer or solutions architect.
  • Knowledge/hands-on experience in distributed systems and/or streaming data technologies.
  • A proven track record delivering complex and high-impactful tech products to a large user base.
  • The ability to present complex topics in plain English to non-technical peers and stakeholders.

What You Can Expect From Life At Trivago
  • Growth: We help you grow as trivago grows through support for personal and professional development, constant new challenges, regular peer-feedback, mentorship and world-class training.
  • Autonomy: Every talent has the ability to make an impact independently by driving topics thanks to our strong entrepreneurial mindset, our horizontal workflow and self-determined working hours.

At trivago we use the latest innovative technologies to empower our users to find their ideal hotel 100 times a second, across 55 different locales world-wide and in 33 different languages.


At trivago's Hotel Search team, our aim is to help travellers to find their ideal hotel or vacation rental. To achieve this, we process, aggregate and deliver vast amounts of data from different sources (online travel agencies, hotel chains and hoteliers) on a daily base to make sure that our users only have the best and most relevant information to make a profound decision on their next booking.




As a DevOps Engineer in Hotel Search, you will support our mission by helping us automate our infrastructure on the AWS platform, using the latest and greatest services and technologies. You will work in both hands-on engineering tasks, but also serve as technical consultant and adviser to several engineering teams to advocate the adoption of best practices in DevOps.




Ready to take the next step in your career? This position will stretch you both professionally and personally. If you think you've got what it takes, read on and apply today!




Get an inside look into tech at trivago:



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aQYEsuGOs-s




What you'll do:


  • Be part of a cross-functional team of software/data engineers, product owners and project managers that directly impacts how millions of travellers find their ideal hotel.

  • As AWS expert, you are actively involved in the ideation and planning of projects and initiatives, both team-level and "big picture".

  • Design and implement scalable CI/CD data pipelines on AWS platform, using infrastructure as a code and technologies like Apache Kafka, Glue, Aurora/RDS, CloudWatch, Lambda, Kinesis, DynamoDB, S3, Redshift, Docker etc.

  • Plan and build modern solutions for access control, security, monitoring and data-backup management in the cloud.

  • Drive innovation and exchange knowledge with teams and peers in your area.

  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or (in case you're self-taught) outstanding references and an impressive Github profile.

  • Demonstrable experience in best practices of building monitoring and security on AWS cloud.

  • Good understanding of networking: TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, NAT, VPN, VPCs etc.

  • A passion for delivering high-quality solutions that will improve productivity.

  • At least a minimal understanding of a programming or scripting language (preferably Python).

  • You speak English (our company language) fluently.




What we'd love you to have:


  • You are and AWS certified Developer, DevOps Engineer or Solutions Architect.

  • You have knowledge/hands-on experience in distributed systems, ETL, big data analytics or streaming data technologies.

  • You have a proven track record delivering complex and high-impactful tech products to a large user base.

  • You are a skilful communicator, who can positively influence the people and teams they are working with in adopting DevOps best practices.

Working Location: Bangkok, Thailand

This is a full time, permanent role in Bangkok, Thailand. Full relocation and Visa sponsorship provided.

Part of Booking Holdings (BKNG), Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online travel platform in Asia. We are looking for ambitious data scientists that would like to take part in implementing cutting edge technologies on one of the largest and quickest moving data sets worldwide.

We move fast, work on tough challenges, laugh and do that from one of the most exciting and vibrant places in the world today - Bangkok Thailand.

Agodans come from over 70 countries: It’s an incredible technical creative melting pot of talents pin-picked from all corners of the planet.

On your day-to-day work you will change the way people run their lives and help our business to grow, improve and expand to new exciting domains. Your voice will be heard, and you will be able to make a difference in a business that touches millions of users in every hour of the day!

Responsibilities

How will your day look like?
  • Build state of the art models and algorithms to support operations and business decisions.
  • Mine our big data to find actionable insights to drive ongoing improvements and fertilize new discoveries.
  • Work with developers and business owners to deliver daily results with the best quality.
  • Discover, research and harness new ideas that can make a difference.


Qualifications

The Musts
  • Open-minded quick learner with desire to explore and keep up with the latest technologies.
  • 3+ years hands on experience as a data scientist / statistician / data engineer.
  • Hands on experience and understanding of ML/AI and related software libraries.
  • Hands on experience with Deep Learning frameworks like Keras, TF, PyTorch and/or others.
  • Excellent Proficiency in SQL and languages like Python and/or Scala.
  • Independent as well as great team player.
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environment.

Great if you have them
  • MSc+ in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fields (a PhD is a major plus).
  • Experience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systems.
  • Hands on experience working with big data framework like Spark/Hadoop.
  • Experience in data science for e-commerce.

Do you have a passion for Data? Do you look through the science in data? SIXT’s Data Science team helps our customers make better mobility decisions by transforming raw data into insights that power many of the products and features available on our website. We are looking for an extraordinary Data Scientist who’s passionate about machine learning and model building to join us. Our team develops mathematical models to solve complex business problems, and our work is critical to many areas including search, sort, bidding, geography, and revenue management. As a member of our group, you will collaborate with other talented scientists to move the business forward using novel approaches and rich sources of data. If you’re seeking an opportunity to apply your love of problem solving to real-world problems in a stimulating and data-rich environment, we’d like to talk to you. The primary focus of this position is to design, prototype, and analyse models that support efforts in search and geography at SIXT. Your work will improve the experience of millions of our customers and have a direct impact on our business results. We are coding the future of mobility! SIXT stands for success, agility, ownership and an intercultural team. Apply now and join our journey and become a part of the SIXT-Family.

Come As You Are
  • You will create experiments based on exploratory analysis with our data to extract knowledge
  • You will analyze data to confirm or disprove hypotheses by the product owners
  • You will build statistical and machine learning models for prediction and segmentation and be responsible for designing and visualizing metrics, constantly looking beyond the numbers
  • You will monitor key product metrics and analyze the reasons they change. Subsequently, you will be proposing features and improvements for the business based on the insights you extract from data
  • You will present results of your work on both detailed technical and business level and assist other data scientists on designing the right data models


Do What You Love
  • As a developer and a passionate big data geek, you have at least 3 years of practical experience in data science. You have already deployed one or more models to production and you know how to maintain model-based processes
  • You have a strong background in statistics and machine learning (or related fields as e.g. information retrieval, natural language processing, computer vision, analytics, reinforcement learning, etc.) and a good knowledge of Python or at least programming languages such as R, Java, or Scala
  • You have experience working with large amounts of real data using SQL or NoSQL
  • You are the one who loves machine learning or NLP or Data mining, you quickly adapt to the domain and understand the data beneath. With the passion for numbers and figures, you are able to solve your problems using data
  • With your good communication skills, you are able to communicate and visualize your findings


Feel Good

In addition to the obligatory table football, driving simulators, and ping-pong table, our two dedicated Feel Good Managers focus on the wellbeing of our SIXT Tech colleagues. Amongst other things they will support you with your relocation, finding accommodation, visa issues and help you to organize team events, Meetups, and Townhalls. Our offices have different sizes, you will definitely find something according to your preferences. We follow no dress code. As a member of the SIXT-Family, you get attractive car rental and leasing offers as well as access to our large employee benefit portal where you find attractive offers for traveling, shopping and more. During breakfast, lunch, and dinner our high-quality restaurant offers daily changing meat, fish and vegetarian dishes, as well as a salad bar and freshly-baked pizza. Our coffee lounge for meeting and relaxing is opened the whole day. COME AS YOU ARE and DO WHAT YOU LOVE: Join our 300 IT colleagues and apply now (in English or German preferred)!

listings.position: Senior Data Scientist - Data & Machine Learning (f/m/d)
listings.description:
Delivery Herois building the next generation of online food-delivery platforms around the world.

We’re truly an international organization, with teams in over 40 countries and 80+ nationalities represented in our Berlin office alone.

DeliveryTech has played an instrumental role in the phenomenal growth of our platform.

Our Tech teams leverage a diverse stack to create cutting-edge solutions which cover the full customer experience - starting with an online search for food and ending with a delicious meal arriving at your doorstep.

If you’re a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

What’s on the menu?
  • Analyze, understand, profile and describe structured and semi-structured data form all areas of the business.
  • Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements to support modeling.
  • Research, design and implement descriptive, predictive and inferential models using artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques.
  • Collaborate with other data scientists, product specialists, and user experience teams to understand business processes, identify data and solution requirements.
  • Guide data engineers to develop well-crafted engineering solutions and design processes to ensure their efficient operation at scale.
What do you bring to the table?

Must Have
  • MS in Information Technology, Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related.
  • Proven experience (6+ years) designing and developing artificial intelligence or machine learning applications at scale.
  • Strong academic knowledge and strong hands on experience (4+ years) in data mining, applied statistics and machine learning.
  • Advanced knowledge (4+ years) of SQL, and either Python or Java.

Should Have
  • Practical knowledge (4+ years) of machine learning and data analysis tools (pyspark, MlLib, Numpy, Scikit, Pandas).
  • Experience (3+ years) in performing A/B & multivariate testing to measure impact of applied models.
  • Experience (3+ years) with cloud data exploration, analysis and reporting tools (Athena, DataStudio, Looker).
  • Experience (3+ years) with data visualization techniques and packages (matplotlib, d3, highcharts).
  • Familiarity (3+ years) using agile project management, issue tracking tools and version control systems (Jira, Pivotal, Rally, Git).

Aptitudes For Success
  • Strive in complex, fast moving environments.
  • Strong oral, written and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Able to express complex business and technical cases in a clear and didactic way.
  • Able to empathize with customers and understand the relationship between data and behaviors.
  • Curious and eager to learn and improve.

Our Toppings
  • English is our working language, but our colleagues at Delivery Hero come from every corner of the globe providing an incredibly diverse, international working atmosphere with cross-cultural teams.
  • A modern, recently refurbished office in the heart of Berlin.
  • We offer flexible working hours to fit around your personal or family life in case you have to drop off your kids at kita or perhaps you just want to come in to work a little later.
  • Great career opportunities following our development career plan.
  • Being part of a global family under the Delivery Hero umbrella, we can offer you the safety of a large company including a pension scheme and stability.
  • Moving can be stressful so to help you settle in we provide a relocation package including visa help, temporary accommodation and a budget to applicants from abroad.
  • Our building has several kitchens where you’ll find fresh fruit, cereals, juice/ drinks, tea, coffee, etc.
  • On nearly every floor you’ll find a kicker or table tennis (or a lounge, and even a nap room) for when you need to take a break.
  • Being a food-ordering company, in between playing and working hard, we provide a generous number of monthly vouchers to use for ordering food on our platforms when you get the munchies.
  • Sprichst du kein Deutsch? No worries, we provide German classes for those expats who want to expedite their integration.
  • We know that experience at the office with interesting and diverse problems, colleagues and technologies isn’t the only way to learn, so our employees get an education budget to attend conferences or trainings locally or around Europe to satisfy their pursuit of knowledge.
  • Every Friday we have a team integration, when we just stop working earlier, grab a beer and relax with colleagues.
  • Sometimes we just enjoy our times together with team events and company events.
At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and representation is key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or any other aspect that makes you, you.

Have we caught your attention? Then please send us your application including cover letter, CV, salary expectations and earliest starting date. We’re looking forward to your application!

Are you the missing ingredient?

Read about the latest updates from our Tech & Product teams on our blog .

Find our stack here .

We are currently building up our Machine Learning team in R&D Department and you can contribute to the vision of our team and support to establish and maintain data-driven approach in surgical performance.

YOUR WORK SCOPE
  • Provide expertise in field of machine vision and classification of objects in videos
  • Experiment with provided medical datasets and label data
  • Find correlation and anomalies in structured datasets
  • Work closely with Product Management for defining hypotheses
  • Discuss with partners and data providers to visualize and communicate your findings and how they can contribute to our products
  • Support to build up machine learning expertise within the company and build up technology stack for machine learning

YOUR BACKGROUND
  • Solid background and proven track record in Data Science (either in academia or industry), preferably with a focus on machine vision
  • Good software development skills (Python, R or Java) and know how to bring machine learning prototypes to production
  • High familiarity with TensorFlow or similar frameworks is a must; good knowledge of Google Cloud ML is a great advantage
  • Knowledge or experience in medical domain would be a bonus point
  • Business fluent in English; German would be a plus


Your Benefits
  • Warm-hearted, flexible, and solution-oriented culture with open feedback culture
  • Flexible working times, including part-time models, tandem positions, trust-based working times (where applicable)
  • Room to introduce and implement creative ideas and develop your talents with technical training and individualised continued education (e.g. languages DE/EN, leadership)
  • Professional and intellectual knowledge exchange with highly-talented and ambitious colleagues from all over the world
  • Work visa sponsorship and relocation assistance (where applicable)

Could this be you? Would you like to work in a highly innovative and visionary environment, where technologies are developed that help to improve and save lives? Worldwide.

Then please get in touch with us to discuss your career opportunities at caresyntax.

Our HR team takes your application and answers your questions under https://caresyntax-jobs.personio.de/job/104016?_pc=53179.

ASP.NET Developer

Based in Berlin

Visa sponsorship supported

Permanent roles


We are looking for a passionate ASP.NET developer (all seniorities) to join our R&D department in Berlin.


You will be working with an organization at the forefront of data science and research for one of the largest retailers. You will play a key role in crafting and evolving APIs, data pipelines and data algorithms that are transforming their workflow and generating new ways of planning their client’s media campaigns.


What you’ll be doing 

  • Design, develop, test, debug, monitor and maintain in-house developed software
  • Solve complex problems, propose smart solutions, spot and identify possible bugs
  • Research alternative technologies to further improve efficiency and performance


What experience and skills we are looking for


    • Develop data pipelines, APIs and algorithmic logic that integrate with large scale data sources
    • Participate in technical design discussions, providing experience in authentication, security, performance and maintainability
    • Work with a team who code in C# / .NET Core,
    • Basic level Python and TypeScript / React knowledge is an advantage
    • Devise data models and processing that is optimal for fast and reliable querying of large volumes of data
    • Work with analytical data models (OLAP / ROLAP), where prior experience is definitely beneficial
    • Write high quality, test-driven software using functional and object-oriented design principles
    • Work in a continuous delivery environment, using tools such as Kubernetes,  Google Cloud Platform, and GitHub/GitLab
    • Work in a cross-functional Agile team, alongside other developers, data scientists, product owners, designers, and testers
    • You have a good understanding of SOLID design principles
    • Work from Berlin/Germany with limited opportunities for partial remote work

     

    We don’t expect you to have direct experience in all the technologies the team uses, but you will need the proficiency and enough related experience to get up to speed quickly and provide hands-on mentoring to our developers.


Key areas of responsibility:

 

Technical excellence

  • You will be responsible for the design and implementation of technical solutions on your project, working in close collaboration with your teammates and the client.
  • You will coach and mentor others, and help evolve ways of working to support the growth of the team. For example, applying practices like BDD, DevOps and Continuous Delivery.
  • You will represent the team in our wider engineering community of practice and contribute to continuous improvement of craft.

 

Software craft

  • You will tackle complex programming problems in a clean and testable way, and ensure code is maintainable.
  • You will evaluate how different technologies, frameworks and languages can be used in order to deliver the best possible solution.
  • You will promote collective code ownership across the stack, contributing to infrastructure, application and database development.

 

Design expertise

  • You will demonstrate expertise in designing and developing high-quality, scalable services using a range of architectural styles, taking into account both functional and non-functional requirements.


What we have to offer you

  • Full-time employment in Berlin, Germany
  •  You will have the opportunity to research, propose and experiment with technologies that will be implemented in new features
  • Play a role in the migration to a new microservices architecture
  •  Introduce new solutions to scale and tune various parts of our ecosystem
  • Competitive compensation, based on your experience and expertise

If you think it’s you we’re looking for please send us your CV and cover letter in English. Feel free to include any coding examples, a link to your GitHub profile, or similar.

At Personio we are on the amazing journey of becoming the leading HR Platform in Europe!

Join our international Business Intelligence team and take an active role in shaping our culture and the future of our organization.
You will be responsible for building and improving analytical solutions to drive decision-making and generation of valuable insights for Personio and its departments. Your ideas and insights will shape Personio’s strategy as we are building Europe’s leading one-stop HR platform. If you’re passionate about delivering high quality data solutions, and enjoy a fast paced diverse working environment, Personio is the place for you!

Your tasks and responsibilities will include:

  • Being the expert and point of contact for all BI-driven reporting and analytics solutions for Sales within Personio
  • Creating and continuously improving dashboards and reportings on critical Sales-KPIs to support better decision making for further growth
  • Proactively identifying and discussing stakeholder requirements, and groom them into deliverables
  • Constructing data models that enable self-service exploration of relevant data for stakeholders
  • Disseminating self-service analytics capabilities into the Sales team and providing end-user training on visualization tools, dashboards and data models
  • Ensuring continuity for all Sales reporting solutions as sales and BI transition to new tools


Your profile

  • At least 5 years of work experience in a business intelligence, data science or other BI-related field, preferably with an emphasis on sales, ideally in B2B software environment
  • Proficiency in SQL, including experience retrieving and manipulating data, and profound skills in Python
  • Experience with constructing and maintaining ETL processes is a plus
  • Experienced in data analysis and visualisation, ideally with Sisense, Periscope or comparable data visualization tools
  • Proactive attitude in identifying and implementing solutions
  • Great communication skills, detail-orientation and high standards on data quality
  • Salesforce experience or understanding of underlying data model is a plus
  • You are business-fluent in English (Level C1/C2), German is a plus


Why Personio?

  • Market-proven, well-funded and fast growing company ($54.3M funding acquired to date)
  • Your chance to play a decisive role in shaping Personio and have a direct impact on the daily work of hundreds of thousands of users
  • 1.500 EUR of development budget per year for attending conferences, courses, buying books
  • MacBook Pro and gadgets, including BOSE headsets with noise cancellation
  • 28 paid vacation days, at least 3 days of home office per month, and flexible working hours
  • Unu electric scooter of your choice as "company car" (see www.unumotors.com) or an additional payment for a yearly public transportation ticket
  • Subsidized Qualitrain membership: For 25 euros a month you can train in 90 fitness and yoga studios, swimming pools and many other sports facilities in Munich
  • Relocation and visa support through an expert agency to Munich, Germany
  • Weekly German language courses
  • Regular team and company events (e.g. Oktoberfest in Munich and skiing trip to Austria)
  • Because joining us at an early stage shows your trust and confidence in Personio, we want you to also profit from the success of the company. Therefore, we will offer you a competitive compensation package (e.g. salary, benefits, virtual shares)

Powered by Berlin-based company builder Next Big Thing AG, Evertrace GmbH is a new startup at the intersection of supply chain and cutting-edge tech (blockchain & IoT). Our vision is to eliminate frustrating information silos and time-consuming, manual work during supply chain management; instead, we’re creating a simple and safe way to exchange data in real-time between involved parties. By providing a single platform for all participants of the logistics process - cargo owners, freight forwarders, brokers, insurers - Evertrace enables accessible data & real-time documentation.

Evertrace is seeking an experienced Java Developer to build the next generation supply chain product. In this role, you will work in an agile team and collaborate on the design, development and optimization of our platform. As one of the first employees of an IoT/Blockchain based supply-chain venture, you will have the opportunity to influence and shape processes. You’ll witness fast growth and co-write Evertrace’s success story, as well as your own.

Join our team to build a product that makes a huge difference to industry players!

These will be your tasks:
  • Design and develop our high-volume, low-latency innovative IoT platform for the supply chain, delivering high-availability and performance
  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle (requirements management with stakeholders, architecture, implementation, test automation, operation, and monitoring)
  • Write well-designed and testable software components
  • Prepare, produce and support software releases
  • Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies, and presenting these for architectural review

Some technologies you will be working with:

  • Java 9, Spring Framework, Spring Boot
  • Restful API and microservices
  • Akka/Reactor or similar, Kafka
  • RDBMS, Cassandra, Elasticsearch
  • Data processing stack (like Hadoop/Sparks/Storm)
  • AI, Machine learning
  • Docker, Kubernetes
  • AWS/Azure

You're offering these qualifications:
  • 5+ years of hands-on Java experience and a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Proven record of successfully building and optimizing scalable, cost-effective and high performing solutions
  • Real-world project experience with real-time data ingestion and processing is a must.
  • A deep interest in Blockchain & IoT technologies and data analytics & AI/Machine learning frameworks (experience is a big bonus)
  • Experience with event-driven/reactive programming
  • Experience in working on back-end integration with relational databases and NoSQL database (like Cassandra)
  • Experience working with microservices and API
  • Experience with cloud deployment and agile environments
  • Knowledge and a great interest for secure development
  • A strong sense of responsibility for the product quality and a goal-oriented working style
  • A true team-player who enjoys contributing to the overall company success
  • Fluency in English (German is not mandatory)

We're offering these benefits:
A sweet deal

  • Full-time unlimited contract
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible working hours
  • Free drinks & fruits
  • Hardware of your choice
  • Subsidized membership to a Berlin sports club with 450+ locations
  • Access to Factory Community events: lectures, social events, networking, great restaurant and café, and a ball-pit!

Work with the best

  • Join an agile, cross-functional, dedicated team
  • Take responsibility for your projects. No micromanagement.
  • Work within a flat hierarchy among international team members from 20+ countries

Recruitment agency

We do not work with recruitment agencies.

Relocation & EU work visa

We offer relocation assistance for this position regarding paperwork, visa and first steps in Germany.

listings.position: Lead Data Engineering - Based in Berlin
listings.description:
Deep Blue Recruitment are currently working with one of the most successful FinTech companies in Europe that are looking for a Lead of Data Engineering to join their team in Berlin.

You will be an integral part of the team and will have a significant impact on the future direction of the business.

These will be your tasks
  • Own our event pipeline and data lake
  • Own the team’s technical strategy in close collaboration with Product and Data analytics
  • Work with the Data Engineering team to develop and improve our Data and Analytics platform
  • Develop and deliver high-impact, forward looking, engineering roadmaps for the team
  • Develop initiatives on ensuring data quality, accuracy, and reliability across the whole data organization
  • Implement and maintain APIs and microservices to integrate heterogeneous data sources into our Data pipeline
  • Design and implement continuous integration and deployment processes
  • Liaise with Product teams in productionizing machine learning code

Requirements
  • 7+ years experience in a similar engineering portfolio
  • 3+ years experience in leading engineering teams
  • Solid understanding of handling event driven pipelines at scale
  • Strong experience in Python development
  • Experience with Scrum and agile development processes and methodologies
  • You work with Git, Continuous Integration, and TDD
  • You understand what it takes to build and support highly scalable and reliable Big Data platforms
  • University degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
  • Strong communication and written skills

Benefits
  • Get paid a competitive salary with stock options
  • Optional German language courses
  • Full support to grow and take leadership from day one
  • Work in a beautiful office building located on the riverfront
  • You have the option to take your dog to work!
  • Relocation and visa support if needed
This is a permanent position and we are looking for someone to start immediately - apply today!

Über uns

Unsere Technologien haben die Leistung in mehr als 6000 Operationssälen in über 1600 Krankenhäusern weltweit auf ein völlig neues Niveau gehoben und unterstützen OP-Teams der neuen Generation in über 10 Millionen Eingriffen pro Jahr.
Mit unseren Hauptstandorten in Berlinund Bostonarbeiten bei uns weltweit über 100 Mitarbeiter über 20 verschiedener Nationalitäten. Nachdem wir in unserer letzten Finanzierungsrunde über 10 Millionen Euro erreicht haben, suchen wir jetzt weitere, hochmotivierte Mitarbeiter, die mit uns gemeinsam das Unternehmen voran bringen möchten.

Was Du bewegen kannst
We are currently building up our Machine Learning team in R&D Department and you can contribute to the vision of our team and support to establish and maintain data-driven approach in surgical performance.
  • Provide expertise in field of machine vision and classification of objects in videos
  • Experiment with provided medical datasets and label data
  • Find correlation and anomalies in structured datasets
  • Work closely with Product Management for defining hypotheses
  • Discuss with partners and data providers to visualize and communicate your findings and how they can contribute to our products
  • Support to build up machine learning expertise within the company and build up technology stack for machine learning

Was du mitbringst

  • Solid background and proven track record in Data Science (either in academia or industry), preferably with a focus on machine vision
  • Good software development skills (Python, R or Java) and know how to bring machine learning prototypes to production
  • High familiarity with TensorFlow or similar frameworks is a must; good knowledge of Google Cloud ML is a great advantage
  • Knowledge or experience in medical domain would be a bonus point
  • Business fluent in English; German would be a plus

Was Du erwarten kannst

  • Warm-hearted, flexible, and solution-oriented culture with open feedback culture
  • Flexible working times, including part-time models, tandem positions, trust-based working times (where applicable)
  • Room to introduce and implement creative ideas and develop your talents with technical training and individualised continued education (e.g. languages DE/EN, leadership)
  • Professional and intellectual knowledge exchange with highly-talented and ambitious colleagues from all over the world
  • Work visa sponsorship and relocation assistance (where applicable)

Kontakt
Could this be you? Would you like to work in a highly innovative and visionary environment, where technologies are developed that help to improve and save lives? Worldwide.
Then please get in touch with us to discuss your career opportunities at caresyntax.
Our HR team takes your applicationand answers your questions underclick apply.
Would you like to know more about caresyntax? Find us onXing,LinkedIn,Facebook,our company website, and join our digital health community!

Berlin
Festanstellung
Date posted: Sep 30, 2019
Location: Berlin, BE, DE
Job Function: Sales & Marketing
Job Type: Permanent
Job Requisition ID: 1905

About The Unit

Product Manager (f/m/d):

A fast-growing new business unit, Digital Farming, was established in 2017 based on the belief that technology would offer transformative opportunities in driving agricultural productivity. Across our four digital hubs, we are finding the answers for farmers, constructing hardware and sensors, crunching satellite data, applying artificial intelligence, and turning research results into real-time solutions.
We’re starting by making precision farming available to every farmer by combining the latest in satellite imaging with sophisticated algorithms built on decades worth of experience in agronomy (the science of crops). At our core, we help farmers increase their harvest yield whilst using fertilizer more accurately and sustainably.
We achieved rapid growth in over a dozen different countries worldwide and are one of the fastest growing startups in agriculture globally. This is your chance to join an exciting, high growth venture and help shape the future of agriculture.

Responsibilities
  • Own the voice of our users and identify their pain points by working hands-on with researchers & designers
  • Work hands-on with user researchers, designers and engineers to implement and build user focused products
  • Create digital solutions to improve the user experience together with the multidisciplinary team
  • Lead and own the ideation, technical development, and launch of innovative products and features
  • Distill features down to what is desirable, viable and feasible
  • Participate and contribute to strategic topics such as product roadmap, go-to-market and partnerships
Profile
  • 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager or related discipline
  • A demonstrated and focused desire to build products and services that customers love
  • Experience in SaaS, commercializing products at scale, 3rd party integrations and/or networks effect are beneficial
  • Working knowledge of agile development methodologies
  • Experience in scaling complex digital products
  • An ability to think strategically and creatively
  • Superior interpersonal and communication skills
  • Ability to thrive in a highly intellectually demanding environment
  • A diligent attention to detail and strong technical intuition
  • The ability to manage time and schedules to meet deadlines and influence through persuasive written and verbal communication
Additional Information
You are
  • Collaborative and thrive on self-improvement
  • Values and results driven
  • Open to constructive feedback, both giving and receiving, in a clear and respectful manner
  • Ready to make an impact, take ownership and you execute with conviction.
  • Proactive and constructive even if things get ambiguous
Benefits
  • Work on sustainable solutions that benefit humankind and the environment
  • Very competitive remuneration and an unlimited working contract
  • Visa and relocation admin support for a smooth transition to work and live in Berlin
  • Flexible working hours, possibility to work from home and work remotely, 30 days holiday
  • Support for personal development, trainings, conferences and continuous learning
  • Commitment to using new approaches, technologies and frameworks
Contact details
Marcus Birke
Head of Product (Atfarm)
Dora Hoffmann
HR Business Partner
Apply no later than
20.10.2019
Job Segment:Agricultural, Agronomy, Sustainable Agriculture, Manager, Product Manager, Agriculture, Management, Operations

Berlin
To support our commercial growth, we are looking to hire our first Enterprise Sales Manager.

How You Can Help
  • Accompany clients through the sales funnel from initial interest to closing.
  • Independently own customer accounts and make sure to provide them with the best possible customer experience
  • Travel throughout the EU to meet prospective clients and attend industry events
  • Provide feedback back to the team from the market and potential clients.
  • Assist in defining sales processes, targets and strategic objectives
We’re Looking For Someone Who Has
  • A successful track-record in selling complex B2B software products, prefererably data/middleware, to enterprise-scale customers
  • 3+ years of experience in business development at a top tier startup, tech company or consultancy
  • Experience in a sales role with demonstrated ability to apply sales frameworks, build compelling narratives and utilize storytelling to influence.
  • Outstanding communication skills who can easily explain complex enterprise solutions in simple terms
  • Excellent project management skills, including the ability to prioritize, sequence, execute and deliver projects on time and on budget.
  • Fluency in English and German (written and spoken)
Our Team

We are a growing team with big dreams. We have come together from (nearly) all corners of the world, and combine a variety of skills and experience. Solving one of the most challenging data science issues is exciting and challenging at the same time and takes the right mindsets and motivations. This is why we value everybody’s opinion and strive for collaborative decisions We value honesty towards each other more than anything and always provide open and direct feedback.

Compensation And Perks
  • An exciting challenge at the cutting edge of policy, privacy, and technology
  • Competitive salary and performance based incentives
  • Learning budget
  • Flexible working hours and home office / remote policy
  • Support with relocation and visa, if needed

Working Location: Bangkok, Thailand

This is a full time, permanent role in Bangkok, Thailand. Full relocation and Visa sponsorship provided.

Part of Booking Holdings (BKNG), Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online travel platform in Asia. We are looking for ambitious data scientists that would like to take part in implementing cutting edge technologies on one of the largest and quickest moving data sets worldwide.

We move fast, work on tough challenges, laugh and do that from one of the most exciting and vibrant places in the world today - Bangkok Thailand.

Agodans come from over 70 countries: It’s an incredible technical creative melting pot of talents pin-picked from all corners of the planet.

On your day-to-day work you will change the way people run their lives and help our business to grow, improve and expand to new exciting domains. Your voice will be heard, and you will be able to make a difference in a business that touches millions of users in every hour of the day!

Responsibilities

How will your day look like?
  • Build state of the art models and algorithms to support operations and business decisions.
  • Mine our big data to find actionable insights to drive ongoing improvements and fertilize new discoveries.
  • Work with developers and business owners to deliver daily results with the best quality.
  • Discover, research and harness new ideas that can make a difference.


Qualifications

The Musts
  • Open-minded quick learner with desire to explore and keep up with the latest technologies.
  • 3+ years hands on experience as a data scientist / statistician / data engineer.
  • Hands on experience and understanding of ML/AI and related software libraries.
  • Hands on experience with Deep Learning frameworks like Keras, TF, PyTorch and/or others.
  • Excellent Proficiency in SQL and languages like Python and/or Scala.
  • Independent as well as great team player.
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environment.

Great if you have them
  • MSc+ in Computer Science / Operations Research / Statistics or other quantitative fields (a PhD is a major plus).
  • Experience in NLP, image processing and/or recommendation systems.
  • Hands on experience working with big data framework like Spark/Hadoop.
  • Experience in data science for e-commerce.
